Text

ï»¿INNOCENT

[Her]367-her Fancy and [His]368-his Fact

By [MARIE CORELLI]79-marie corelli

Author of " [[God]80-god 's Good Man]2673-god 's good man , "[79-marie corelli] " The Treasure of Heaven , "[79-marie corelli] Etc .

BOOK ONE : [HER]367-her FANCY

CHAPTER I

[The old by - road]369-the old by - road went rambling down into [a dell of deep green shadow]370-a dell of deep green shadow . It was a reprobate of [a road,--a vagrant of the land,--having long ago wandered out of straight and even courses]371-a road,--a vagrant of the land,--having long ago wandered out of straight and even courses and taken to meandering aimlessly into many ruts and furrows under arching trees , which in wet weather poured their weight of dripping rain upon it and made [it]369-the old by - road [little more than a mud pool]372-little more than a mud pool . Between straggling bushes of elder and hazel , blackberry and thorn , it made its solitary shambling way , so sunken into itself with long disuse that neither to the right nor to the left of [it]369-the old by - road could anything be seen of [the surrounding country]373-the surrounding country . Hidden behind the intervening foliage on either hand were [rich pastures]374-rich pastures and [ploughed fields]375-ploughed fields , but with these [the old road]376-the old road had nothing in common . There were many things better suited to [its]376-the old road nature , such as the melodious notes of the birds which made [their]377-their homes year after year amid [its]376-the old road bordering thickets , or the gathering together in springtime of thousands of primroses , whose pale , small , elfin faces peeped out from every mossy corner,--or the scent of secret violets in the grass , filling the air with the delicate sweetness of a breathing made warm by the April sun . Or when the thrill of summer drew the wild roses running quickly from [the earth]378-the earth skyward , twining their stems together in fantastic arches and tufts of deep pink and flush - white blossom , and the briony wreaths with their small bright green stars swung pendent from over - shadowing boughs like garlands for a sylvan festival . Or the thousands of tiny unassuming herbs which grew up with the growing speargrass , bringing with them pungent odours from the soil as from some deep - laid storehouse of precious spices . These choice delights were [the old by - road]369-the old by - road 's peculiar possession , and through a wild maze of beauty and fragrance it strayed on with a careless awkwardness , getting more and more involved in tangles of green,--till at last , recoiling abruptly as it were upon [its]376-the old road own steps , [it]376-the old road stopped short at the entrance to [a cleared space in front of [a farmyard]381-a farmyard]380-a cleared space in front of a farmyard . With this [the old by - road]369-the old by - road had evidently no sort of business whatever , and ended altogether , as it were , with a rough shock of surprise at finding itself in [such open quarters]383-such open quarters . No arching trees or twining brambles were here,--it was a wide , clean brick - paved place chiefly possessed by [a goodly company of promising fowls]384-a goodly company of promising fowls , and a huge cart - horse . The horse was tied to [[his]385-his manger]386-his manger in [an open shed]387-an open shed , and munched and munched with all the steadiness and goodwill of [[the sailor]388-the sailor 's wife who offended [[Macbeth]81-macbeth 's first witch]390-macbeth 's first witch]389-the sailor 's wife who offended macbeth 's first witch . Beyond [the farmyard]391-the farmyard was [the farmhouse]392-the farmhouse [itself,--a long , low , timbered building with a broad tiled roof supported by huge oaken rafters and crowned with many [gables,--a building]394-gables,--a building proudly declaring [itself]394-gables,--a building as of the days of [Elizabeth]82-elizabeth 's yeomen]393-itself,--a long , low , timbered building with a broad tiled roof supported by huge oaken rafters and crowned with many gables,--a building proudly declaring itself as of the days of elizabeth 's yeomen , and bearing about [it]394-gables,--a building the honourable marks of age and long stress of weather . [No such farmhouses]395-no such farmhouses are built nowadays , for life has become with [us]396-us less than a temporary thing,--a coin to be spent rapidly as soon as gained , too valueless for any interest upon it to be sought or desired . In olden times it was apparently not considered such cheap currency . [Men]397-men built [[their]397-men homes]398-their homes to last not only for [their]397-men own lifetime , but for the lifetime of [[their]397-men children]399-their children and [[their]397-men children 's children]400-their children 's children ; and the idea that [[their]397-men children 's children]400-their children 's children might possibly fail to appreciate the strenuousness and worth of [their]400-their children 's children labours never entered [their]400-their children 's children simple brains .

[The farmyard]391-the farmyard was terminated at [its]391-the farmyard other end by a broad stone archway , which showed as in a semi - circular frame the glint of scarlet geraniums in the distance , and in the shadow cast by this embrasure was the small unobtrusive figure of [a girl]403-a girl . [She]403-a girl stood idly watching the hens pecking at [their]397-men food and driving away [[their]397-men offspring]404-their offspring from every chance of sharing bit or sup with [them,--and]405-them,--and as [she]403-a girl noted the greedy triumph of the strong over the weak , the great over the small , [her]403-a girl brows drew together in a slight frown of something like scorn . Yet [hers]403-a girl was not a face that naturally expressed any of the unkind or harsh emotions . It was soft and delicately featured , and its rose - white tints were illumined by grave , deeply - set grey eyes that were full of wistful and questioning pathos . In stature [she]403-a girl was below the middle height and slight of build , so that [she]403-a girl seemed [a mere child]406-a mere child at first sight , with nothing particularly attractive about [her]403-a girl except , perhaps , [her]403-a girl hands . These were daintily shaped and characteristic of inbred refinement , and as they hung listlessly at [her]403-a girl sides looked scarcely less white than the white cotton frock [she]403-a girl wore . [She]403-a girl turned presently with a movement of impatience away from the sight of the fussy and quarrelsome fowls , and looking up at [the quaint gables of [the farmhouse]392-the farmhouse]407-the quaint gables of the farmhouse uttered a low , caressing call . A white dove flew down to [her]403-a girl instantly , followed by another and yet another . [She]403-a girl smiled and extended [her]403-a girl arms , and a whole flock of the birds came fluttering about [her]403-a girl in a whirl of wings , perching on [her]403-a girl shoulders and alighting at [her]403-a girl feet . One that seemed to enjoy a position of special favouritism , flew straight against [her]403-a girl breast,--she caught it and held it there . It remained with [her]403-a girl quite contentedly , while [she]403-a girl stroked its velvety neck .

" [Poor Cupid]83-cupid ! "[403-a girl] [she]403-a girl murmured . " [You]83-cupid love [me]403-a girl , do n't [you]83-cupid ? Oh yes , ever so much ! Only [you]83-cupid ca n't tell [me]403-a girl so ! [I]403-a girl 'm glad ! [You]83-cupid would n't be half so sweet if [you]83-cupid could ! "[403-a girl]

[She]403-a girl kissed the bird 's soft head , and still stroking it scattered all the others around [her]403-a girl by a slight gesture , and went , followed by a snowy cloud of [them]409-them , through the archway into [the garden beyond]410-the garden beyond . Here there were flower - beds formally cut and arranged in the old - fashioned Dutch manner , full of sweet - smelling old - fashioned things , such as stocks and lupins , verbena and mignonette,--there were box - borders and clumps of saxifrage , fuchsias , and geraniums,--and roses that grew in every possible way that roses have ever grown , or can ever grow . [The farmhouse]392-the farmhouse fronted fully on [this garden]412-this garden , and a magnificent " Glory "[413-the most highly trained hybrids] rose covered [it]392-the farmhouse from [its]392-the farmhouse deep black oaken porch to [its]392-the farmhouse highest gable , wreathing it with hundreds of pale golden balls of perfume . A real " old "[413-the most highly trained hybrids] rose it was , without any doubt of its own intrinsic worth and sweetness,--a rose before which [the most highly trained hybrids]413-the most highly trained hybrids might hang [their]413-the most highly trained hybrids heads for shame or wither away with envy , for the air around [it]392-the farmhouse was wholly perfumed with its honey - scented nectar , distilled from peaceful years upon years of sunbeams and stainless dew . [The girl]414-the girl , still carrying [her]414-the girl pet dove , walked slowly along the narrow gravelled paths that encircled the flower - beds and box - borders , till , reaching a low green door at the further end of [the garden]415-the garden , [she]414-the girl opened it and passed through into [a newly mown field]416-a newly mown field , where [several lads]417-several lads and [men]397-men were about busily employed in raking together the last swaths of a full crop of hay and adding them to the last waggon which stood in the centre of the ground , horseless , and piled to an almost toppling height . [One young fellow]419-one young fellow , with a crimson silk tie knotted about [his]419-one young fellow open shirt - collar , stood on top of the lofty fragrant load , fork in hand , tossing the additional heaps together as they were thrown up to [him]419-one young fellow . The afternoon sun blazed burningly down on [his]419-one young fellow uncovered head and bare brown arms , and as [he]419-one young fellow shook and turned the hay with untiring energy , [his]419-one young fellow movements were full of the easy grace and picturesqueness which are often the unconscious endowment of those whose labour keeps [them]420-them daily in the fresh air . Occasional bursts of laughter and scraps of rough song came from [the others at work]421-the others at work , and there was only one absolutely quiet figure among [them]421-the others at work , that of [an old man sitting on an upturned barrel which had been but recently emptied of [its]422-an old man sitting on an upturned barrel which had been but recently emptied of its home - brewed beer , meditatively smoking a long clay pipe home - brewed beer , meditatively smoking a long clay pipe]422-an old man sitting on an upturned barrel which had been but recently emptied of its home - brewed beer , meditatively smoking a long clay pipe . [He]419-one young fellow wore a smock frock and straw hat , and under the brim of the straw hat , which was well pulled down over [his]419-one young fellow forehead , [his]419-one young fellow filmy eyes gleamed with an alert watchfulness . [He]419-one young fellow seemed to be counting every morsel of hay that was being added to the load and pricing it in [his]419-one young fellow mind , but there was no actual expression of either pleasure or interest on [his]419-one young fellow features . As [the girl]414-the girl entered [the field]424-the field , and [her]414-the girl gown made a gleam of white on the grass , [he]419-one young fellow turned [his]419-one young fellow head and looked at [her]414-the girl , puffing hard at [his]419-one young fellow pipe and watching [her]414-the girl approach only a little less narrowly than [he]419-one young fellow watched the piling up of the hay . When [she]414-the girl drew sufficiently near [him]419-one young fellow [he]419-one young fellow spoke .

" Coming to ride [home]2674-home on last load ? "[419-one young fellow]

[She]414-the girl hesitated .

" [I]414-the girl do n't know . [I]414-the girl 'm not sure , "[414-the girl] [she]414-the girl answered .

" It 'll please [Robin]84-robin if [you]414-the girl do , "[419-one young fellow] [he]419-one young fellow said .

A little smile trembled on [her]414-the girl lips . [She]414-the girl bent [her]414-the girl head over the dove [she]414-the girl held against [her]414-the girl bosom .

" Why should [I]414-the girl please [Robin]84-robin ? "[414-the girl] [she]414-the girl asked .

[His]419-one young fellow dull eyes sparkled with a gleam of anger .

" Please [Robin]84-robin , please [ME]419-one young fellow , "[419-one young fellow] [he]419-one young fellow said , sharply--"Please [yourself]414-the girl , please [nobody]2675-nobody . "[419-one young fellow]

" [I]414-the girl do [my]414-the girl best to please [YOU]419-one young fellow , [Dad]85-dad ! "[414-the girl] [she]414-the girl said , gently , yet with emphasis .

[He]419-one young fellow was silent , sucking at [his]419-one young fellow pipe - stem . Just then a whistle struck the air like the near note of a thrush . It came from [the man on top of the haywaggon]425-the man on top of the haywaggon . [He]425-the man on top of the haywaggon had paused in [his]425-the man on top of the haywaggon labour , and [his]425-the man on top of the haywaggon face was turned towards [the old man]426-the old man and [the girl]414-the girl . [It]428-it was a handsome face , lighted by a smile which seemed to have caught a reflex of the sun .

" All ready , [Uncle]2676-uncle ! "[426-the old man] [he]426-the old man shouted--"Ready and waiting ! "[426-the old man]

[The old man]426-the old man drew [his]426-the old man pipe from [his]426-the old man mouth .

" There [you]414-the girl are ! "[426-the old man] [he]426-the old man said , addressing [the girl]414-the girl in a softer tone,--"He 's wanting [you]414-the girl . "[426-the old man]

[She]414-the girl moved away at once . As [she]414-the girl went , [the men who were raking in the last sweepings of the hay]431-the men who were raking in the last sweepings of the hay stood aside for [her]414-the girl to pass . [One of [them]431-the men who were raking in the last sweepings of the hay]432-one of them put a ladder against the wheel of [the waggon]433-the waggon .

" Going up , [miss]2677-miss ? "[426-the old man] [he]426-the old man asked , with a cheerful grin .

[She]414-the girl smiled a response , but said nothing .

[The young fellow on top of the load]434-the young fellow on top of the load looked down . [His]434-the young fellow on top of the load blue eyes sparkled merrily as [he]434-the young fellow on top of the load saw [her]414-the girl .

" Are [you]414-the girl coming ? "[426-the old man] [he]426-the old man called .

[She]414-the girl glanced up .

" If [you]426-the old man like , "[414-the girl] [she]414-the girl answered .

" If [I]426-the old man like ! "[426-the old man] [he]426-the old man echoed , half - mockingly , half - tenderly ; " [You]414-the girl know [I]426-the old man like ! Why , [you]414-the girl 've got that wretched bird with [you]414-the girl ! "[426-the old man]

" [He]414-the girl 's not a wretched bird , "[414-the girl] [she]414-the girl said,--"He 's [a darling]2678-a darling ! "[426-the old man]

" Well , [you]414-the girl ca n't climb up here hugging [him]414-the girl like that ! Let [him]414-the girl go,--and then [I]414-the girl 'll help [you]414-the girl . "[414-the girl]

For all answer [she]414-the girl ascended the ladder lightly without assistance , still holding the dove , and in another minute was seated beside [him]426-the old man .

" There ! "[414-the girl] [she]414-the girl said , as [she]414-the girl settled [herself]414-the girl comfortably down in the soft , sweet - smelling hay . " Now [you]426-the old man 've got [your]426-the old man wish , and [I]414-the girl hope [Dad]85-dad is happy . "[414-the girl]

" Did [he]85-dad tell [you]414-the girl to come , or did [you]414-the girl come of [your]414-the girl own accord ? "[435-the young man] asked [the young man]435-the young man , with a touch of curiosity .

" [He]85-dad told [me]414-the girl , of course , "[414-the girl] [she]414-the girl answered ; " [I]414-the girl should never have come of [my]414-the girl own accord . "[414-the girl]

[He]435-the young man bit [his]435-the young man lip vexedly . Turning away from [her]414-the girl [he]435-the young man called to [the haymakers]436-the haymakers :

" That 'll do , [boys]2679-boys ! Fetch [Roger]86-roger , and haul in ! "[435-the young man]

The sun was nearing the western horizon and a deep apricot glow warmed [the mown field]437-the mown field and the undulating foliage in the far distance . [The men]438-the men began to scatter here and there , putting aside [their]438-the men long wooden rakes , and [two of [them]438-the men]439-two of them went off to bring [Roger]86-roger , the cart - horse , from [[his]435-the young man shed]440-his shed .

" [Uncle Hugo]87-uncle hugo ! "[439-two of them]

[The old man , who still sat impassively on the beer - barrel]441-the old man , who still sat impassively on the beer - barrel , looked up .

" [Ay]88-ay ! What is it ? "[441-the old man , who still sat impassively on the beer - barrel]

[Uncle Hugo]87-uncle hugo shook [his]87-uncle hugo head despondently .

" Why not ? It 's the last load this year ! "[87-uncle hugo]

" [Ay]88-ay ! "[435-the young man] [He]435-the young man lifted [his]435-the young man straw hat and waved it in a kind of farewell salute towards [the waggon]433-the waggon , repeating mechanically : " The last load ! The very last ! "[435-the young man]

Then there came a cessation of movement everywhere for the moment . It was a kind of breathing pause in [Nature]89-nature 's everlasting chorus,--a sudden rest , as it seemed , in the very spaces of the air . [The young man]435-the young man threw [himself]435-the young man down on the hay - load so that [he]435-the young man faced [the girl , who sat quiet]444-the girl , who sat quiet , caressing the dove [she]444-the girl , who sat quiet held . [He]435-the young man was undeniably good - looking , with an open nobility of feature which is uncommon enough among [well - born and carefully - nurtured specimens of the human race]445-well - born and carefully - nurtured specimens of the human race , and is perhaps still more rarely to be found among [those whose lot in life is one of continuous hard manual labour]446-those whose lot in life is one of continuous hard manual labour . There 's no animals on [earth]2738-earth as ever thirsty as [men]397-men ! Well , good luck t'ye ! [I]103-priscilla must go , or there 'll be a smell of burnin ' supper - cakes . "[103-priscilla]

[She]103-priscilla settled [her]103-priscilla sunbonnet anew and trotted away,--looking rather like a large spotted mushroom mysteriously set in motion and rolling , rather than walking , off [the field]424-the field .

When [she]103-priscilla was gone , [Innocent]152-innocent sat down again upon the hay , this time without [Cupid]83-cupid . [He]469-he had flown off to join [[his]469-he mates]470-his mates on [the farmhouse gables]471-the farmhouse gables .

" [Dad]85-dad is really not well , "[103-priscilla] [she]103-priscilla said , thoughtfully ; " [I]103-priscilla feel anxious about [him]85-dad . If [he]85-dad were to die,-- "[103-priscilla] At the mere thought [her]103-priscilla eyes filled with tears . " [He]85-dad must die some day , "[84-robin] answered [Robin]84-robin , gently,--"and [he]85-dad 's old,--nigh on eighty . "[84-robin]

" Oh , [I]103-priscilla do n't want to remember that , "[103-priscilla] [she]103-priscilla murmured . " It 's the cruellest part of life -- that [people]2701-people should grow old , and die , and pass away from [us]2741-us . What should [I]103-priscilla do without [Dad]85-dad ? [I]103-priscilla should be all alone , with [no one]2691-no one in [the world]2693-the world to care what becomes of [me]103-priscilla . "[103-priscilla]

" _ [I]84-robin _ care ! "[84-robin] [he]84-robin said , softly .

" Yes , [you]84-robin care -- just now"--she[84-robin] answered , with a sigh ; " and it 's very kind of [you]84-robin . [I]84-robin wish [I]84-robin could care -- in the way [you]84-robin want [me]84-robin to -- but-- "[84-robin]

" Will [you]84-robin try ? "[84-robin] [he]84-robin pleaded .

" [I]472-i do try -- really [I]472-i do try hard , "[472-i] [she]472-i said , with quite a piteous earnestness,--"but [I]472-i ca n't feel what is n't HERE,"--and[472-i] [she]472-i pressed both hands on [her]472-i breast--"I care more for [Roger]86-roger the horse , and [Cupid]83-cupid the dove , than [I]472-i do for [you]84-robin ! It 's quite awful of [me]472-i -- but there it is ! [I]472-i love -- [I]472-i simply adore"--and[472-i] [she]472-i threw out [her]472-i arms with an embracing gesture--"all the trees and plants and birds!--and everything about [the farm]2744-the farm and [the farmhouse]392-the farmhouse itself -- it 's just [the sweetest home in [the world]2693-the world]2746-the sweetest home in the world ! There 's not a brick or a stone in [it]392-the farmhouse that [I]472-i would not want to kiss if [I]472-i had to leave [it]392-the farmhouse -- but [I]472-i never felt that way for [you]84-robin ! And yet [I]472-i like [you]84-robin very , very much , [Robin!--I]108-robin!--i wish [I]472-i could see [you]84-robin married to [some nice girl]2748-some nice girl , only [I]472-i do n't know one really nice enough . "[472-i]

" Nor do [I]473-i ! "[473-i] [he]473-i answered , with a laugh , " except [yourself]84-robin ! But never mind , [dear!--we]2749-dear!--we wo n't talk of it any more , just now at any rate . [I]473-i 'm [a patient sort of chap]2750-a patient sort of chap . [I]473-i can wait ! "[473-i]

" How long ? "[474-she] [she]474-she queried , with a wondering glance .

" All [my]473-i life ! "[473-i] [he]473-i answered , simply .

A silence fell between [them]475-them . Some inward touch of embarrassment troubled [the girl]414-the girl , for the colour came and went flatteringly in [her]414-the girl soft cheeks and [her]414-the girl eyes drooped under [his]473-i fervent gaze . The glowing light of the sky deepened , and the sun began to sink in a mist of bright orange , which was reflected over all the visible landscape with a warm and vivid glory . That strange sense of beauty and mystery which thrills the air with the approach of evening , made all the simple pastoral scene a dream of incommunicable loveliness,--and [the two youthful figures]477-the two youthful figures , throned on [their]477-the two youthful figures high dais of golden - green hay , might have passed for the rustic [Adam]109-adam and Eve of [some newly created Eden]478-some newly created eden . [They]475-them were both very quiet,--with the tense quietness of hearts that are too full for speech . A joy in the present was shadowed with a dim unconscious fear of the future in both [their]475-them thoughts,--though neither of [them]475-them would have expressed [their]475-them feelings in this regard one to the other . A thrush warbled in a hedge close by , and [the doves on [the farmhouse gables]471-the farmhouse gables]479-the doves on the farmhouse gables spread [their]479-the doves on the farmhouse gables white wings to the late sunlight , cooing amorously . And again [the man]481-the man spoke , with a gentle firmness :

" All [my]481-the man life [I]481-the man shall love [you]152-innocent , [Innocent]152-innocent ! Whatever happens , remember that ! All [my]481-the man life ! "[481-the man]

CHAPTER II

The swinging open of a great gate at the further end of [the field]424-the field disturbed the momentary silence which followed [his]481-the man words . [The returning haymakers]483-the returning haymakers appeared on the scene , leading [Roger]86-roger at [their]483-the returning haymakers head , and [Innocent]152-innocent jumped up eagerly , glad of the interruption .

" Here comes [old Roger]86-roger ! "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent cried,--"bless [his]86-roger heart ! Now , [Robin]84-robin , [you]84-robin must try to look very stately ! Are [you]84-robin going to ride [home]2674-home standing or sitting ? "[481-the man]

[He]481-the man was visibly annoyed at [her]152-innocent light indifference .

" Unless [I]481-the man may sit beside [you]152-innocent with [my]481-the man arm round [your]152-innocent waist , in the Pettigrew fashion , [I]481-the man 'd rather stand ! "[481-the man] [he]481-the man retorted . " [You]152-innocent said [Pettigrew]93-mrs. pettigrew 's hands were always dirty -- so are [mine]152-innocent . [I]481-the man 'd better keep [my]481-the man distance from [you]84-robin . [One]2752-one ca n't make hay and remain altogether as clean as a new pin ! "[481-the man]

[She]152-innocent gave an impatient gesture .

" [You]481-the man always take things up in the wrong way , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said--"I never thought [you]481-the man a bit like [Pettigrew]93-mrs. pettigrew ! [Your]481-the man hands are not really dirty ! "[481-the man]

" They are ! "[481-the man] [he]481-the man answered , obstinately . " Besides , [you]481-the man do n't want [my]481-the man arm round [your]481-the man waist , do [you]481-the man ? "[481-the man]

" Certainly not ! "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent replied , quickly .

" Then [I]481-the man 'll stand , "[481-the man] [he]481-the man said;--"You shall be enthroned like [a queen]2753-a queen and [I]481-the man 'll be [[your]481-the man bodyguard]2754-your bodyguard . Here , wait a minute ! "[481-the man]

[He]481-the man piled up the hay in the middle of the load till it made a high cushion where , in obedience to [his]481-the man gesture , [Innocent]152-innocent seated [herself]152-innocent . [The men leading the horse]484-the men leading the horse were now close about the waggon , and [one of [them]484-the men leading the horse]432-one of them , grinning sheepishly at [the girl]414-the girl , offered [her]414-the girl a daintily - made wreath of wild roses , from which all the thorns had been carefully removed .

" Looks prutty , do n't it ? "[481-the man] [he]481-the man said .

[She]414-the girl accepted it with a smile .

" Is it for [me]414-the girl ? Oh , [Larry]110-larry , how nice of [you]110-larry ! Am [I]414-the girl to wear it ? "[414-the girl]

" If [ye]110-larry loike ! "[481-the man] This with another grin .

[She]414-the girl set it on [her]414-the girl uncovered head and became at once a model for [a Romney]487-a romney ; the wild roses with their delicate pink and white against [her]414-the girl brown hair suited the hues of [her]414-the girl complexion and the tender grey of [her]414-the girl eyes;--and when , thus adorned , [she]414-the girl looked up at [[her]414-the girl companion]488-her companion , [he]481-the man was fain to turn away quickly lest [his]481-the man admiration should be too plainly made manifest before [profane witnesses]489-profane witnesses .

[Roger]86-roger , meanwhile , was being harnessed to the waggon . [He]86-roger was [a handsome creature of [his]86-roger kind]490-a handsome creature of his kind , and [he]86-roger knew it . As [he]86-roger turned [his]86-roger bright soft glance from side to side with a conscious pride in [himself]86-roger and [his]86-roger surroundings , [he]86-roger seemed to be perfectly aware that the knots of bright red ribbon tied in [his]86-roger long and heavy mane meant some sort of festival . When all was done [the haymakers]436-the haymakers gathered round .

" Good luck to [the last load]2755-the last load , [Mr. Clifford]111-mr. clifford ! "[436-the haymakers] [they]436-the haymakers shouted .

" Good luck to [[you]436-the haymakers all]2756-you all ! "[84-robin] answered [Robin]84-robin , cheerily .

" Good luck t'ye , [Miss]2677-miss ! "[436-the haymakers] and [they]436-the haymakers raised [their]436-the haymakers sun - browned faces to [the girl]414-the girl as [she]414-the girl looked down upon [them]436-the haymakers . " As fine a crop and as fair a load next year ! "[436-the haymakers]

" Good luck to [you]111-mr. clifford ! "[414-the girl] [she]414-the girl responded -- then suddenly bending a little forward [she]414-the girl said almost breathlessly : " Please wish luck to [Dad]85-dad ! [He]85-dad 's not well -- and [he]85-dad is n't here ! Oh , please do n't forget [him]85-dad ! "[414-the girl]

[They]436-the haymakers all stared at [her]414-the girl for a moment , as if startled or surprised , then [they]436-the haymakers all joined in a stentorian shout .

" That 's right , [Miss]2758-miss ! Good luck to [the master]2759-the master ! Many good years of life to [him]85-dad , and better crops every year ! "[436-the haymakers]

[She]414-the girl drew back , smiling [her]414-the girl thanks , but there were tears in [her]414-the girl eyes . And then [they]436-the haymakers all started in a pretty procession -- [the men leading [Roger]86-roger , who paced along [the meadow]494-the meadow with equine dignity , shaking [his]86-roger ribbons now and again as if [he]86-roger were fully conscious of carrying something more valuable than mere hay,--and above [them]436-the haymakers all]493-the men leading roger , who paced along the meadow with equine dignity , shaking his ribbons now and again as if he were fully conscious of carrying something more valuable than mere hay,--and above them all smiled [the girl]414-the girl 's young face , framed in its soft brown hair and crowned with the wild roses , while at [her]414-the girl side stood [the very type of a model Englishman]496-the very type of a model englishman , with all the promise of splendid life and vigour in the build of [his]86-roger form , the set of [his]86-roger shoulders and the poise of [his]86-roger handsome head . It was a picture of youth and beauty and lovely nature set against the warm evening tint of the sky,--one of those pictures which , though drawn for the moment only on the minds of [those who see it]497-those who see it , is yet never forgotten .

Arriving presently at a vast enclosure , in which already two loads of hay were being stacked , [they]436-the haymakers were hailed with a cheery shout by [several other labourers at work]498-several other labourers at work , and very soon a strong smell of beer began to mingle with the odour of the hay and the dewy scent of the elder flowers and sweet briar in the hedges close by .

" Have a drop , [Mr. Clifford]111-mr. clifford ! "[499-one tall , powerful - looking man who seemed to be a leader among the others] said [one tall , powerful - looking man who seemed to be a leader among [the others]500-the others]499-one tall , powerful - looking man who seemed to be a leader among the others , holding out a pewter tankard full and frothing over .

[Robin Clifford]84-robin smiled and put [his]84-robin lips to it .

" Just to [your]84-robin health , [Landon]112-landon ! "[86-roger] [he]86-roger said--"I'm not [a drinking man]2760-a drinking man . "[499-one tall , powerful - looking man who seemed to be a leader among the others]

" Haymaking 's thirsty work , "[501-the other] commented [the other]501-the other . " Will [Miss Jocelyn]113-jocelyn do [us]504-us the honour ? "[501-the other]

[The girl]414-the girl made a wry little face .

" [I]503-i do n't like beer , [Mr. Landon]114-mr. landon , "[503-i] [she]503-i said--"It 's horrid stuff , even when it 's [home]2674-home - brewed ! [I]501-the other help to make it , [you]114-mr. landon see ! "[501-the other]

[She]414-the girl laughed gaily -- [they]504-us all laughed with [her]414-the girl , and then there was a little altercation which ended in [her]414-the girl putting [her]414-the girl lips to the tankard just offered to [Robin]84-robin and sipping the merest fleck of its foam . [Landon]112-landon watched [her,--and]505-her,--and as [she]414-the girl returned the cup , put [his]112-landon own mouth to the place [hers]414-the girl had touched and drank the whole draught off greedily . [Robin]84-robin did not see [his]112-landon action , but [the girl]414-the girl did , and a deep blush of offence suffused [her]414-the girl cheeks . [She]414-the girl rose , a little nervously .

" [I]414-the girl 'll go in now , "[414-the girl] [she]414-the girl said--"Dad must be alone by this time . "[414-the girl]

" All right ! "[84-robin] And [Robin]84-robin jumped lightly from the top of the load to the ground and put the ladder up for [her]414-the girl to descend . [She]414-the girl came down daintily , turning [her]414-the girl back to [him]112-landon so that the hem of [her]414-the girl neat white skirt fell like a little snowflake over each rung of the ladder , veiling not only [her]414-the girl slim ankles but the very heels of [her]414-the girl shoes . " There [you]414-the girl are ! "[112-landon] [he]112-landon said , with a laugh--"When [you]414-the girl get into [the house]2762-the house [you]414-the girl can tell [Uncle]2763-uncle that [you]414-the girl are [a Rose Queen]2764-a rose queen , [a Hay Queen]2765-a hay queen , and Queen of everything and [everyone on [Briar Farm]4-briar farm]2766-everyone on briar farm , including [[your]414-the girl very humble servant]2767-your very humble servant , [Robin Clifford]84-robin ! "[112-landon]

"[112-landon]

With [her]152-innocent disappearance came a brief pause among [the men]438-the men . Then [Robin]84-robin , turning away from [Landon]112-landon , proceeded to give various orders . [He]112-landon was [a person in authority]510-a person in authority , and as [everyone]511-everyone knew , was likely to be [the owner of [the farm]2744-the farm when [[his]112-landon uncle]514-his uncle was dead]512-the owner of the farm when his uncle was dead . [Landon]112-landon went close up to [him]112-landon .

" [Mr. Clifford]111-mr. clifford , "[112-landon] [he]112-landon said , somewhat thickly , " [you]111-mr. clifford heard what [I]112-landon said just now ? [Clifford]84-robin glanced [him]112-landon up and down .

" [Yourself]111-mr. clifford , [I]84-robin suppose ? "[84-robin] [he]84-robin retorted .

" And why not ? "[112-landon] sneered [Landon]112-landon .

" Only because there are two sides to every question , "[84-robin] said [Clifford]84-robin , carelessly , with a laugh . " And no decision can be arrived at till both are heard ! "[84-robin]

[He]84-robin climbed up among [the other men]515-the other men and set to work , stacking steadily , and singing in a fine soft baritone the old fifteenth - century song :

" [Yonder]115-yonder comes [a courteous knight , Lustily raking over the hay]2772-a courteous knight , lustily raking over the hay , [He]84-robin was well aware of [a bonny lass]2773-a bonny lass , As [she]2773-a bonny lass came wandering over the way . Then [she]2773-a bonny lass sang Downe a downe , hey downe derry ! "[84-robin]

[Landon]112-landon looked up at [him]84-robin with a dark smile .

" Those laugh best who laugh last ! "[112-landon] [he]112-landon muttered , " And a whistling throstle has had its neck wrung before now ! "[112-landon]

Meanwhile [Innocent]152-innocent had entered [the farmhouse]392-the farmhouse . [She]152-innocent found [that personage]521-that personage rolling out pastry and talking volubly as [she]152-innocent rolled :

" Ah ! [YOU'LL]2777-you'll never come to much good , [Jenny Spinner]116-jenny , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent cried . " What with a muck of dirty dishes in one corner and a muddle of ragged clouts in another , [you]116-jenny 're [the very model of [a wife for [a farm hand]2780-a farm hand]2779-a wife for a farm hand]2778-the very model of a wife for a farm hand ! Well ! [God]80-god ' elp [ye]116-jenny when [the man]481-the man comes as [ye're]116-jenny lookin ' for ! [He]481-the man 'll be [a fool]2783-a fool anyhow , for [all men]2784-all men are that,--but [he]481-the man 'll be twice [a fool]2783-a fool if [he]481-the man takes [you]116-jenny for a life - satchel on [his]481-the man shoulders ! "[152-innocent]

[Jenny Spinner]116-jenny endured this tirade patiently , and went on with the washing - up in which [she]116-jenny was engaged , only turning [her]116-jenny head to look at [Innocent]152-innocent as [she]116-jenny appeared suddenly in the [kitchen]522-kitchen doorway , with [her]116-jenny hair slightly dishevelled and the wreath of wild roses crowning [her]116-jenny brows .

" [Priscilla]103-priscilla , where 's [Dad]85-dad ? "[116-jenny] [she]116-jenny asked .

" [Lord]2786-lord save [us]2787-us , [lovey]2788-lovey ! " Was it -- was it all right , do [you]2788-lovey think ? "[414-the girl] asked [the girl]414-the girl , hesitatingly .

"[116-jenny]

[Innocent]152-innocent hardly waited to hear [her]152-innocent last words .

" [I]152-innocent 'm going to [Dad]85-dad , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said , quickly , and disappeared .

[Priscilla Friday]103-priscilla stopped for a minute in the rolling - cut of [her]103-priscilla pastry . Some great stress of thought appeared to be working behind [her]103-priscilla wrinkled brow , for [she]103-priscilla shook [her]103-priscilla head , pursed [her]103-priscilla lips and rolled up [her]103-priscilla eyes a great many times . Then [she]103-priscilla gave a short sigh and went on with [her]103-priscilla work .

[The farmhouse]392-the farmhouse was [a rambling old place]525-a rambling old place , full of [quaint corners]526-quaint corners , arches and odd little steps up and down leading to cupboards , mysterious recesses and devious winding ways which turned into [dark narrow passages]527-dark narrow passages , branching right and left through [the whole breadth of [the house]2762-the house]528-the whole breadth of the house . It was along one of these that [Innocent]152-innocent ran swiftly on leaving [the kitchen]518-the kitchen , till [she]152-innocent reached a closed door , where pausing , [she]152-innocent listened a moment - then , hearing no sound , opened it and went softly in . [The room]531-the room [she]152-innocent entered was filled with soft shadows of the gradually falling dusk , yet partially lit by a golden flame of the after - glow which shone through the open latticed window from the western sky . Close to the waning light sat [the master of [the farm]2744-the farm]532-the master of the farm , still clad in [his]532-the master of the farm smock frock , with [his]532-the master of the farm straw hat on the table beside [him]532-the master of the farm and [his]532-the master of the farm stick leaning against the arm of [his]532-the master of the farm chair . [He]532-the master of the farm was very quiet,--so quiet , that a late beam of the sun , touching the rough silver white of [his]532-the master of the farm hair , seemed almost obtrusive , as suggesting an interruption to the moveless peace of [his]532-the master of the farm attitude . [Innocent]152-innocent stopped short , with a tremor of nervous fear .

" [Dad]85-dad ! "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said , softly .

[He]532-the master of the farm turned towards [her]152-innocent .

" Ay , [lass]2727-lass ! What is it ? "[532-the master of the farm]

[She]152-innocent did not answer , but came up and knelt down beside [him]532-the master of the farm , taking one of [his]532-the master of the farm brown wrinkled hands in [her]152-innocent own and caressing it . The silence between [them]534-them was unbroken for quite two or three minutes ; then [he]532-the master of the farm said :

" Last load in all safe ? "[532-the master of the farm]

" Yes , [Dad]85-dad ! "[532-the master of the farm]

" Not a drop of rain to wet it , and no hard words to toughen it , eh ? "[532-the master of the farm]

" No , [Dad]85-dad . "[532-the master of the farm]

[She]152-innocent gave the answer a little hesitatingly . [She]152-innocent was thinking of [Ned Landon]112-landon . [He]532-the master of the farm caught the slight falter in [her]152-innocent voice and looked at [her]152-innocent suspiciously .

" Been quarrelling with [Robin]84-robin ? "[532-the master of the farm]

" [Dear Dad]85-dad , no ! [We]534-them 're [the best of friends]2800-the best of friends . "[532-the master of the farm]

[He]532-the master of the farm loosened [his]532-the master of the farm hand from [her]152-innocent clasp and patted [her]152-innocent head with it .

[She]152-innocent was silent . The after - glow warmed the tints of [her]152-innocent hair to russet - gold and turned to a deeper pink the petals of the roses in the wreath [she]152-innocent wore . [He]532-the master of the farm touched the blossoms and spoke with great gentleness .

[She]152-innocent looked up , smiling .

Another pause ensued , and the western gold of the sky began to fade into misty grey .

" [Dad]85-dad , "[414-the girl] said [the girl]414-the girl then , in a low tone--"Do tell [me]414-the girl -- what did [the London doctor]2806-the london doctor say ? "[414-the girl]

[His]536-his speech faltered . [He]536-his turned and looked out on [the garden]415-the garden , full of luxuriant blossom , the colours of which were gradually merging into indistinguishable masses under the darkening grey of the dusk .

[She]414-the girl moved softly about [the room]531-the room , setting things straight , and lighting two candles in a pair of tall brass candlesticks which stood one on either side of a carved oak press . [The room thus illumined]540-the room thus illumined showed [itself]531-the room to be [a roughly - timbered apartment in the style of the earliest Tudor times]541-a roughly - timbered apartment in the style of the earliest tudor times , and all the furniture in [it]531-the room was of the same period . The thick gate - legged table -- the curious chairs , picturesque , but uncomfortable -- the two old dower chests -- the quaint three - legged stools and upright settles , were a collection that would have been precious to [the art dealer]542-the art dealer and [curio hunter]543-curio hunter , as would the massive eight - day clock with its grotesquely painted face , delineating not only the hours and days but the lunar months , and possessing a sonorous chime which just now struck eight with a boom as deep as that of a cathedral bell . The sound appeared to startle [the old farmer]544-the old farmer with a kind of shock , for [he]536-his rose from [his]536-his chair and grasped [his]536-his stick , looking about [him]536-his as though for the moment uncertain of [his]536-his bearings .

" How fast the hours go by ! "[536-his] [he]536-his muttered , dreamily . " When [we]2827-we 're young [they]2828-they do n't count -- but when [we]2827-we 're old [we]2827-we know that every hour brings [us]2827-we nearer to the end - the end , the end of all ! Another night closing in -- and the last load cleared from [the field]424-the field -- [Innocent]152-innocent ! "[536-his]

The name broke from [his]536-his lips like a cry of suffering , and [she]545-she ran to [him]536-his trembling .

" [Dad]85-dad , [dear]2830-dear , what is it ? "[545-she]

Here the door opened , admitting a flood of cheerful light from [the outside passage]546-the outside passage , and [Robin Clifford]84-robin entered .

" [Hullo]104-hullo , [Uncle]2833-uncle ! Supper 's ready ! "[84-robin]

[The old man]426-the old man 's face changed instantly . [Its]548-its worn and scared expression smoothed into a smile , and , loosening [his]536-his hold of [Innocent]152-innocent , [he]536-his straightened [himself]536-his and stood erect .

" More work 's done on water after all , "[113-jocelyn] said [Jocelyn]113-jocelyn . " The horses that draw for [us]2835-we and the cattle that make food for [us]2835-we prove that . "[84-robin]

[He]84-robin seemed to have suddenly lost all feebleness , and walked with a firm step into what [he]84-robin called [the Great Hall]550-the great hall , which was distinguished by this name from [the lesser or entrance hall of [the house]2762-the house]551-the lesser or entrance hall of the house . [It]550-the great hall was [a nobly proportioned , very lofty apartment]553-a nobly proportioned , very lofty apartment , richly timbered , the roof being supported by huge arched beams curiously and intricately carved . Long narrow boards on stout old trestles occupied the centre , and these were spread with cloths of coarse but spotlessly clean linen and furnished with antique plates , tankards and other vessels of pewter which would have sold for a far larger sum in the market than solid silver . A tall carved chair was set at the head of the largest table , and in this [Farmer Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn seated [himself]120-farmer jocelyn . [The men]438-the men now began to come in from [the fields]2706-the fields in [their]438-the men work - a - day clothes , escorted by [Ned Landon]112-landon , [their]438-the men only attempt at a toilet having been a wash and brush up in [the outhouses]556-the outhouses ; and soon [the hall]517-the hall presented a scene of lively bustle and activity . [Priscilla]103-priscilla , entering [it]517-the hall from [the kitchen]518-the kitchen with [[her]103-priscilla two assistants]559-her two assistants , brought in three huge smoking joints on enormous pewter dishes,--then followed other good things of all sorts,--vegetables , puddings , pasties , cakes and fruit , which [Innocent]152-innocent helped to set out all along the boards in tempting array . It was a generous supper fit for a " Harvest Home"--yet[120-farmer jocelyn] it was only [Farmer Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn 's ordinary way of celebrating the end of the haymaking,--the real harvest [home]2674-home was another and bigger festival yet to come . [Robin Clifford]84-robin began to carve a sirloin of [beef,--Ned Landon]112-landon , who was nearly opposite [him]84-robin , actively apportioned slices of roast pork , the delicacy most favoured by [the majority]561-the majority , and when all the knives and forks were going and voices began to be loud and tongues discursive , [Innocent]152-innocent slipped into a chair by [Farmer Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn and sat between [him]84-robin and [Priscilla]103-priscilla . For not only [the farm hands]562-the farm hands but all [the servants on the place]563-the servants on the place were at table , this haymaking supper being the annual order of [the household]564-the household . [The girl]414-the girl 's small delicate head , with its coronal of wild roses , looked strange and incongruous among the rough specimens of manhood about [her]414-the girl , and sometimes as the laughter became boisterous , or some bucolic witticism caught [her]414-the girl ear , a faint flush coloured the paleness of [her]414-the girl cheeks and a little nervous tremor ran through [her]414-the girl frame . [She]414-the girl drew as closely as [she]414-the girl could to [the old farmer , who sat rigidly upright and quiet , eating nothing but a morsel of bread with a bowl of hot salted milk [Priscilla]103-priscilla had put before [him]566-the old farmer , who sat rigidly upright and quiet , eating nothing but a morsel of bread with a bowl of hot salted milk priscilla had put before him]566-the old farmer , who sat rigidly upright and quiet , eating nothing but a morsel of bread with a bowl of hot salted milk priscilla had put before him . Beer was served freely , and was passed from [man]567-man to [man]567-man in leather " blackjacks "[567-man] such as were commonly used in olden times , but which are now considered mere curiosities . They were , however , ordinary wear at [Briar Farm]4-briar farm , and had been so since very early days . [The Great Hall]550-the great hall was lighted by tall windows reaching almost to the roof and traversed with shafts of solid stonework ; [the one immediately opposite [Farmer Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn 's chair]570-the one immediately opposite farmer jocelyn 's chair showed the very last parting glow of the sunset like a dull red gleam on [a dark sea]571-a dark sea . For the rest , thick home - made candles of a torch shape fixed into iron sconces round the walls illumined [the room]531-the room , and burned with unsteady flare , giving rise to curious lights and shadows as though ghostly figures were passing to and fro , ruffling the air with [their]573-their unseen presences . [Priscilla Priday]121-priscilla , [her]121-priscilla wizened yellow face just now reddened to the tint of a winter apple by [her]121-priscilla recent exertions in [the kitchen]518-the kitchen , was not so much engaged in eating [her]121-priscilla supper as in watching [[her]121-priscilla master]575-her master . Meanwhile the noise at the supper table grew louder and more incessant , and sundry deep potations of home - brewed ale began to do [their]581-their work . [One man]582-one man , seated near [Ned Landon]112-landon , was holding forth in very slow thick accents on the subject of education :

" Be eddicated ! "[582-one man] [he]582-one man said , articulating [his]582-one man words with difficulty,--"That 's what [I]582-one man says , [boys]2679-boys ! Be eddicated ! " And learn to despise [[his]582-one man father]2848-his father ! "[84-robin] said [Robin]84-robin , suddenly , [his]84-robin clear voice ringing out above the other 's husky loquacity . " [You]582-one man 're right ! That 's the best way to train [a boy]2850-a boy in the way [he]2850-a boy should go ! "[84-robin]

There was a brief silence . Then came a fresh murmur of voices and [Ned Landon]112-landon 's voice rose above [them]583-them .

" [I]112-landon do n't agree with [you]582-one man , [Mr. Clifford]111-mr. clifford , "[112-landon] [he]112-landon said--"There 's no reason why [a well - educated lad]2851-a well - educated lad should despise [[his]2851-a well - educated lad father]2848-his father . "[84-robin]

" But [he]112-landon often does , "[112-landon] said [Robin--"reason]123-robin--"reason or no reason . "[84-robin]

" What 's that done for [me]84-robin ? "[84-robin] demanded [Robin]84-robin , carelessly,--"Where has it put [me]84-robin ? Just nowhere , but exactly where [I]84-robin might have stood all the time . [I]84-robin did n't learn farming at [Oxford]6-oxford ! "[84-robin]

" [[My]84-robin father]2856-my father 's dead , "[84-robin] answered [Robin]84-robin , curtly,--"and [I]84-robin honour [his]2856-my father memory . "[84-robin]

" So [your]84-robin own argument goes to the wall ! "[112-landon] said [Landon]112-landon . " Education has not made [you]84-robin think less of [him]2856-my father . "[112-landon]

[The man who knows how to plough a field rightly]2857-the man who knows how to plough a field rightly is as usefully educated as [the man who knows how to read a book]2858-the man who knows how to read a book , in [my]112-landon opinion . "[112-landon]

" Education , "[84-robin] interposed a strong voice , " is first to learn [one]2752-one 's place in [the world]2693-the world and then know how to keep it ! "[84-robin]

All eyes turned towards the head of the table . It was [Farmer Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn who spoke , and [he]84-robin went on speaking :

" What 's called education nowadays , "[84-robin] [he]84-robin said , " is a mere smattering and does no good . A roar of laughter went round the table .

" [Danvers]125-danvers ! "[586-a huge red - faced fellow at the other end of the] exclaimed [a huge red - faced fellow at the other end of the]586-a huge red - faced fellow at the other end of the board,--"Why [he]125-danvers talks [yer]84-robin ' ead off about what [he]125-danvers 's picked up here and there like , and when [I]586-a huge red - faced fellow at the other end of the asked [him]125-danvers to tell [me]586-a huge red - faced fellow at the other end of the where [[my]586-a huge red - faced fellow at the other end of the son]2868-my son is as went to [Mexico]7-mexico , blowed if [he]125-danvers did n't say it was [[a town]2869-a town somewheres near [New York]8-new york]2870-a town somewheres near new york ! "[586-a huge red - faced fellow at the other end of the]

Another roar went round the table . [Farmer Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn smiled and held up [his]587-i hand to enjoin silence .

" [Mr. Danvers]125-danvers is [a teacher selected by [the Government]2872-the government]2871-a teacher selected by the government , "[587-i] [he]587-i then observed , with mock gravity . " And if [he]125-danvers teaches [us]588-we that [Mexico]7-mexico is [a town near [New York]8-new york]2873-a town near new york , [we]588-we [poor ignorant farm - folk]2874-poor ignorant farm - folk are bound to believe [him]125-danvers ! "[587-i]

[They]588-we all laughed again , and [he]587-i continued :

" [I]587-i 'm old enough , [boys]2679-boys , to have seen many changes , and [I]587-i tell [you]2679-boys , all things considered , that the worst change is the education business , so far as the strength and the health of [the country]2876-the country goes . That , and machine work . When [I]587-i was [a youngster]2877-a youngster , nearly [every field - hand]2878-every field - hand knew how to mow,--now [we]588-we 've trouble enough to find [an extra man who can use a scythe]2879-an extra man who can use a scythe . And [you]2679-boys may put a machine on the grass as much as [you]2679-boys like , [you]2679-boys 'll never get the quality that [you]2679-boys 'll get with a well - curved blade and [a man]2681-a man 's arm and hand wielding it . Longer work maybe , and risk of rain -- but , taking the odds for and against , [men]397-men are better than machines . Forty years [we]588-we 've scythed the grass on [Briar Farm]4-briar farm , and have n't [we]588-we had the finest crops of hay in [the county]2882-the county ? "[587-i]

A chorus of gruff voices answered [him]589-him :

" Ay , [Mister Jocelyn]102-amadis de jocelyn ! "[587-i]

" That 's right ! "[587-i]

" [I]582-one man never ' member more'n two wet seasons and then [we]588-we got last load in ' tween showers , "[582-one man] observed [one man]582-one man , thoughtfully .

" There ai n't never been nothin' wrong with [Briar Farm]4-briar farm hay crops anyway -- [all the buyers]2883-all the buyers knows that for thirty mile round , "[591-another] said [another]591-another .

" And the wheat and the corn and the barley and the oats the same , "[544-the old farmer] struck in [the old farmer]544-the old farmer again--"all the seed sown by hand and the harvest reaped by hand , and [every man and boy in [the village]2885-the village or [near]2886-near [it]2885-the village]2884-every man and boy in the village or near it has found work enough to keep [him]2884-every man and boy in the village or near it in [[his]2884-every man and boy in the village or near it native place]2887-his native place , spring , summer , autumn and winter , is n't that so ? "[544-the old farmer]

" Ay , ay ! "[544-the old farmer]

" Never a day out o ' work ! "[544-the old farmer]

" Talk of unemployed trouble , "[102-amadis de jocelyn] went on [Jocelyn]102-amadis de jocelyn , " if the old ways were kept up and work done in the old fashion , there 'd be plenty for [all [England]9-england 's men]2888-all england 's men to do , and to feed fair and hearty ! But the idea nowadays is to rush everything just to get finished with it , and then to play cards or football , and get drunk till the legs do n't know whether it 's land or [water]2889-water [they]2888-all england 's men 're standing on ! It 's the wrong way about , [boys]2679-boys ! It 's the wrong way about ! [You]2679-boys may hurry and scurry along as fast as [you]2679-boys please , but [you]2679-boys miss most good things by the way ; and there 's only one end to [your]2679-boys racing -- the grave ! There 's no such haste to drop into THAT , [boys]2679-boys ! It 'll wait ! It 's always waiting ! And the quicker [you]2679-boys go the quicker [you]2679-boys 'll get to it ! Take time while [you]2679-boys 're young ! That time for [me]102-amadis de jocelyn is past ! "[102-amadis de jocelyn]

[He]102-amadis de jocelyn lifted [his]102-amadis de jocelyn head and looked round upon [them]593-them all . There was a strange wild look in [his]102-amadis de jocelyn old eyes,--and a sudden sense of awe fell on [the rest of [the company]595-the company]594-the rest of the company . [Farmer Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn seemed all at once removed from [them]593-them to a height of dignity above [his]102-amadis de jocelyn ordinary bearing . [Innocent]152-innocent 's rose - crowned head drooped , and tears sprang involuntarily to [her]152-innocent eyes . [She]152-innocent tried to hide them , not so well , however , but that [Priscilla Priday]121-priscilla saw them .

" Now , [lovey child]2892-lovey child ! "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla whispered,--"Don't take on ! It 's only [the doctors]2791-the doctors that 's made [him]102-amadis de jocelyn low like and feelin ' blue , and [he]102-amadis de jocelyn ai n't takin ' sup or morsel , but [we]2894-we 'll make [him]102-amadis de jocelyn have a bite in [[his]102-amadis de jocelyn own room]2895-his own room afterwards . Do n't [you]2892-lovey child swell [your]2892-lovey child pretty eyes and make ['em]2896-'em red , for that wo n't suit [me]152-innocent nor [Mr. Robin]126-robin neither , come , come!--that it wo n't ! "[152-innocent]

[Innocent]152-innocent put one of [her]152-innocent little hands furtively under the board and pressed [Priscilla]121-priscilla 's rough knuckles tenderly , but [she]152-innocent said nothing . The silence was broken by one of [the oldest men present]596-the oldest men present , who rose , tankard in hand .

" The time for good farming is never past ! "[597-he] [he]597-he said , in a hearty voice--"And [no one]2691-no one will ever beat [Farmer Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn at that ! Full cups , [boys]2679-boys ! And [the master]2759-the master 's health ! Long life to [him]2759-the master ! "[597-he]

The response was immediate , [every man]598-every man rising to [his]598-every man feet . [None of [them]598-every man]599-none of them were particularly unsteady except [Ned Landon]112-landon , who nearly fell over the table as [he]112-landon got up , though [he]112-landon managed to straighten [himself]112-landon in time .

" [Farmer Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn ! "[597-he]

" To [Briar Farm]4-briar farm and [the master]2759-the master ! "[112-landon]

" Health and good luck ! "[597-he]

These salutations were roared loudly round the table , and then [the whole company]600-the whole company gave vent to a hearty ' Hip - hip - hurrah ! ' that roused echoes from the vaulted roof and made its flaring lights tremble .

" One more ! "[112-landon] shouted [Landon]112-landon , suddenly , turning [his]112-landon flushed face from side to side upon those immediately near him--"Miss [Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn ! "[112-landon]

There followed a deafening volley of cheering,--tankards clinked together and shone in the flickering light and every eye looked towards [the girl]414-the girl , who , colouring deeply , shrank from the tumult around [her]414-the girl like a leaf shivering in a storm - wind . [Robin]126-robin glanced at [her]414-the girl with a half - jealous , half - anxious look , but [her]414-the girl face was turned away from [him]126-robin . [He]126-robin lifted [his]126-robin tankard and , bowing towards [her]414-the girl , drank the contents . When the toast was fully pledged , [Farmer Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn got up , amid much clapping of hands , stamping of feet and thumping on the boards . [He]126-robin waited till quiet was restored , and then , speaking in strong resonant accents , said :

" [Boys]2679-boys , [I]602-i thank [you]2679-boys ! [You]2679-boys 're [all boys]2902-all boys to [me]602-i , young and old , for [you]2679-boys 've worked on [the farm]2744-the farm so long that [I]602-i seem to know [your]2679-boys faces as well as [I]602-i know the shape of [the land]2904-the land and the trees on [the ridges]2905-the ridges . [You]2679-boys 've wished [me]602-i health and long life -- and [I]602-i take it that [your]2679-boys wishes are honest -- but [I]602-i 've had a long life already and must n't expect much more of it . However , [the farm]2744-the farm will go on just the same whether [I]602-i 'm [here]2907-here or elsewhere,--and [no man that works well on]2908-no man that works well on [it]2744-the farm will be turned away from it,--that [I]602-i can promise [you]2679-boys ! And the advice [I]602-i 've always given to [you]2679-boys [I]602-i give to [you]2679-boys again,--stick to [the land]2904-the land and the work of [the land]2904-the land ! There 's nothing finer in [the world]2693-the world than the fresh air and the scent of the good brown earth that gives [you]2679-boys the reward of [your]2679-boys labour , always providing it is labour and not ' scamp ' service . When [I]602-i 'm gone [you]2679-boys 'll perhaps remember what [I]602-i say,--and think it not so badly said either . [I]602-i thank [you]2679-boys for [your]2679-boys good wishes and"--here[602-i] [he]602-i hesitated--"my little girl here thanks [you]2679-boys too . Next time [you]2679-boys make the hay -- if [I]602-i 'm not with [you]2679-boys -- [I]602-i ask [you]2679-boys to be as merry as [you]2679-boys are to - night and to drink to [my]602-i memory ! For whenever [one master of [Briar Farm]4-briar farm]2912-one master of briar farm has gone there 's always been another in [his]2912-one master of briar farm place!--and there always will be ! "[602-i] [He]602-i paused,--then lifting a full tankard which had been put beside [him]602-i , [he]602-i drank a few drops of its contents--"God bless [you]2679-boys all ! May [you]2679-boys long have the will to work and the health to enjoy the fruits of honest labour ! "[602-i]

There was another outburst of noisy cheering , followed by a new kind of clamour ,

" A song ! "[602-i]

" A song ! "[602-i]

" Who 'll begin ? "[602-i]

" [Little Steevy]127-steevy ! "[602-i]

"[2913-one old fellow with very white hair and a very red face--"ye're]

[A young giant of a man]603-a young giant of a man stood up in response to this adjuration , blushing and smiling bashfully .

" Here [I]602-i be ! "[602-i]

" Sing away , [lad]2838-lad , sing away ! "[602-i]

" Wet [yer]2679-boys pipe , and whistle ! "[602-i]

" Tune up , [[my]602-i blackbird]2916-my blackbird ! "[602-i]

[Steevy]127-steevy , thus adjured , straightened [himself]127-steevy to [his]127-steevy full stature of over six feet and drank off a cupful of ale . Then [he]602-i began in a remarkably fine and mellow tenor :

" Would [you]2679-boys choose [a wife]2917-a wife For a happy life , Leave [the town]2918-the town and [the country]2876-the country take ; Where [Susan]128-susan and [Doll]129-doll , And [Jenny]116-jenny and [Moll]79-marie corelli , Follow [Harry]130-harry and [John]131-john , While harvest goes on , And merrily , merrily rake ! "[602-i]

" [The lass]2920-the lass give [me]602-i [here]2907-here , As brown as [my]602-i beer , That knows how to govern [a farm]2922-a farm ; That can milk a cow , [Or]10-or [farrow a sow]2923-farrow a sow , Make butter and cheese , And gather green peas , And guard the poultry from harm . "[602-i]

" This , this is [the girl , Worth rubies and pearl]2924-the girl , worth rubies and pearl , [The wife that a [home]2674-home will make]2925-the wife that a home will make ! [[We]2927-we [farmers]2929-farmers]2928-we farmers need [No quality breed]2930-no quality breed , But [a woman that 's won While harvest goes on]2931-a woman that 's won while harvest goes on , And [we]2927-we merrily , merrily [rake]2932-rake ! "[602-i]

[ Footnote : Old Song 1740 . ]

A dozen or more stentorian voices joined in the refrain :

" [A woman that 's won While harvest goes on , And [we]2927-we merrily , merrily rake]2933-a woman that 's won while harvest goes on , and we merrily , merrily rake . "[602-i]

" Bravo ! "[602-i]

" Good for [you]602-i , [Steevy]127-steevy ! "[602-i]

" [First - class]2934-first - class ! "[602-i]

" Here 's to [you]602-i , [[my]602-i lad]2834-my lad ! "[602-i]

The shouting , laughter and applause continued for many minutes , then came more singing of songs from various rivals to the tuneful Steevy . And presently [all]604-all joined together in a boisterous chorus which ran thus :

" A glass is good and [a lass]2936-a lass is good , And a pipe is good in cold weather , [The world]2693-the world is good and [the people]2938-the people are good , And [we]2927-we 're [all good fellows]2939-all good fellows together ! "[604-all]

In the middle of this performance [Farmer Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn rose from [his]605-he place and left [the hall]517-the hall , [Innocent]152-innocent accompanying [him]605-he . Once [he]605-he looked back on the gay scene presented to [him]605-he -- the disordered supper - table , the easy lounging attitudes of [the well - fed men]607-the well - fed men , the flare of the lights which cast a ruddy glow on old and young faces and sparkled over the burnished pewter,--then with a strange yearning pain in [his]605-he eyes [he]605-he turned slowly away , leaning on the arm of [the girl beside [him]605-he]608-the girl beside him , and went,--leaving [the merry - makers]609-the merry - makers to [themselves]609-the merry - makers .

CHAPTER III

Returning to [the room where [he]605-he had sat alone before supper , [he]605-he sank heavily into the armchair [he]605-he had previously occupied]610-the room where he had sat alone before supper , he sank heavily into the armchair he had previously occupied . The window was still open , and the scent of roses stole in with every breath of air,--a few stars sparkled in the sky , and a faint line of silver in the east showed where the moon would shortly rise . [He]605-he looked out in dreamy silence , and for some minutes seemed too much absorbed in thought to notice the presence of [Innocent]152-innocent , who had seated [herself]152-innocent at a small table near [him]605-he , on which [she]152-innocent had set a lit candle , and was quietly sewing . [She]152-innocent had forgotten that [she]152-innocent still wore the wreath of wild roses,--the fragile flowers were drooping and dying in [her]152-innocent hair , and as [she]152-innocent bent over [her]152-innocent work and the candlelight illumined [her]152-innocent delicate profile , there was something almost sculptural in the shape of the leaves as they encircled [her]152-innocent brow , making [her]152-innocent look like [a young Greek nymph or goddess brought to life out of the poetic dreams of the elder world]611-a young greek nymph or goddess brought to life out of the poetic dreams of the elder world . [She]152-innocent was troubled and anxious , but [she]152-innocent tried not to let this seem apparent . [She]152-innocent knew from [her]152-innocent life 's experience of [his]605-he ways and whims that it was best to wait till [the old man]426-the old man chose to speak , rather than urge [him]605-he into talk before [he]605-he was ready or willing . [She]152-innocent glanced up from [her]152-innocent sewing now and again and saw that [he]605-he looked very pale and worn , and [she]152-innocent felt that [he]605-he suffered . [Her]152-innocent tender young heart ached with longing to comfort [him]605-he , yet [she]152-innocent knew not what [she]152-innocent should say . So [she]152-innocent sat quiet , as full of loving thoughts as a Madonna lily may be full of the dew of Heaven , yet mute as the angelic blossom itself . Presently [he]605-he moved restlessly , and turning in [his]605-he chair looked at [her]152-innocent intently . The fixity of [his]605-he gaze drew [her]152-innocent like a magnet from [her]152-innocent work and [she]152-innocent put down [her]152-innocent sewing .

" Do [you]605-he want anything , [Dad]85-dad ? "[152-innocent]

[He]605-he rose , and began to fumble with the buttons of [his]605-he smock .

" Ay -- just help [me]605-he to get this off . The working day is over,--the working clothes can go ! "[605-he]

[She]152-innocent was at [his]605-he side instantly and with [her]152-innocent light deft fingers soon disembarrassed [him]605-he of the homely garment . When it was taken off a noticeable transformation was effected in [his]605-he appearance . Clad in plain dark homespun , which was fashioned into a suit somewhat resembling the doublet and hose of olden times , [his]605-he tall thin figure had a distinctly aristocratic look and bearing which was lacking when clothed in [the labourer]613-the labourer 's garb . Old as [he]605-he was , there were traces of intellect and even beauty in [his]605-he features,--his head , on which the thin white hair shone like spun silver , was proudly set on [his]605-he shoulders in that unmistakable line which indicates the power and the will to command ; and as [he]605-he unconsciously drew [himself]605-he upright [he]605-he looked more like [some old hero of a hundred battles]614-some old hero of a hundred battles than [a farmer whose chief pride was the excellence of [his]605-he crops and the prosperity of [[his]605-he farm]616-his farm managed by hand work only . For despite the jeers of [[his]605-he neighbours]617-his neighbours , who were never tired of remonstrating with [him]605-he for not " going with the times , "[120-farmer jocelyn] [Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn had one fixed rule of farming , and this was that no modern machinery should be used on [[his]605-he lands]618-his lands]615-a farmer whose chief pride was the excellence of his crops and the prosperity of his farm managed by hand work only . for despite the jeers of his neighbours , who were never tired of remonstrating with him for not " going with the times , " jocelyn had one fixed rule of farming , and this was that no modern machinery should be used on his lands . [He]605-he was [the best employer of labour for many and many a mile round]619-the best employer of labour for many and many a mile round , and [the most generous as well as the most exact paymaster]620-the most generous as well as the most exact paymaster , and though [people]2701-people asserted that there was no reasonable explanation for it , nevertheless it annually happened that the hand - sown , hand - reaped crops of [Briar Farm]4-briar farm were finer and richer in grain and quality , and of much better value than the machine - sown , machine - reaped crops of [any other farm in [the county]2882-the county]622-any other farm in the county or for that matter in [the three counties adjoining]624-the three counties adjoining . [He]605-he stood now for a minute or two watching [Innocent]152-innocent as [she]152-innocent looked carefully over [his]605-he smock frock to see if there were any buttons missing or anything to be done requiring the services of [her]152-innocent quick needle and thread,--then as [she]152-innocent folded it and put it aside on a chair [he]605-he said with a thrill of compassion in [his]605-he voice :

" [Poor little child]2940-poor little child , [thou]2940-poor little child hast eaten no supper ! [I]152-innocent saw [thee]2940-poor little child playing with the bread and touching no morsel . Art not well ? "[152-innocent]

[She]152-innocent looked up at [him]605-he and tried to smile , but tears came into [her]152-innocent eyes despite [her]152-innocent efforts to keep them back .

" [Dear Dad]85-dad , [I]152-innocent am only anxious , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent murmured , tremulously . " [You]605-he , too , have had nothing . Shall [I]152-innocent fetch [you]605-he a glass of the old wine ? It will do [you]605-he good . "[152-innocent]

[He]605-he still bent [his]605-he brows thoughtfully upon [her]152-innocent .

" Presently -- presently -- not now , "[605-he] [he]605-he answered . " Come and sit by [me]605-he at the window and [I]605-he 'll tell [you]152-innocent -- [I'll]605-he tell [you]152-innocent what [you]152-innocent must know . But see [you]152-innocent , [child]2801-child , if [you]152-innocent are going to cry or fret , [you]152-innocent will be no help to [me]605-he and [I]605-he 'll just hold [my]605-he peace ! "[605-he]

[She]152-innocent drew a quick breath , and [her]152-innocent face paled .

" [I]152-innocent will not cry , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said,--"I will not fret . [I]152-innocent promise [you]625-i , [Dad]85-dad ! "[152-innocent]

[She]152-innocent came close up to [him]625-i as [she]152-innocent spoke . [He]625-i took [her]152-innocent gently in [his]625-i arms and kissed [her]152-innocent .

" That 's [a brave girl]2942-a brave girl ! "[625-i] And holding [her]152-innocent by the hand [he]625-i drew [her]152-innocent towards the open window--"Look out there ! See how the stars shine ! Always the same , no matter what happens to [[us]2943-our poor folk]2944-us poor folk down here,--they twinkle as merrily over [our]2943-our graves as over [[our]2943-our gardens,--and]2945-our gardens,--and yet if [we]2943-our 're to believe what [we]2943-our 're taught nowadays , [they]2946-they 're [all worlds]2947-all worlds more or less like [our]2943-our own , full of [living creatures that suffer and die like [ourselves]2943-our]2948-living creatures that suffer and die like ourselves . It 's a queer plan of [the Almighty]580-the almighty , to keep on making wonderful and beautiful things just to destroy [them]2946-they ! There seems no sense in it ! "[625-i]

[He]625-i sat down again in [his]625-i chair , and [she]152-innocent , obeying [his]625-i gesture , brought a low stool to [his]625-i feet and settled [herself]152-innocent upon it , leaning against [his]625-i knee . [Her]152-innocent face was upturned to [his]625-i and the flickering light of the tall candles quivering over it showed the wistful tender watchfulness of [its]626-its expression -- a look which seemed to trouble [him]625-i , for [he]625-i avoided [her]152-innocent eyes .

" [You]152-innocent want to know what [the London doctor]2806-the london doctor said , "[625-i] [he]625-i began . " Well , [child]2801-child , [you]152-innocent 'll not be any the better for knowing , but it 's as [I]625-i thought . [I]625-i 've got [my]625-i death - warrant . [Slowton]105-slowton was not sure about me,--but [this man]2952-this man , ill as [he]2952-this man is [himself]2952-this man , has had too much experience to make mistakes . There 's no cure for [me]625-i . [I]625-i may last out another twelve months -- perhaps not so long -- certainly not longer . "[625-i]

[He]625-i saw [her]152-innocent cheeks grow white with the ashy whiteness of a sudden shock . [Her]152-innocent eyes dilated with pain and fear , and a quick sigh escaped [her]152-innocent , then [she]152-innocent set [her]152-innocent lips hard .

" [I]152-innocent do n't believe it , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said , adding with stronger emphasis--"I WON'T believe it ! "[152-innocent]

[He]625-i patted the small hand that rested on [his]625-i knee .

" [You]152-innocent wo n't ? [Poor little girl]2953-poor little girl , [you]152-innocent must believe it!--and more than that , [you]152-innocent must be prepared for it . Even a year 's none too much for all that has to be done,--'twill almost take [me]625-i that time to look the thing square in the face and give up [the farm]2744-the farm for good . "--Here[625-i] [he]625-i paused with a kind of horror at [his]625-i own words--"Give up the farm!--My God ! And for ever ! How strange it seems ! "[625-i]

The tumult in [her]152-innocent mind found sudden speech .

" [Dad]85-dad , [dear]2830-dear ! [Dad]85-dad ! It is n't true ! Do n't think it ! Do n't mind what [the doctor]2825-the doctor says . [He]2825-the doctor 's wrong -- [I'm]152-innocent sure [he]2825-the doctor 's wrong ! [You]152-innocent 'll live for many and many a happy year yet -- oh yes , [Dad]85-dad , [you]152-innocent will ! [I]625-i 'm sure of it ! [You]152-innocent wo n't die , [darling Dad]2957-darling dad ! Why should [you]152-innocent ? "[625-i]

[She]152-innocent broke off with a half - smothered sob .

" Why should [I]625-i ? "[625-i] [he]625-i said , with a perplexed frown ; " Ah!--that 's more than [I]625-i can tell [you]152-innocent ! There 's neither rhyme nor reason in it that [I]625-i can see . But it 's the rule of life that it should end in death . For some the end is swift -- for some it 's slow -- some know when it 's coming -- some don't,--the last are the happiest . [I]625-i 've been told , [you]152-innocent see,--and it 's no use [my]625-i fighting against the fact,--a year at the most , perhaps less , is the longest term [I]625-i have of [Briar Farm]2958-briar farm . [Your]152-innocent eyes are wet -- [you]152-innocent promised [you]152-innocent would n't cry . "[625-i]

[She]152-innocent furtively dashed away the drops that were shining on [her]152-innocent lashes . Then [she]152-innocent forced a faint quivering smile .

" [I]152-innocent 'm not crying , [Dad]85-dad , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said . " There 's nothing to cry for , "[152-innocent] and [she]152-innocent fondled [his]625-i hand in [her]152-innocent own--"The [doctors]2793-doctors are wrong . [You]152-innocent 're only a little weak and run down -- [you'll]152-innocent be all right with rest and care -- and -- and [you]152-innocent sha n't die ! [You]152-innocent sha n't die ! [I]152-innocent wo n't let [you]152-innocent . "[152-innocent]

[He]625-i drew a long breath and passed [his]625-i hand across [his]625-i forehead as though [he]625-i were puzzled or in pain .

" That 's foolish talk , "[625-i] [he]625-i said , with some harshness ; " [You]152-innocent 've got trouble to meet , and [you]152-innocent must meet it . [I]625-i 'm bound to show [you]152-innocent trouble -- but [I]625-i can show [you]152-innocent a way out of it as well . "[625-i]

[He]625-i paused a moment,--a light wind outside the lattice swayed a branch of roses to and fro , shaking out their perfume as from a swung censer .

" The first thing [I]625-i must tell [you]152-innocent , "[625-i] [he]625-i went on , " is about [yourself]152-innocent . It 's time [you]152-innocent should know who [you]152-innocent are . "[625-i]

[She]627-she looked up at [him]625-i startled .

" Who [I]627-she am ? "[627-she] [she]627-she repeated,--then as [she]627-she saw the stern expression on [his]625-i face a sudden sense of fear ran through [her]627-she nerves like the chill of an icy wind and [she]627-she waited dumbly for [his]625-i next word . [He]625-i gripped [her]627-she hand hard in [his]625-i own .

" Now hear [me]625-i out , [child]2801-child ! "[625-i] [he]625-i said--"Let [me]625-i speak on without interruption , or [I]625-i shall never get through the tale . Perhaps [I]625-i ought to have told [you]152-innocent before , but [I]625-i 've put it off and put it off , thinking ' twould be time enough when [you]152-innocent and [Robin]126-robin were [we]2961-we d.
