[I]910-i think that is unfair,--but [I]910-i must bear it somehow , and [I]910-i will try to be brave . [I]910-i 'm glad [I]910-i 've told [you]911-you all about it,--and [you]911-you are very kind to have taken it so well -- and to care for [me]910-i still -- but [I]910-i shall never marry [you]911-you , [Robin!--never]153-robin!--never ! [I]910-i shall never bring [my]910-i ' base - born ' blood into [the family of [Jocelyn]143-hugo jocelyn]3192-the family of jocelyn ! "[910-i]

[His]912-his heart sank as [he]912-his heard [her]913-me -- and involuntarily [he]912-his stretched out [his]912-his arms in appeal .

" [Innocent]152-innocent ! "[912-his] [he]912-his murmured--"Don't be hard upon [me]913-me ! Think a little longer before [you]911-you leave [me]913-me without any hope ! It means so much to [my]913-me life ! Surely [you]911-you can not be cruel ? Do [you]911-you care for [me]913-me less than [you]911-you care for [that old knight buried under [his]3193-that old knight buried under his own effigy in the garden own effigy in [the garden]415-the garden]3193-that old knight buried under his own effigy in the garden ? Will [you]911-you not think kindly of a living [man?--a man who loves [you]911-you beyond all things]3195-man?--a man who loves you beyond all things ? Oh , [Innocent!--be]154-innocent!--be gentle , be merciful ! "[913-me]

[She]913-me came to [him]912-his and took [his]912-his hands in [her]913-me own .

" It is just because [I]913-me am kind and gentle and merciful , "[913-me] [she]913-me said , in [her]913-me sweet , grave accents , " that [I]913-me will not marry [you]911-you , [dear]2830-dear ! [I]913-me know [I]913-me am right,--and [you]911-you will think so too , in time . For the moment [you]911-you imagine [me]913-me to be much better and prettier than [I]913-me am -- and that there is no one like [me!--poor]154-innocent!--be [Robin!--you]151-robin!--you are blind!--there are [so many sweet and lovely girls]3197-so many sweet and lovely girls , well born , with [fathers]3198-fathers and [mothers]3199-mothers to care for [them]3197-so many sweet and lovely girls -- and [you]911-you , with [your]911-you good looks and kind ways , could marry [any one of [them]3197-so many sweet and lovely girls]3200-any one of them -- and [you]911-you will , some day ! Good - night , [dear]2830-dear ! [You]911-you have stayed [here]2907-here a long time talking to [me!--just]3203-me!--just suppose [you]911-you were seen sitting on this window - ledge so late!--it is past midnight!--what would be said of [me]913-me ! "[913-me]

" What could be said ? "[84-robin] demanded [Robin]84-robin , defiantly . " [I]84-robin came up here of [my]84-robin own accord,--the blame would be [mine]84-robin ! "[84-robin]

[She]914-she shook [her]914-she head sadly , smiling a little .

" Ah , [Robin]84-robin ! [The man]481-the man is never blamed ! It 's always [the woman]3205-the woman 's fault ! "[913-me]

" Where 's [your]914-she fault to - night ? "[84-robin] [he]84-robin asked .

" Oh , most plain ! "[914-she] [she]914-she answered . " When [I]914-she saw [you]84-robin coming , [I]914-she ought to have shut the window , drawn the curtains , and left [you]84-robin to clamber down the wall again as fast as [you]84-robin clambered up ! But [I]914-she wanted to tell [you]84-robin what had happened -- and how everything had changed for [me]914-she -- and now -- now that [you]84-robin know all -- good - night ! "[914-she]

[He]84-robin looked at [her]914-she longingly . If [she]914-she would only show some little sign of tenderness!--if [he]84-robin might just kiss [her]914-she hand , [he]84-robin thought ! But [she]914-she withdrew into the shadow , and [he]84-robin had no excuse for lingering .

" Good - night ! "[84-robin] [he]84-robin said , softly . " Good - night , [[my]84-robin angel]3206-my angel Innocent ! Good - night , [[my]84-robin little love]3207-my little love ! "[84-robin]

[She]914-she made no response and moved slowly backward into [the room]531-the room . But as [he]84-robin reluctantly left [his]84-robin point of vantage and began to descend , stepping lightly from branch to branch of [the accommodating wistaria]916-the accommodating wistaria , [he]84-robin saw the shadowy outline of [her]914-she figure once more as [she]914-she stretched out a hand and closed the lattice window , drawing a curtain across it . With the drawing of that curtain the beauty of the summer night was over for [him]84-robin , and poising [himself]84-robin lightly on a tough stem which was twisted strongly enough to give [him]84-robin adequate support and which projected some four feet above the smooth grass below , [he]84-robin sprang down . Scarcely had [he]84-robin touched the ground when [a man]2681-a man , leaping suddenly out of a thick clump of bushes near that side of [the house]2762-the house , caught [him]84-robin in a savage grip and shook [him]84-robin with all the fury of [an enraged mastiff shaking a rat]919-an enraged mastiff shaking a rat . Taken thus unawares , and rendered almost breathless by the swiftness of the attack , [Clifford]84-robin struggled in the grasp of [[his]84-robin assailant]920-his assailant and fought with [him]920-his assailant desperately for a moment without any idea of [his]84-robin identity,--then as by a dexterous twist of body [he]84-robin managed to partially extricate [himself]84-robin , [he]84-robin looked up and saw the face of [Ned Landon]112-landon , livid and convulsed with passion .

" [Landon]112-landon ! "[112-landon] [he]112-landon gasped--"What 's the matter with [you]112-landon ? Are [you]112-landon mad ? "[921-his antagonist]

" Yes ! "[112-landon] answered [Landon]112-landon , hoarsely--"And enough to make [me]112-landon so ! [You]112-landon devil ! [You]112-landon 've ruined [the girl]414-the girl ! "[112-landon]

With a rapid movement , unexpected by [[his]84-robin antagonist]921-his antagonist , [Clifford]84-robin disengaged [himself]84-robin and stood free .

" [You]112-landon lie ! "[112-landon] [he]112-landon said--"And [you]112-landon shall pay for it ! Come away from [the house]2762-the house and fight like [a man]2681-a man ! Come into [the grass meadow yonder]3211-the grass meadow yonder , where [no one]2691-no one can see or hear [us]3213-us . Come ! "[112-landon]

[Landon]112-landon paused , drawing [his]112-landon breath thickly , and looking like a snarling beast baulked of its prey .

" That 's a trick ! "[112-landon] [he]112-landon said , scornfully--"You'll run away ! "[112-landon]

" Come ! "[84-robin] repeated [Clifford]84-robin , vehemently--"You're more likely to run away than [I]84-robin am ! Come ! "[84-robin]

[Landon]112-landon glanced [him]84-robin over from head to foot -- the moonbeams fell brightly on [his]112-landon athletic figure and handsome face -- then turned on [his]112-landon heel .

" No , [I]112-landon wo n't ! "[112-landon] [he]112-landon said , curtly--"I've done all [I]112-landon want to do for to - night . [I]112-landon 've shaken [you]112-landon like the puppy [you]112-landon are ! To - morrow [we]922-both men 'll settle [our]922-both men differences . "[112-landon]

For all answer [Clifford]84-robin sprang at [him]112-landon and struck [him]112-landon smartly across the face . In another moment [both men]922-both men were engaged in a fierce tussle , none the less deadly because so silent . [A practised boxer and wrestler]923-a practised boxer and wrestler , [Clifford]84-robin grappled more and more closely with [the bigger but clumsier man]924-the bigger but clumsier man , dragging [him]112-landon steadily inch by inch further away from [the house]2762-the house as [they]922-both men fought . More desperate , more determined became the struggle , till by two or three adroit manoeuvres [Clifford]84-robin got [[his]84-robin opponent]926-his opponent under [him]84-robin and bore [him]112-landon gradually to the ground , where , kneeling on [his]84-robin chest , [he]84-robin pinned [him]112-landon down .

" Let [me]84-robin go ! "[84-robin] muttered [Landon--"You're]155-landon--"you're killing [me]84-robin ! "[84-robin]

" Serve [you]84-robin right ! "[84-robin] answered [Clifford--"You scoundrel]3214-clifford--"you scoundrel ! [[My]84-robin uncle]3167-my uncle shall know of this ! "[84-robin]

" Tell [him]3167-my uncle what [you]84-robin like ! "[112-landon] retorted [Landon]112-landon , faintly--"I do n't care ! Get off [my]112-landon chest!--you're suffocating [me]112-landon ! "[112-landon]

[Clifford]84-robin slightly relaxed the pressure of [his]84-robin hands and knees .

" Will [you]84-robin apologise ? "[84-robin] [he]84-robin demanded .

" Apologise?--for what ? "[84-robin]

" For [your]84-robin insolence to [me]84-robin and [[my]84-robin cousin]3216-my cousin . "[84-robin]

" [Cousin]156-cousin be hanged ! "[84-robin] snarled [Landon--"She]157-landon--"she 's no more [[your]84-robin cousin]3217-your cousin than [I]84-robin am -- [she]156-cousin 's only [a nameless bastard]3218-a nameless bastard ! [I]84-robin heard [her]156-cousin tell [you]84-robin so ! And fine airs [she]156-cousin gives [herself]156-cousin on nothing ! "[84-robin]

" [[You]84-robin miserable spy]3219-you miserable spy ! "[84-robin] and [Clifford]84-robin again held [him]84-robin down as in a vise--"Whatever [you]84-robin heard is none of [your]84-robin business ! Will [you]84-robin apologise ? "[84-robin]

" Oh , [I]112-landon 'll apologise , if [you]112-landon like!--anything to get [your]112-landon weight off me!"--and[112-landon] [Landon]112-landon made an abortive effort to rise . " But [I]112-landon keep [my]112-landon own opinion all the same ! "[112-landon]

Slowly [Robin]84-robin released [him]84-robin , and watched [him]84-robin as [he]84-robin picked [himself]84-robin up , with an air of mingled scorn and pity . [Landon]112-landon laughed forcedly , passing one hand across [his]112-landon forehead and staring in a dazed fashion at the shadows cast on the ground by the moon .

" Yes -- [I]84-robin keep [my]84-robin own opinion ! "[84-robin] [he]84-robin repeated , stupidly . " [You]112-landon 've got the better of [me]84-robin just now -- but [you]112-landon wo n't always , [my]84-robin pert Cock [Robin]84-robin ! [You]112-landon wo n't always . Do n't [you]112-landon think it ! [Briar Farm]4-briar farm and [I]84-robin may part [company]3220-company -- but there 's [a bigger place than [Briar Farm]4-briar farm]3221-a bigger place than briar farm -- there 's the world!--that 's [a wide field]3222-a wide field and plenty of crops growing on [it]3222-a wide field ! And [the men that sow those kind of crops]3223-the men that sow those kind of crops and reap them and bring them in , are [better farmers]3224-better farmers than [you]112-landon 'll ever be ! As for [your]112-landon girl!"--here[84-robin] [his]84-robin face darkened and [he]84-robin shook [his]84-robin fist towards the lattice window behind which slept the unconscious cause of the quarrel--"You can keep [her]3225-her ! A nice ' Innocent ' [SHE]3225-her is!--talking with [a man in [[her]3225-her bedroom]3227-her bedroom]3226-a man in her bedroom after midnight!--why , [I]84-robin would n't have [her]3225-her as a gift -- not now ! "[84-robin]

Choking with rage , [Clifford]84-robin sprang towards [him]84-robin again -- [Landon]112-landon stepped back .

" Hands off ! "[112-landon] [he]112-landon said--"Don't touch [me]112-landon ! [I]112-landon 'm in a killing mood ! [I]112-landon 've a knife on [me]112-landon -- [you]112-landon have n't . [You]112-landon 're [the master]2759-the master -- [I'm]112-landon [the man]481-the man -- and [I]112-landon 'll play fair ! [I]112-landon 've [my]112-landon future to think of , and [I]112-landon do n't want to start with a murder ! "[112-landon]

With this , [he]112-landon turned [his]112-landon back and strode off , walking somewhat unsteadily like [a blind man]927-a blind man feeling [his]927-a blind man way .

[Clifford]84-robin stood for a moment , inert . The angry blood burned in [his]84-robin face,--his hands were involuntarily clenched,--he was impatient with [himself]84-robin for having , as [he]84-robin thought , let [Landon]112-landon off too easily . [He]84-robin saw at once the possibility of mischief brewing , and hastily considered how it could best be circumvented .

" The simplest way out of it is to make a clean breast of everything , "[84-robin] [he]84-robin decided , at last . " Tomorrow [I]84-robin 'll see [Uncle Hugo]87-uncle hugo early in the morning and tell [him]87-uncle hugo just what has happened . "[84-robin]

Under the influence of this resolve , [he]112-landon gradually calmed down and re - entered [the house]2762-the house . And the moonlight , widening and then waning over [the smooth and peaceful meadows of [Briar Farm]4-briar farm]929-the smooth and peaceful meadows of briar farm , had it all its own way for the rest of the night , and as it filtered through the leafy branches of the elms and beeches which embowered [the old tomb of [the Sieur Amadis de Jocelin]138-the sieur amadis]930-the old tomb of the sieur amadis de jocelin it touched with a pale glitter the stone hands of [his]112-landon sculptured effigy,--hands that were folded prayerfully above the motto,--"Mon coeur [me]121-priscilla soutien ! "[121-priscilla]

CHAPTER V

As early as six o'clock the next morning [Innocent]152-innocent was up and dressed , and , hastening down to [the kitchen]518-the kitchen , busied [herself]152-innocent , as was [her]152-innocent usual daily custom , in assisting [Priscilla]121-priscilla with the housework and the preparation for breakfast . There was always plenty to do , and as [she]152-innocent moved quickly to and fro , fulfilling the various duties [she]152-innocent had taken upon [herself]152-innocent and which [she]152-innocent performed with unobtrusive care and exactitude , the melancholy forebodings of the past night partially cleared away from [her]152-innocent mind . Yet there was a new expression on [her]152-innocent face -- one of sadness and seriousness unfamiliar to its almost child - like features , and it was not easy for [her]152-innocent to smile in [her]152-innocent ordinary bright way at the round of scolding which [Priscilla]121-priscilla administered every morning to [the maids who swept and scrubbed and dusted and scoured [the kitchen]518-the kitchen till no speck of dirt was anywhere visible , till the copper shone like mirrors , and the tables were nearly as smooth as polished silver or ivory]932-the maids who swept and scrubbed and dusted and scoured the kitchen till no speck of dirt was anywhere visible , till the copper shone like mirrors , and the tables were nearly as smooth as polished silver or ivory . Going into [the dairy]934-the dairy where pans of new milk stood ready for skimming , and looking out for a moment through the lattice window , [she]152-innocent saw [old Hugo Jocelyn]143-hugo jocelyn and [Robin Clifford]84-robin walking together across [the garden]415-the garden , engaged in close and earnest conversation . A little sigh escaped [her]152-innocent as [she]152-innocent thought : " [They]937-the other servants are talking about [me!"--then]121-priscilla[152-innocent] , on a sudden impulse , [she]152-innocent went back into [the kitchen]518-the kitchen where [Priscilla]121-priscilla was for the moment alone , [the other servants]937-the other servants having dispersed into [various quarters of [the house]2762-the house]938-various quarters of the house , and going straight up to [her]121-priscilla said , simply--

" [Priscilla]121-priscilla dear , why did [you]121-priscilla never tell [me]152-innocent that [I]152-innocent was n't [[Dad]85-dad 's own daughter]3230-dad 's own daughter ? "[152-innocent]

[Priscilla]121-priscilla started violently , and [her]121-priscilla always red face turned redder,--then , with an effort to recover [herself]121-priscilla , [she]121-priscilla answered--

" Lord , lovey ! How [you]121-priscilla frightened [me]121-priscilla ! Why did n't [I]121-priscilla tell [you]121-priscilla ? Well , in the first place , ' twasn't none of [my]121-priscilla business , and in the second , ' twouldn't have done any good if [I]121-priscilla had . "[121-priscilla]

[Innocent]152-innocent was silent , looking at [her]121-priscilla with a piteous intensity .

" And who is it that 's told [you]121-priscilla now ? "[121-priscilla] went on [Priscilla]121-priscilla , nervously--"some meddlin ' old fool-- "[121-priscilla]

[Innocent]152-innocent raised [her]152-innocent hand , warningly .

" Hush , [Priscilla]121-priscilla ! [Dad]85-dad [himself]85-dad told [me--]3231-me-- "[152-innocent]

" Well , [he]85-dad might just as well have kept a still tongue in [his]85-dad head , "[121-priscilla] retorted [Priscilla]121-priscilla , sharply . " [He]85-dad 's kept it for eighteen years , an ' why [he]85-dad should let it go wagging loose now , [the Lord]3232-the lord only knows ! There 's no making out the ways of [men,--they]3233-they first plays the wise and silent game like barn - door owls,--then all on a suddint - like [they]3233-they starts cawing gossip for all [they]3233-they 're worth , like crows . And what 's the good of tellin ' [ye]121-priscilla , anyway ? "[121-priscilla]

" No good , perhaps , "[152-innocent] answered [Innocent]152-innocent , sorrowfully--"but it 's right [I]152-innocent should know . [You]414-the girl see , [I]152-innocent 'm not [a child]634-a child any more -- [I'm]152-innocent eighteen -- that 's [a woman]2688-a woman -- and [a woman]2688-a woman ought to know what [she]2688-a woman must expect more or less in [her]2688-a woman life-- "[152-innocent]

[Priscilla]121-priscilla leaned on the newly scrubbed [kitchen]522-kitchen table and looked across at [the girl]414-the girl with a compassionate expression .

" What [a woman]2688-a woman must expect in life is good ' ard knocks and blows , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said--"unless [she]2688-a woman can get [a man]2681-a man to look arter [her]2688-a woman what 's not of the general kicking spirit . Take [my]121-priscilla advice , [dearie]3132-dearie ! [You]121-priscilla marry [Mr. Robin!--as]158-mr. robin!--as good [a boy as ever breathed]3240-a boy as ever breathed -- [he'll]158-mr. robin!--as be a kind fond ' usband to [ye]121-priscilla , and [arter]3241-arter all that 's what [a woman]2688-a woman thrives best on -- kindness -- an ' [you]121-priscilla 've ' ad it all [your]121-priscilla life up to now-- "[121-priscilla]

" [Priscilla]121-priscilla , "[152-innocent] interrupted [Innocent]152-innocent , decidedly--"I can not marry [Robin]84-robin ! [You]121-priscilla know [I]152-innocent can not ! [A poor nameless girl like [me!--why]3243-a poor nameless girl like me!--why]3243-a poor nameless girl like me!--why , it would be a shame to [him]84-robin in after - years . Besides , [I]152-innocent do n't love [him]84-robin -- and it 's wicked to marry [a man [you]121-priscilla do n't love]3244-a man you do n't love . "[152-innocent]

[Priscilla]121-priscilla smothered a sound between a grunt and a sigh .

" [You]121-priscilla talks a lot about love , [child]2801-child , "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla said--"but [I]121-priscilla 'm thinkin ' [you]2801-child do n't know much about it . [Them]3246-them old books an ' papers [you]2801-child found up in [the secret room]3247-the secret room are full of nonsense , [I]121-priscilla 'm pretty sure -- an ' if [you]2801-child believes that [men]397-men are always sighin ' an ' dyin ' for [a woman]2688-a woman , [you]2801-child 're mistaken -- yes , [you]2801-child are , lovey ! [They]397-men goes where [they]397-men can be made most comfortable -- an ' it do n't matter what [sort o ' woman]3250-sort o ' woman gives the comfort so long as [they]397-men gits it . "[121-priscilla]

[Innocent]152-innocent smiled , faintly .

" [You]121-priscilla do n't know anything about it , [Priscilla]121-priscilla , "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla answered--"You were never married . "[121-priscilla]

" Thank [the Lord]3232-the lord and [His]3232-the lord goodness , no ! "[121-priscilla] said [Priscilla]121-priscilla , with an emphatic sniff--"I've never been troubled with the whimsies of [a man]2681-a man , which is worse than all the megrims of [a woman]2688-a woman any day . [I]121-priscilla 've looked [arter]3254-arter [Mr. Jocelyn]102-amadis de jocelyn in a way -- but [he]102-amadis de jocelyn 's no sort of [a man to worry about]3255-a man to worry about -- [he]102-amadis de jocelyn just goes reglar to the farmin'--an ' that 's all -- [a decent creature]3256-a decent creature always , an ' steady as [his]102-amadis de jocelyn own oxen what pulls the plough . An ' when [he]102-amadis de jocelyn 's gone , if go [he]102-amadis de jocelyn must , [I]121-priscilla 'll look arter [you]942-you an ' [Mr. Robin]126-robin , an ' please [God]80-god , [I]121-priscilla 'll dance [[your]942-you babies]3257-your babies on [my]121-priscilla old knees-- "[121-priscilla] Here [she]942-you broke off and turned [her]942-you head away . [Innocent]152-innocent ran to [her]942-you , surprised .

" Why , [Priscilla]121-priscilla , [you]121-priscilla 're crying ! "[942-you] [she]942-you exclaimed--"Don't do that ! Why should [you]121-priscilla cry ? "[121-priscilla]

" Why indeed ! "[942-you] blubbered Priscilla--"Except that [I]943-she 'm [a doiterin ' fool]3258-a doiterin ' fool ! [I]943-she ca n't abear the thoughts of [you]942-you turnin ' [yer]942-you back on the good that [God]80-god gives [ye]942-you , an ' floutin ' [Mr. Robin]126-robin , who 's [the best sort o ' man that ever could fall to the lot of [a little tender maid like [you]942-you]3260-a little tender maid like you]3259-the best sort o ' man that ever could fall to the lot of a little tender maid like you -- why , lovey , [you]942-you do n't know the wickedness o ' [this world]3261-this world , nor the ways of it -- an ' [you]942-you talks about love as if it was somethin' wonderful an ' far away , when here it is at [yer]942-you very feet for the pickin ' up ! What 's the good of all [they]3262-they books [ye've]942-you bin readin ' if [they]3262-they do n't teach [ye]942-you that [the old knight [you]942-you 're fond of]3263-the old knight you 're fond of got so weary of [the world]2693-the world that [arter]3263-the old knight you 're fond of tryin ' everythin ' in turn [he]3263-the old knight you 're fond of found nothin' better than to marry [a plain , straight country wench]3265-a plain , straight country wench and settle down in [Briar Farm]4-briar farm for all [his]3263-the old knight you 're fond of days ? Ai n't that the lesson [he]3263-the old knight you 're fond of 's taught [ye]942-you ? "[943-she]

[She]943-she paused , looking hopefully at [the girl]414-the girl through [her]943-she tears -- but [Innocent]152-innocent 's small fair face was pale and calm , though [her]943-she eyes shone with a brilliancy as of suppressed excitement .

" No , "[943-she] [she]943-she said--"He has not taught [me]943-she that at all . [He]3263-the old knight you 're fond of came here to ' seek forgetfulness'--so it is said in the words [he]3263-the old knight you 're fond of carved on the panel in [his]3263-the old knight you 're fond of study,--but [we]3266-we do not know that [he]3263-the old knight you 're fond of ever really forgot . [He]3263-the old knight you 're fond of only ' found peace , ' and peace is not happiness -- except for the very old . "[943-she]

" Peace is not happiness ! "[121-priscilla] re - echoed [Priscilla]121-priscilla , staring--"That 's a queer thing to say , [lovey]2788-lovey ! What do [you]2788-lovey call being happy ? "[121-priscilla]

" It is difficult to explain"--and[414-the girl] a swift warm colour flew over [the girl]414-the girl 's cheeks , expressing some wave of hidden feeling--"Your idea of happiness and mine must be so different ! "[121-priscilla] [She]121-priscilla smiled--"Dear , good [Priscilla]121-priscilla ! [You]121-priscilla are so much more easily contented than [I]414-the girl am ! "[414-the girl]

[Priscilla]121-priscilla looked at [her]414-the girl with a great tenderness in [her]121-priscilla dim old grey eyes .

" See here , [lovey]2788-lovey ! "[943-she] [she]943-she said--"You're just like a young bird on the edge of a nest ready to fly . [You]121-priscilla do n't know [the world]2693-the world nor the ways of it . Oh , [[my]121-priscilla dear]3270-my dear , it ai n't all gold harvests and apples ripening rosy in the sun ! [You]121-priscilla 've lived all [your]121-priscilla life in [the open country]3271-the open country , and so [you]121-priscilla 've always had [the good God]3272-the good god near you,--but there 's places where [the houses]3273-the houses stand so close together that the sky can hardly make a patch of blue between the smoking chimneys -- like [London]3-london , for instance -- ah!--that 's where [you]121-priscilla 'd find what [the world]2693-the world 's like , lovey!--where [you]121-priscilla feels so lonesome that [you]121-priscilla wonders why [you]121-priscilla ever were born-- "[121-priscilla]

" [I]414-the girl wonder that already , "[414-the girl] interrupted [the girl]414-the girl , quickly . " Do n't worry [me]414-the girl , [dear]2830-dear ! [I]414-the girl have so much to think about -- [my]414-the girl life seems so altered and strange -- [I]414-the girl hardly understand [myself]414-the girl -- and [I]414-the girl do n't know what [I]414-the girl shall do with [my]414-the girl future -- but [I]414-the girl cannot -- [I]414-the girl will not marry [Robin]126-robin ! "[414-the girl]

[She]414-the girl turned away quickly then , to avoid further discussion .

A little later [she]414-the girl went into [the quaint oak - panelled room]947-the quaint oak - panelled room where the fateful disclosures of the past night had been revealed to [her]414-the girl . Here breakfast was laid , and the latticed window was set wide open , admitting the sweet scent of stocks and mignonette with every breath of the morning air . [She]414-the girl stood awhile looking out on the gay beauty of [the garden]415-the garden , and [her]414-the girl eyes unconsciously filled with tears .

" Dear [home]2674-home ! "[414-the girl] [she]414-the girl murmured--"Home that is not [mine]414-the girl -- that never will be [mine]414-the girl ! How [I]414-the girl have loved you!--how [I]414-the girl shall always love [you]414-the girl ! "[414-the girl]

A slow step behind [her]414-the girl interrupted [her]414-the girl meditations -- and [she]414-the girl looked around with a smile as timid as it was tender . There was [her]414-the girl " Dad"--the[414-the girl] same as ever,--yet now to [her]414-the girl mind so far removed from [her]414-the girl that [she]414-the girl hesitated a moment before giving [him]949-i [her]414-the girl customary good - morning greeting . A pained contraction of [his]949-i brow showed [her]414-the girl that [he]949-i felt this little difference , and [she]414-the girl hastened to make instant amends .

" [Dear Dad]85-dad ! "[414-the girl] [she]414-the girl said , softly,--and [she]414-the girl put [her]414-the girl soft arms about [him]949-i and kissed [his]949-i cheek--"How are [you]949-i this morning ? Did [you]949-i sleep well ? "[414-the girl]

[He]949-i took [her]414-the girl arms from [his]949-i shoulders , and held [her]414-the girl for a moment , looking at [her]414-the girl scrutinisingly from under [his]949-i shaggy brows .

" [I]949-i did not sleep at all , "[949-i] [he]949-i answered her--"I lay broad awake , thinking of [you]414-the girl . Thinking of [you]414-the girl , [[my]949-i little innocent , fatherless , motherless lamb]3277-my little innocent , fatherless , motherless lamb ! And [you]414-the girl , [child!--you]414-the girl did not sleep so well as [you]414-the girl should have done , talking with [Robin]126-robin half the night out of window ! "[949-i]

[She]414-the girl coloured deeply . [He]949-i smiled and pinched [her]414-the girl crimsoning cheek , apparently well pleased .

" No harm , no harm ! "[949-i] [he]949-i said--"Just two young doves cooing among the leaves at mating time ! [Robin]126-robin has told [me]949-i all about it . Now listen , child!--I'm away to - day to [the market town]3278-the market town -- there 's seed to buy and crops to sell -- [I'll]949-i take [Ned Landon]112-landon with [me--]949-i "[949-i] [he]949-i paused , and an odd expression of sternness and resolve clouded [his]949-i features--"Yes!--I'll take [Ned Landon]112-landon with [me]949-i -- [he]112-landon 's shrewd enough when [he]112-landon 's sober -- and [he]112-landon 's cunning enough , too , for that matter!--yes , [I]949-i 'll take [him]112-landon with [me]949-i . [We]3279-we 'll be off in [the dog - cart]3280-the dog - cart as soon as breakfast 's done . [My]949-i time 's getting short , but [I]949-i 'll attend to [my]949-i own business as long as [I]949-i can -- [I'll]949-i look after [Briar Farm]4-briar farm till [I]949-i die -- and [I]949-i 'll die in harness . There 's plenty of work to do yet -- plenty of work ; and while [I]949-i 'm away [you]950-his can settle up things-- "[949-i]

Here [he]950-his broke off , and [his]950-his eyes grew fixed in a sudden vacant stare . [Innocent]152-innocent , frightened at [his]950-his unnatural look , laid [her]152-innocent hand caressingly on [his]950-his arm .

" Yes , dear [Dad]85-dad ! "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said , soothingly--"What is it [you]950-his wish [me]152-innocent to do ? "[152-innocent]

The stare faded from [his]950-his eyeballs , and [his]950-his face softened .

" Settle up things , "[950-his] [he]950-his repeated , slowly , and with emphasis--"Settle up things with [Robin]126-robin . No more beating about the bush ! [You]950-his talked to [him]126-robin long enough out of window last night , and mind [you!--somebody]3281-you!--somebody was listening ! That means mischief ! _ [I]950-his _ do n't blame [you]950-his , poor wilding!--but remember , [SOMEBODY]3282-somebody WAS LISTENING ! Now think of that and of [your]950-his good name , child!--settle with [Robin]126-robin and [we]3283-we 'll have [the banns]3284-the banns put up next Sunday . "[950-his]

While [he]950-his thus spoke the warm rose of [her]152-innocent cheeks faded to an extreme pallor,--her very lips grew white and set . [Her]152-innocent hurrying thoughts clamoured for utterance,--she could have expressed in passionate terms [her]152-innocent own bitter sense of wrong and unmerited shame , but pity for [the old man]426-the old man 's worn and haggard look of pain held [her]152-innocent silent . [She]152-innocent saw and felt that [he]950-his was not strong enough to bear any argument or opposition in [his]950-his present mood , so [she]152-innocent made no sort of reply , not even by a look or a smile . Quietly [she]152-innocent went to the breakfast table , and busied [herself]152-innocent in preparing [his]950-his morning meal . [He]950-his followed [her]152-innocent and sat heavily down in [his]950-his usual chair , watching [her]152-innocent furtively as [she]152-innocent poured out the tea .

" Such little white hands , are n't they ? "[950-his] [he]950-his said , coaxingly , touching [her]152-innocent small fingers when [she]152-innocent gave [him]950-his [his]950-his cup--"Eh , wilding ? The prettiest lily flowers [I]152-innocent ever saw ! And one of them will look all the prettier for a gold wedding - ring upon it ! Ay , ay ! [We]3285-we 'll have [the banns]3284-the banns put up on Sunday . "[152-innocent]

Still [she]152-innocent did not speak ; once [she]152-innocent turned away [her]152-innocent head to hide the tears that involuntarily rose to [her]152-innocent eyes . [Old Hugo]143-hugo jocelyn , meanwhile , began to eat [his]950-his breakfast with the nervous haste of a man who takes [his]950-his food more out of custom than necessity . Presently [he]950-his became irritated at [her]152-innocent continued silence .

" [You]152-innocent heard what [I]950-his said , did n't [you]152-innocent ? "[950-his] [he]950-his demanded--"And [you]152-innocent understood ? "[950-his]

[She]152-innocent looked full at [him]950-his with sorrowful , earnest eyes .

" Yes , [Dad]85-dad . [I]152-innocent heard . And [I]152-innocent understood . "[152-innocent]

[He]950-his nodded and smiled , and appeared to take it for granted that [she]152-innocent had received an order which it was [her]152-innocent bounden duty to obey . The sun shone brilliantly in upon [the beautiful old room]952-the beautiful old room , and through the open window came a pleasant murmuring of bees among the mignonette , and the whistle of a thrush in an elm - tree sounded with clear and cheerful persistence . [Hugo Jocelyn]143-hugo jocelyn looked at the fair view of [the flowering garden]953-the flowering garden and drew [his]143-hugo jocelyn breath hard in a quick sigh .

" It 's a fine day , "[143-hugo jocelyn] [he]143-hugo jocelyn said--"and it 's [a fine world]3287-a fine world ! Ay , that it is ! [I]143-hugo jocelyn 'm not sure there 's a better anywhere ! And it 's a bit difficult to think of going down for ever into the dark and the cold , away from the sunshine and the sky -- but it 's got to be done!"--here[143-hugo jocelyn] [he]143-hugo jocelyn clenched [his]143-hugo jocelyn fist and brought it down on the table with a defiant blow--"It 's got to be done , and [I]143-hugo jocelyn 've got to do it ! But not yet -- not quite yet!--I've plenty of time and chance to stop mischief ! "[143-hugo jocelyn]

[He]143-hugo jocelyn rose , and drawing [himself]143-hugo jocelyn up to [his]143-hugo jocelyn full height looked for the moment strong and resolute . Taking one or two slow turns up and down [the room]531-the room , [he]143-hugo jocelyn suddenly stopped in front of [Innocent]152-innocent .

" [We]3288-we shall be away all day , "[143-hugo jocelyn] [he]143-hugo jocelyn said--"I and [Ned Landon]112-landon . Do [you]955-she hear ? "[143-hugo jocelyn]

[She]955-she smiled faintly .

" Did [I]955-she open [my]955-she eyes , [Dad]85-dad ? "[955-she] [she]955-she said--"I did not mean to be curious . [I]143-hugo jocelyn only thought-- "[143-hugo jocelyn]

"[143-hugo jocelyn]

" [You]3291-little girl 'll have all the day to [yourself]3291-little girl with [Robin]126-robin , "[143-hugo jocelyn] [he]143-hugo jocelyn added , glancing back at her--"There'll be [no spies]3298-no spies about [the place]883-the place , and [no one]2691-no one listening , as there was last night ! "[143-hugo jocelyn]

[She]955-she sprang up from [her]955-she chair , moved at last by an impulse of indignation .

" Who was it ? "[955-she] [she]955-she asked--"I said nothing wrong -- and [I]143-hugo jocelyn do not care!--but who was it ? "[143-hugo jocelyn]

A curious strained look came into [old Hugo]143-hugo jocelyn 's eyes as [he]143-hugo jocelyn answered--

" [Ned Landon]112-landon . "[955-she]

[She]955-she looked amazed,--then scared .

" [Ned Landon]112-landon ? "[955-she]

" [Ay]3301-ay ! [Ned Landon]112-landon . [He]112-landon has n't the sweetest of tempers and [he]112-landon is n't always sober . " Why , what mischief can there be ? "[414-the girl] [the girl]414-the girl demanded , [her]414-the girl colour coming and going quickly--"And why should [he]112-landon have listened ? It 's a mean trick to spy upon [others]2689-others ! "[414-the girl]

[He]143-hugo jocelyn smiled indulgently .

" Of course it 's a mean trick , [child!--but]161-child!--but there 's [a good many men]3304-a good many men -- and [women]718-women too -- who are just made up of mean tricks and nothing more . Ay!--and that reminds [me--]143-hugo jocelyn "[143-hugo jocelyn] Here [he]143-hugo jocelyn came from the door back into [the room]531-the room again , and going to a quaint old upright oaken press that stood in one corner , [he]143-hugo jocelyn unlocked it and took out a roll of bank - notes . "[143-hugo jocelyn] [He]143-hugo jocelyn approached [her]958-she , and lifting [her]958-she small face between [his]143-hugo jocelyn hands , kissed it tenderly . " Bless [thee]958-she ! [No child of [my]143-hugo jocelyn own]3311-no child of my own could be dearer than [thou]958-she art ! [She]958-she trembled under [his]143-hugo jocelyn caress , and [her]958-she heart was full of speechless sorrow . [She]958-she longed to yield to [his]143-hugo jocelyn wishes,--she knew that if [she]958-she did so [she]958-she would give [him]143-hugo jocelyn happiness and greater resignation to the death which confronted [him]143-hugo jocelyn ; and [she]958-she also knew that if [she]958-she could make up [her]958-she mind to marry [Robin Clifford]84-robin [she]958-she would have the best and the tenderest of [husbands]959-husbands . And [Briar Farm,--the beloved old home]960-briar farm,--the beloved old home -- would be [hers!--her]961-hers!--her very own ! [[Her]958-she children]962-her children would inherit [it]960-briar farm,--the beloved old home and play about [the fair and fruitful fields]963-the fair and fruitful fields as [she]958-she had done -- [they]962-her children , too , could be taught to love the memory of [the old knight]964-the old knight , [the Sieur [Amadis de Jocelin]138-the sieur amadis]965-the sieur amadis de jocelin -- ah!--but surely it was the spirit of [the Sieur Amadis]138-the sieur amadis [himself]138-the sieur amadis that held [her]958-she back and prevented [her]958-she from doing [his]138-the sieur amadis name and memory grievous wrong ! [She]958-she was not of [his]138-the sieur amadis blood or race -- [she]958-she was nameless and illegitimate,--no good could come of [her]958-she engrafting [herself]958-she like a weed upon a branch of [the old noble stock]966-the old noble stock -- [the farm]2744-the farm would cease to prosper .

So [she]958-she thought and so [she]958-she felt , in [her]958-she dreamy imaginative way , and though [she]958-she allowed [old Hugo]143-hugo jocelyn to leave [her]958-she without vexing [him]143-hugo jocelyn by any decided opposition to [his]143-hugo jocelyn plans , [she]958-she was more than ever firmly resolved to abide by [her]958-she own interior sense of what was right and fitting . [She]958-she heard the wheels of the dog - cart grating the gravel outside the garden gate , and an affectionate impulse moved [her]958-she to go and see [her]958-she " Dad "[112-landon] off . As [she]958-she made [her]958-she appearance under the rose - covered porch of [the farm - house]968-the farm - house door , [she]958-she perceived [Landon]112-landon , who at once pulled off [his]112-landon cap with an elaborate and exaggerated show of respect .

" Good - morning , [Miss Jocelyn]113-jocelyn ! "[112-landon]

[He]112-landon emphasized the surname with a touch of malice . [She]958-she coloured , but replied " Good - morning "[958-she] with a sweet composure . [He]112-landon eyed [her]958-she askance , but had no opportunity for more words , as old [Hugo]143-hugo jocelyn just then clambered up into [the dog - cart]3280-the dog - cart , and took the reins of the rather skittish young mare which was harnessed to it .

" Come on , [Landon]112-landon ! "[112-landon] [he]112-landon shouted , impatiently--"No time for farewells ! "[112-landon] Then , as [Landon]112-landon jumped up beside [him]112-landon , [he]112-landon smiled , seeing the soft , wistful face of [the girl]414-the girl watching [him]112-landon from beneath a canopy of roses .

" Take care of [the house]2762-the house while [I]112-landon 'm gone ! "[112-landon] [he]112-landon called to her;--"You'll find [Robin]84-robin in [the orchard]3313-the orchard . "[112-landon]

[He]112-landon laid the lightest flick of the whip on the mare 's ears , and [she]414-the girl trotted rapidly away .

[Innocent]152-innocent stood a moment gazing after [the retreating vehicle]971-the retreating vehicle till it disappeared,--then [she]152-innocent went slowly into [the house]2762-the house . [Robin]84-robin was in [the orchard]3313-the orchard , was [he]84-robin ? [Well!--he]152-innocent had plenty of work to do there , and [she]152-innocent would not disturb [him]84-robin . [She]152-innocent turned away from the sunshine and flowers and made [her]152-innocent way [upstairs]974-upstairs to [[her]152-innocent own room]865-her own room . How quiet and reposeful [it]865-her own room looked ! [It]865-her own room was [a beloved shrine , full of sweet memories and dreams,--there]976-a beloved shrine , full of sweet memories and dreams,--there would never be any room like [it]865-her own room in [the world]2693-the world for [her]152-innocent , [she]152-innocent well knew . Listlessly [she]152-innocent sat down at the table , and turned over the pages of an old book [she]152-innocent had been reading , but [her]152-innocent eyes were not upon it .

" [I]152-innocent wonder ! "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said , half aloud -- then paused .

The thought in [her]152-innocent mind was too daring for utterance . [She]152-innocent was picturing the possibility of going quietly away from [Briar Farm]4-briar farm all alone , and trying to make a name and career for [herself]152-innocent through the one natural gift [she]152-innocent fancied [she]152-innocent might possess , a gift which nowadays is considered almost as common as it was once admired and rare . To be [a poet]978-a poet and [romancist,--a weaver of wonderful thoughts into musical language,--this]979-romancist,--a weaver of wonderful thoughts into musical language,--this seemed to [her]152-innocent the highest of all attainment ; [the proudest emperor of [the most powerful nation on [earth]2738-earth]981-the most powerful nation on earth]980-the proudest emperor of the most powerful nation on earth was , to [her]152-innocent mind , far less than [Shakespeare,--and]162-shakespeare,--and inferior to the simplest French lyrist of old time that ever wrote a " chanson d'amour . "[979-romancist,--a weaver of wonderful thoughts into musical language,--this] But the doubt in [her]152-innocent mind was whether [she]152-innocent , personally , had any thoughts worth expressing,--any ideas which [the world]2693-the world might be the happier or the better for knowing and sharing ? [She]152-innocent drew a long breath,--the warm colour flushed [her]152-innocent cheeks and then faded , leaving [her]152-innocent very pale,--the whole outlook of [her]152-innocent life was so barren of hope or promise that [she]152-innocent dared not indulge in any dream of brighter days . On the face of it , there seemed no possible chance of leaving [Briar Farm]4-briar farm without some outside assistance -- [she]152-innocent had no money , and no means of obtaining any . Then,--even supposing [she]152-innocent could get to [London]3-london , [she]152-innocent knew [no one]2691-no one there,--she had [no friends]985-no friends . Sighing wearily , [she]152-innocent opened a deep drawer in the table at which [she]152-innocent sat , and took out a manuscript -- every page of it so neatly written as to be almost like copper - plate -- and set [herself]152-innocent to reading it steadily . There were enough written sheets to make a good - sized printed volume -- and [she]152-innocent read on for more than an hour . When [she]152-innocent lifted [her]152-innocent eyes at last they were eager and luminous .

" Perhaps , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent half whispered--"perhaps there is something in it after all!--something just a little new and out of the ordinary -- but -- how shall [I]152-innocent ever know ! "[152-innocent]

Putting the manuscript by with a lingering care , [she]152-innocent went to the window and looked out . The peaceful scene was dear and familiar -- and [she]152-innocent already felt a premonition of the pain [she]152-innocent would have to endure in leaving so sweet and safe [a home]986-a home . [Her]152-innocent thoughts gradually recurred to the old trouble -- [Robin]84-robin , and [Robin]84-robin 's love for her,--Robin , who , if [she]152-innocent married [him]84-robin , would spend [his]84-robin life gladly in the effort to make [her]152-innocent happy,--where in [the wide world]987-the wide world would [she]152-innocent find [a better , truer - hearted man]988-a better , truer - hearted man ? And yet -- a curious reluctance had held [her]152-innocent back from [him]84-robin , even when [she]152-innocent had believed [herself]152-innocent to be [the actual daughter of [Hugo Jocelyn,--and]163-hugo jocelyn,--and]989-the actual daughter of hugo jocelyn,--and now -- now , when [she]152-innocent knew [she]152-innocent was nothing but [a stray foundling , deserted by [[her]152-innocent own parents and left to the care of [strangers]992-strangers]991-her own parents and left to the care of strangers]990-a stray foundling , deserted by her own parents and left to the care of strangers , [she]152-innocent considered it would be nothing short of shame and disgrace to [him]84-robin , were [she]152-innocent to become [[his]84-robin wife]706-his wife .

" [I]152-innocent can always be [[his]84-robin friend]3314-his friend , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said to herself--"And if [I]152-innocent once make [him]84-robin understand clearly how much better it is for [us]3315-us to be like [brother]3316-brother and [sister]3317-sister , [he]84-robin will see things in the right way . And when [he]84-robin marries [I]152-innocent am sure to be fond of [[his]84-robin wife]706-his wife and [children]3319-children -- and -- and -- it will be ever so much happier for [us]3315-us all ! [I]152-innocent 'll go and talk to [him]84-robin now . "[152-innocent]

[She]152-innocent ran [downstairs]994-downstairs and out across [the garden]415-the garden , and presently made a sudden appearance in [the orchard]3313-the orchard -- a little vision of white among the russet - coloured trees with their burden of reddening apples . [Robin]84-robin was there alone -- [he]84-robin was busied in putting up a sturdy prop under one of the longer branches of a tree heavily laden with fruit . [He]84-robin saw [her]152-innocent and smiled -- but went on with [his]84-robin work .

" Are [you]84-robin very busy ? "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent asked , approaching [him]84-robin almost timidly .

" Just now , yes ! In a moment , no ! [We]3320-we shall lose this big bough in the next high wind if [I]152-innocent do n't take care . "[152-innocent]

[She]152-innocent waited -- watching the strength and dexterity of [his]84-robin hands and arms , and the movements of [his]84-robin light muscular figure . In a little while [he]84-robin had finished all [he]84-robin had to do -- and turning to [her]152-innocent said , laughingly--

" Now [I]152-innocent am at [your]152-innocent service ! [You]152-innocent look very serious!--grave as [a little judge]3321-a little judge , and quite reproachful ! What have [I]152-innocent done?--or what has [anybody]3114-anybody done that [you]152-innocent should almost frown at [me]152-innocent on this bright sun - shiny morning ? "[152-innocent]

[She]152-innocent smiled in response to [his]84-robin gay , questioning look .

" [I]152-innocent 'm sorry [I]152-innocent have such a depressing aspect , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said--"I do n't feel very happy , and [I]84-robin suppose [my]84-robin face shows it . "[84-robin]

[He]84-robin was silent for a minute or two , watching [her]152-innocent with a grave tenderness in [his]84-robin eyes .

By and by [he]84-robin spoke , gently--

" Come and stroll about a bit with [me]84-robin through the orchard,--it will cheer [you]152-innocent to see the apples hanging in such rosy clusters among the grey - green leaves . Nothing prettier in all [the world]2693-the world , [I]84-robin think!--and they are just ripening enough to be fragrant . Come , [dear]2830-dear ! Let [us]997-we talk [our]997-we troubles out ! "[84-robin]

[She]152-innocent walked by [his]84-robin side , mutely -- and [they]997-we moved slowly together under the warm scented boughs , through which the sunlight fell in broad streams of gold , making the interlacing shadows darker by contrast . There was a painful throbbing in [her]152-innocent throat,--the tension of struggling tears which strove for an outlet,--but gradually the sweet influences of the air and sunshine did good work in calming [her]152-innocent nerves , and [she]152-innocent was quite composed when [Robin]84-robin spoke again .

" [You]152-innocent see , [dear]2830-dear , [I]84-robin know quite well what is worrying [you]152-innocent . [I]84-robin 'm worried [myself]84-robin -- and [I]84-robin 'd better tell [you]152-innocent all about it . Last night-- "[84-robin] [he]84-robin paused .

[She]152-innocent looked up at [him]84-robin , quickly .

" Last night?--Well ? "[152-innocent]

" Well -- [Ned Landon]112-landon was in hiding in the bushes under [your]152-innocent window -- and [he]112-landon must have been [there]2972-there all the time [we]997-we were talking together . " [I]152-innocent never could ! [Even]3389-she Priscilla!--when [she]3389-she asks [you]1010-you to ' listen to reason , ' [she]3389-she 's in the worst of tempers ! " Yes -- if _ [I]1010-you _ may too ! "[1010-you] [he]1010-you answered , kissing the hand [he]1010-you held , with lingering tenderness .

The soft colour flew over [her]152-innocent cheeks,--she smiled .

" Poor [Robin]84-robin ! "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said--"You deserve to be happy and [you]1010-you will be!--not with [me]152-innocent , but with [some one]3392-some one much better , and ever so much prettier ! [I]152-innocent can see [you]1010-you as [the master of [Briar Farm]4-briar farm]3178-the master of briar farm -- [such a sweet home for [you]1010-you and [[your]1010-you wife]3364-your wife]3394-such a sweet home for you and your wife , and all [[your]1010-you little children]3396-your little children running about in [the fields]2706-the fields among the buttercups and daisies -- a pretty sight , [Robin!--I]108-robin!--i shall think of it often when -- when [I]152-innocent am far away ! "[152-innocent]

[He]1010-you was about to utter a protest,--she stopped [him]1010-you by a gesture .

" Hush ! "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said .

And there was a moment 's silence .

CHAPTER VI

" When [I]152-innocent think about love , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent began presently , in a soft dreamy voice--"I'm quite sure that [very few people]3398-very few people ever really feel it or understand it . It must be the rarest thing in all [the world]2693-the world ! [This poor Sieur Amadis]138-the sieur amadis , asleep so long in [his]138-the sieur amadis grave , was a true lover,--and [I]152-innocent will tell [you]1010-you how [I]152-innocent know [he]138-the sieur amadis had said good - bye to love when [he]138-the sieur amadis married . All those books [we]3400-we found in the old dower - chest , that day when [we]3400-we were playing about together as [children]3319-children , belonged to [him]138-the sieur amadis -- some are [his]138-the sieur amadis own compositions , written by [his]138-the sieur amadis own hand,--the others , as [you]1010-you know , are printed books which must have been difficult to get in [his]138-the sieur amadis day , and are now , [I]152-innocent suppose , quite out of date and almost unknown . [I]152-innocent have read them all!--my head is a little library full of odd volumes ! But there is one -- a manuscript book -- which [I]152-innocent never tire of reading,--it is a sort of journal in which [the Sieur Amadis]138-the sieur amadis wrote down many of [his]138-the sieur amadis own feelings -- sometimes in prose , sometimes in verse -- and by following them carefully and piecing them together , it is quite easy to find out [his]138-the sieur amadis sadness and secret -- how [he]138-the sieur amadis loved once and never loved again-- "[152-innocent]

" [You]1013-she ca n't tell that , "[1013-she] interrupted [Robin--"men]167-robin--"men often say [they]167-robin--"men can only love once -- but [they]167-robin--"men love ever so many times-- "[152-innocent]

[She]1013-she smiled -- and [her]1013-she eyes showed [him]1014-he what a stupid blunder [he]1014-he had made .

" Do [they]167-robin--"men ? "[1013-she] [she]1013-she queried , softly--"I am so glad , [Robin]84-robin ! For [you]84-robin will find it easy then to love [somebody else]3402-somebody else instead of [me]1013-she ! "[1013-she]

[He]1014-he flushed , vexedly .

" [I]1014-he did n't mean that-- "[1014-he] [he]1014-he began .

" No ? [I]1016-i think [you]84-robin did!--but of course if [you]84-robin had thought twice [you]84-robin would n't have said it ! It was uttered quite truly and naturally , [Robin!--don't]168-robin!--don't regret it ! Only [I]1016-i want to explain to [you]84-robin that [the Sieur Amadis]138-the sieur amadis was not like that -- [he]138-the sieur amadis loved just once -- and [the lady [he]138-the sieur amadis loved]3384-the lady he loved must have been [a very beautiful woman who had plenty of [admirers]3405-admirers and did not care for [him]138-the sieur amadis at all]3404-a very beautiful woman who had plenty of admirers and did not care for him at all . All [he]138-the sieur amadis writes proves that . [He]138-the sieur amadis is always grieved to the heart about it . Still [he]138-the sieur amadis loved [her]3384-the lady he loved -- and [he]138-the sieur amadis seems glad to have loved [her]3384-the lady he loved , though it was all no use . And [he]138-the sieur amadis kept a little chronicle of [his]138-the sieur amadis dreams and fancies -- all that [he]138-the sieur amadis felt and thought about,--it is beautifully and tenderly written all in quaint old French . [I]1016-i had some trouble to make it out -- but [I]1016-i did at last -- every word -- and when [he]138-the sieur amadis made up [his]138-the sieur amadis mind to marry , [he]138-the sieur amadis finished the little book and never wrote another word in it . Shall [I]1016-i tell [you]1016-i what were the last lines [he]138-the sieur amadis wrote ? "[1016-i]

" It would n't be any use , "[1015-he] [he]1015-he answered , kissing again the hand [he]1015-he held--"I do n't understand French . [I]1016-i 've never even tried to learn it . "[1016-i]

[She]1016-i laughed .

" [I]1016-i know [you]1015-he have n't ! But [you]1015-he 've missed a great deal , [Robin!--you]151-robin!--you have really ! When [I]1016-i made up [my]1016-i mind to find out all the [Sieur Amadis]138-the sieur amadis had written , [I]1016-i got [Priscilla]121-priscilla to buy [me]1016-i a French dictionary and grammar and some other French lesson - books besides -- then [I]1016-i spelt all the words carefully and looked them all up in the dictionary , and learned the pronunciation from one of the lesson - books -- and by - and - bye it got quite easy . For two years at least it was dreadfully hard work -- but now -- well!--I think [I]1016-i could almost speak French if [I]1016-i had the chance ! "[1016-i]

" [I]84-robin 'm sure [you]1016-i could ! "[84-robin] said [Robin]84-robin , looking at [her]1016-i , admiringly--"You're [a clever little girl]3406-a clever little girl and could do anything [you]1016-i wanted to . "[84-robin]

[Her]1016-i brows contracted a little,--the easy lightness of [his]84-robin compliment had that air of masculine indifference which is more provoking to [an intelligent woman]1017-an intelligent woman than downright contradiction . The smile lingered in [her]1016-i eyes , however,--a smile of mingled amusement and compassion .

" Well , [I]1016-i wanted to understand the writing of [the Sieur Amadis]138-the sieur amadis , "[1016-i] [she]1016-i went on , quietly--"and when [I]1016-i could understand them [I]1016-i translated them . So [I]1016-i can tell [you]84-robin the last words [he]964-the old knight wrote in [his]964-the old knight journal -- just before [he]964-the old knight married,--in fact on the very eve of [his]964-the old knight marriage - day-- "[1016-i] [She]1016-i paused abruptly , and looked for a moment at [the worn and battered tomb of [the old knight]964-the old knight]1018-the worn and battered tomb of the old knight , green with moss and made picturesque by a trailing branch of wild roses that had thrown itself across [the stone effigy]1020-the stone effigy in an attempt to reach some of [[its]1020-the stone effigy neighbours]1021-its neighbours on the opposite side . [Robin]84-robin followed [her]1016-i gaze with [his]84-robin own , and for a moment was more than usually impressed by the calm , almost stern dignity of [the recumbent figure]1022-the recumbent figure .

" Go on , "[84-robin] [he]84-robin said--"What were the words ? "[169-innocent]

" [These"--and[84-robin] Innocent]169-innocent spoke them in a hushed voice , with sweet reverence and feeling--"'Tonight [I]84-robin pull down and put away for ever the golden banner of [my]84-robin life 's ideal . It has been held aloft too long in the sunshine of a dream , and the lily broidered on its web is but a withered flower . [My]84-robin life is no longer of use to [myself]84-robin , but as [a man]2681-a man and [faithful knight]3408-faithful knight [I]84-robin will make it serve another 's pleasure and another 's good . And because [this good and simple girl]3409-this good and simple girl doth truly love [me]84-robin , though [her]3409-this good and simple girl love was none of [my]84-robin seeking , [I]84-robin will give [her]3409-this good and simple girl [her]3409-this good and simple girl heart 's desire , though [mine]84-robin own heart 's desire shall never be accomplished,--I will make [her]3409-this good and simple girl [[my]84-robin wife]3339-my wife , and will be to [her]3409-this good and simple girl [a true and loyal husband]3411-a true and loyal husband , so that [she]3409-this good and simple girl may receive from [me]84-robin all [she]3409-this good and simple girl craves of happiness and peace . For though [I]84-robin fain would die rather than [we]3412-we d , [I]84-robin know that life is not given to [a man]2681-a man to live selfishly , nor is [God]80-god satisfied to have it wasted by [any one who hath sworn to be [[His]2681-a man knight and [servant]3416-servant]3415-his knight and servant]3414-any one who hath sworn to be his knight and servant . Therefore even so let it be!--I give all [my]84-robin unvalued existence to [her]3409-this good and simple girl who doth consider it valuable , and with all [my]84-robin soul [I]84-robin pray that [I]84-robin may make [so gentle and trustful a creature]3417-so gentle and trustful a creature happy . But to [Love]91-love -- oh , to [Love]91-love a long farewell!--farewell [my]84-robin dreams!--farewell ambition!--farewell the glory of the vision unattainable!--farewell bright splendour of an earthly Paradise!--for now [I]84-robin enter [that prison]3418-that prison which shall hold [me]84-robin fast till death release [me]84-robin ! Close , doors!--fasten , locks!--be patient in [thy]3419-thy silent solitude , [[my]84-robin Soul]3420-my soul ! ' "[84-robin]

[Innocent]169-innocent 's voice faltered here -- then [she]169-innocent said--"That is the end . [He]84-robin signed it ' [Amadis]138-the sieur amadis . ' "[169-innocent]

[Robin]84-robin was very quiet for a minute or two .

" It 's pretty -- very pretty and touching -- and all that sort of thing , "[84-robin] [he]84-robin said at last--"but it 's like some old sonnet or mediaeval bit of romance . [No one]2691-no one would go on like that nowadays . "[169-innocent]

[Innocent]169-innocent lifted [her]169-innocent eyebrows , quizzically .

" Go on like what ? "[169-innocent]

[He]84-robin moved impatiently .

" Oh , about being patient in solitude with [one]2752-one 's soul , and saying farewell to love . "[84-robin] [He]84-robin gave a short laugh . " [Innocent]169-innocent dear , [I]84-robin wish [you]169-innocent would see [the world]2693-the world as it really is!--not through the old - style spectacles of [the Sieur Amadis]138-the sieur amadis ! In [his]84-robin day [people]2701-people were altogether different from what [they]2701-people are now . "[84-robin]

" [I]169-innocent 'm sure [they]2701-people were ! "[169-innocent] [she]169-innocent answered , quietly--"But love is the same to - day as it was then . "[169-innocent]

[He]84-robin considered a moment , then smiled .

" No , [dear]2830-dear , [I]84-robin 'm not sure that it is , "[84-robin] [he]84-robin said . " [Those knights]3426-those knights and [poets]3427-poets and [curious people of that kind]3428-curious people of that kind lived in a sort of imaginary ecstasy -- [they]2701-people exaggerated [their]2701-people emotions and lived at the top - height of [their]2701-people fancies . [We]3429-we in [our]3429-we time are much more sane and level - headed . And it 's much better for [us]3429-we in the long run . "[84-robin]

[She]169-innocent made no reply . Only very gently [she]169-innocent withdrew [her]169-innocent hand from [his]84-robin .

" [I]84-robin 'm not [a knight of old]3430-a knight of old , "[84-robin] [he]84-robin went on , turning [his]84-robin handsome , sun - browned face towards her,--"but [I]84-robin 'm sure [I]84-robin love [you]169-innocent as much as ever [the Sieur Amadis]138-the sieur amadis could have loved [[his]138-the sieur amadis unknown lady]3431-his unknown lady . So much indeed do [I]84-robin love [you]169-innocent that [I]84-robin could n't write about it to save [my]84-robin life!--though [I]84-robin did write verses at [Oxford]6-oxford once -- very bad ones ! "[84-robin] [He]84-robin laughed . " But [I]84-robin can do one thing [the Sieur Amadis]138-the sieur amadis did n't do -- [I]84-robin can keep faithful to [my]84-robin Vision of the glory unattainable'--and if [I]84-robin do n't marry [you]169-innocent [I]84-robin 'll marry no - body -- so there ! "[84-robin]

[She]1023-she looked at [him]84-robin curiously and wistfully .

" [You]84-robin will not be so foolish , "[1023-she] [she]1023-she said--"You will not put [me]84-robin into the position of [the Sieur Amadis]138-the sieur amadis , who married [some one who loved [him]138-the sieur amadis]3432-some one who loved him , merely out of pity ! "[84-robin]

[He]84-robin sprang up from the grass beside [her]1023-she .

" No , no ! [I]1023-she wo n't do that , [Innocent]169-innocent ! [I]1023-she 'm not [a coward]3433-a coward ! If [you]169-innocent ca n't love [me]1023-she , [you]169-innocent shall not marry [me]1023-she , just because [you]169-innocent are sorry for [me]1023-she ! That would be intolerable ! [I]1023-she would n't have [you]169-innocent for [a wife at all under such circumstances]3434-a wife at all under such circumstances . [I]1023-she shall be perfectly happy as [a bachelor]3435-a bachelor -- perhaps happier than if [I]1023-she married . "[1023-she]

" And what about [Briar Farm]4-briar farm ? "[1023-she] [she]1023-she asked .

" [Briar Farm]4-briar farm can get on as best it may ! "[1024-he] [he]1024-he replied , cheerily--"I'll work on it as long as [I]1024-he live and hand it down to [some one worthy of it]3436-some one worthy of it , never fear ! So there , [Innocent!--be]154-innocent!--be happy , and do n't worry [yourself]169-innocent ! Keep to [[your]169-innocent old knight]3437-your old knight and [your]169-innocent strange fancies about [him]3437-your old knight -- [you]169-innocent may be right in [your]169-innocent ideas of love , or [you]169-innocent may be wrong ; but the great point with [me]1024-he is that [you]169-innocent should be happy -- and if [you]169-innocent can not be happy in [my]1024-he way , why [you]169-innocent must just be happy in [your]169-innocent own ! "[1024-he]

[She]1023-she looked at [him]1024-he with a new interest , as [he]1024-he stood upright , facing [her]1023-she in all the vigour and beauty of [his]1024-he young manhood . A little smile crept round the corners of [her]1023-she mouth .

" [You]1024-he are really [a very handsome boy]3438-a very handsome boy ! "[1023-she] [she]1023-she said--"Quite a picture in [your]1024-he way ! [Some girl]3439-some girl will be very proud of [you]1024-he ! "[1024-he]

[He]1024-he gave a movement of impatience .

" [I]1024-he must go back to [the orchard]3313-the orchard , "[1024-he] [he]1024-he said--"There 's plenty to do . And after all , work 's the finest thing in [the world]2693-the world -- quite as fine as love -- perhaps finer ! "[1024-he]

A faint sense of compunction moved [her]1023-she at [his]1024-he words -- [she]1023-she was conscious of a lurking admiration for [his]1024-he cool , strong , healthy attitude towards life and the things of life . And yet [she]1023-she was resentful that [he]1024-he should be capable of considering anything in [the world]2693-the world " finer "[1024-he] than love . Work ? What work ? Pruning trees and gathering apples ? Surely there were greater ambitions than these ? [She]1023-she watched [him]1024-he thoughtfully under the fringe of [her]1023-she long eyelashes , as [he]1024-he moved off .

" Going to [the orchard]3313-the orchard ? "[1023-she] [she]1023-she asked .

" Yes . "[1024-he]

[She]1023-she smiled a little .

" That 's right ! "[1023-she]

[He]1024-he glanced back at [her]1023-she . Had [she]1023-she known how bravely [he]1024-he restrained [himself]1024-he [she]1023-she might have made as much a hero of [him]1024-he as of [the knight Amadis]1026-the knight amadis . For [he]1024-he was wounded to the heart -- [his]1024-he brightest hopes were frustrated , and at the very instant [he]1024-he walked away from [her]1023-she [he]1024-he would have given [his]1024-he life to have held [her]1023-she for a moment in [his]1024-he arms,--to have kissed [her]1023-she lips , and whispered to [her]1023-she the pretty , caressing love - nonsense which to warm and tender hearts is the sweetest language in [the world]2693-the world . And with all [his]1024-he restrained passion [he]1024-he was irritated with what , from [a man]2681-a man 's point of view , [he]1024-he considered folly on [her]1023-she part,--he felt that [she]1023-she despised [his]1024-he love and [himself]1024-he for no other reason than a mere romantic idea , bred of loneliness and too much reading of a literature alien to the customs and manners of the immediate time , and an uncomfortable premonition of fear for [her]1023-she future troubled [his]1024-he mind .

" [Poor little girl]2953-poor little girl ! "[1024-he] [he]1024-he thought--"She does not know the world!--and when [she]1023-she DOES come to know it -- ah , [[my]1024-he poor [Innocent!--I]170-innocent!--i]3444-my poor innocent!--i would rather [she]1023-she never knew ! "[1024-he]

Meanwhile [she]1023-she , left to [herself]1023-she , was not without a certain feeling of regret . [She]1023-she was not sure of [her]1023-she own mind -- and [she]1023-she had no control over [her]1023-she own fancies . Every now and then a wave of conviction came over [her]1023-she that after all tender - hearted old [Priscilla]121-priscilla might be right -- that it would be best to marry [Robin]84-robin and help [him]84-robin to hold and keep [Briar Farm]4-briar farm as [it]4-briar farm had ever been kept and held since the days of [the Sieur Amadis]138-the sieur amadis . Perhaps , had [she]1023-she never heard the story of [her]1023-she actual condition , as told [her]1023-she by [Farmer Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn on the previous night , [she]1023-she might have consented to what seemed so easy and pleasant a lot in life ; but now it seemed to [her]1023-she more than impossible . [She]1023-she no longer had any link with [the far - away ancestor who had served [her]1023-she so long as a sort of ideal -- [she]1023-she was [a mere foundling]1030-a mere foundling without any name save the unbaptised appellation of [Innocent]169-innocent]1029-the far - away ancestor who had served her so long as a sort of ideal -- she was a mere foundling without any name save the unbaptised appellation of innocent . And [she]1023-she regarded [herself]1023-she as [a sort of castaway]1031-a sort of castaway .

[She]1023-she went into [the house]2762-the house soon after [Robin]84-robin had left [her]1023-she , and busied [herself]1023-she with sorting the linen and looking over what had to be mended . " For when [I]1023-she go , "[1023-she] [she]1023-she said to [herself]1023-she , " [they]3445-they must find everything in order . "[1023-she] [She]1023-she dined alone with [Priscilla]121-priscilla -- [Robin]84-robin sent word that [he]84-robin was too busy to come in . [She]1023-she was a little piqued at this -- and almost cross when [he]84-robin sent the same message at tea - time,--but [she]1023-she was proud in [her]1023-she way and would not go out to see if [she]1023-she could persuade [him]84-robin to leave [his]84-robin work for half - an - hour . The sun was slowly declining when [she]1023-she suddenly put down [her]1023-she sewing , struck by a thought which had not previously occurred to [her]1023-she -- and ran fleetly across [the garden]415-the garden to [the orchard]3313-the orchard , where [she]1023-she found [Robin]84-robin lying on [his]84-robin back under the trees with closed eyes . [He]84-robin opened them , hearing the light movement of [her]1023-she feet and the soft flutter of [her]1023-she gown -- but [he]84-robin did not rise . [She]1023-she stopped -- looking at [him]84-robin .

" Were [you]84-robin asleep ? "[1023-she]

[He]84-robin stretched [his]84-robin arms above [his]84-robin head , lazily .

" [I]84-robin believe [I]84-robin was ! "[84-robin] [he]84-robin answered , smiling .

" And [you]1023-she would n't come in to tea ! "[1023-she] This with a touch of annoyance .

" Oh yes , [I]84-robin would , if [I]84-robin had wanted tea , "[84-robin] [he]84-robin replied--"but [I]1023-she did n't want it . "[1023-she]

" Nor [[my]1023-she company]3446-my company , [I]1023-she suppose , "[1023-she] [she]1023-she added , with a little shrug of [her]1023-she shoulders . [His]84-robin eyes flashed mischievously .

" Oh , [I]84-robin daresay that had something to do with it ! "[84-robin] [he]84-robin agreed .

A curious vexation fretted [her]1023-she . [She]1023-she wished [he]84-robin would not look so handsome -- and -- yes!--so indifferent . An impression of loneliness and desertion came over [her]1023-she -- [he]84-robin , [Robin]84-robin , was not the same to [her]1023-she now -- so [she]1023-she fancied -- no doubt [he]84-robin had been thinking hard all the day while doing [his]84-robin work , and at last had come to the conclusion that it was wisest after all to let [her]1023-she go and cease to care for [her]1023-she as [he]84-robin had done . A little throbbing pulse struggled in [her]1023-she throat -- a threat of rising tears,--but [she]1023-she conquered the emotion and spoke in a voice which , though it trembled , was sweet and gentle .

" [Robin]84-robin , "[1023-she] [she]1023-she said--"don't [you]84-robin think -- wouldn't it be better -- perhaps-- "[1023-she]

[He]84-robin looked up at [her]1023-she wonderingly -- [she]1023-she seemed nervous or frightened .

" What is it ? "[84-robin] [he]84-robin asked--"Anything [you]1023-she want [me]1023-she to do ? "[1023-she]

" Yes"--and[84-robin] [her]1023-she eyes drooped--"but [I]1023-she hardly like to say it . [You]1023-she see , [Dad]85-dad made up [his]85-dad mind this morning that [we]3447-we were to settle things together -- and [he]85-dad 'll be angry and disappointed-- "[1023-she]

[Robin]84-robin half - raised [himself]84-robin on one arm .

" [He]85-dad 'll be angry and disappointed if [we]3447-we do n't settle it , [you]1023-she mean , "[84-robin] [he]84-robin said--"and [we]3447-we certainly have n't settled it . Well ? "[1023-she]

A faint colour flushed [her]1023-she face .

" Could n't [we]3447-we pretend it 's all right for the moment ? "[1023-she] [she]1023-she suggested--"Just to give [him]85-dad a little peace of mind ? "[84-robin]

[He]84-robin looked at [her]1023-she steadily .

" [You]1023-she mean , could n't [we]3447-we deceive [him]85-dad ? "[84-robin]

" Yes!--for [his]85-dad good ! [He]85-dad has deceived [ME]84-robin all [my]84-robin life,--I suppose for [MY]84-robin good -- though it has turned out badly-- "[84-robin]

" Has it ? Why ? "[84-robin]

" It has left [me]1023-she nameless , "[1023-she] [she]1023-she answered,--"and friendless . "[84-robin]

A sudden rush of tears blinded [her]1023-she eyes -- [she]1023-she put [her]1023-she hands over them . [He]84-robin sprang up and , taking hold of [her]1023-she slender wrists , tried to draw those hands down . [He]84-robin succeeded at last , and looked wistfully into [her]1023-she face , quivering with restrained grief .

" [Dear]2830-dear , [I]84-robin will do what [you]1023-she like ! "[84-robin] [he]84-robin said . " Tell [me]84-robin -- what is [your]1023-she wish ? "[84-robin]

[She]1023-she waited a moment , till [she]1023-she had controlled [herself]1023-she a little .

" [I]84-robin thought"--she[84-robin] said , then--"that [we]3449-we might tell [Dad]85-dad just for to - night that [we]3449-we are engaged -- it would make [him]85-dad happy -- and perhaps in a week or two [we]3449-we might get up a quarrel together and break it off-- "[84-robin]

[Robin]84-robin smiled .

" [Dear]85-dad little girl!--I'm afraid the plan would n't work ! [He]85-dad wants [the banns]3284-the banns put up on Sunday -- and this is Wednesday . "[84-robin]

[Her]1023-she brows knitted perplexedly .

" Something can be managed before then , "[1023-she] [she]1023-she said . " [Robin]84-robin , [I]1023-she can not bear to disappoint [him]85-dad ! [He]85-dad 's old -- and [he]85-dad 's so ill too!--it would n't hurt [us]3449-we for one night to say [we]3449-we are engaged ! "[1023-she]

" All right!"--and[84-robin] [Robin]84-robin threw back [his]84-robin head and laughed joyously--"I do n't mind ! The sensation of even imagining [I]84-robin 'm engaged to [you]1023-she is quite agreeable ! For one evening , at least , [I]84-robin can assume a sort of proprietorship over [you]1023-she ! [Innocent]169-innocent ! [I]84-robin -- [I--]84-robin "[84-robin]

[He]84-robin looked so mirthful and mischievous that [she]1023-she smiled , though the teardrops still sparkled on [her]1023-she lashes .

" Well ? What are [you]84-robin thinking of now ? "[1023-she] [she]1023-she asked .

" [I]84-robin think -- [I]84-robin really think -- under the circumstances [I]84-robin ought to kiss [you]84-robin ! " [I]1023-she can not act a kiss , "[1023-she] [she]1023-she said--"You can , if [you]84-robin like ! [I]84-robin do n't mind . "[84-robin]

" [You]84-robin do n't mind ? "[1023-she]

" No . "[84-robin]

[He]84-robin looked from right to left -- the apple - boughs , loaded with rosy fruit , were intertwined above them like a canopy -- the sinking sun made mellow gold of all the air , and touched [the girl]414-the girl 's small figure with a delicate luminance -- [his]84-robin heart beat , and for a second [his]84-robin senses swam in a giddy whirl of longing and ecstasy -- then [he]84-robin suddenly pulled [himself]84-robin together .

" [Dear Innocent]152-innocent , [I]84-robin would n't kiss [you]152-innocent for [the world]2693-the world ! "[84-robin]

[She]414-the girl drew a long breath of evident relief .

" Then [you]84-robin 'll tell [[your]84-robin uncle--]3456-your uncle-- "[414-the girl]

" [He]3456-your uncle-- may have been kept by some business , "[414-the girl] [she]414-the girl said--"He wo n't be long now . [You]84-robin 'll say [we]3458-we 're engaged ? "[84-robin]

" Yes . "[414-the girl]

" And perhaps"--went[84-robin] on [Innocent--"you]84-robin might ask [him]3456-your uncle-- not to have the banns put up yet as [we]3458-we do n't want it known quite so soon-- "[414-the girl]

[Her]414-the girl eyes shone upon [him]84-robin with a grateful tenderness .

" [You]414-the girl are very good , [Robin]84-robin ! "[414-the girl]

[He]84-robin laughed .

" Good ! Not [I]414-the girl ! "[84-robin]

" And do not poets help [you]84-robin to understand [Nature]89-nature ? "[152-innocent] asked [Innocent]152-innocent .

"[152-innocent]

[Innocent]152-innocent 's eyes regarded [him]1037-you with quiet admiration .
