[She]152-innocent turned away then , and moved towards [the house]2762-the house . As [she]152-innocent went , [she]152-innocent suddenly stopped and clapped [her]152-innocent hands , calling :

" [Cupid]83-cupid ! [Cupid]83-cupid ! Cu - COO - pid ! "[152-innocent]

A flash of white wings glimmered in the sunset - light , and [her]152-innocent pet dove flew to [her]152-innocent , circling round and round till it dropped on [her]152-innocent outstretched arm . [She]152-innocent caught it to [her]152-innocent bosom , kissing its soft head tenderly , and murmuring playful words to it . [Robin]84-robin watched [her]152-innocent , as with [this favourite bird - playmate]1039-this favourite bird - playmate [she]152-innocent disappeared across [the garden]415-the garden and into [the house]2762-the house . Then [he]84-robin gave a gesture half of despair , half of resignation -- and left [the orchard]3313-the orchard .

The sun sank , and the evening shadows began to steal slowly in their long darkening lines over [the quiet fields]1043-the quiet fields , and yet [Farmer Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn had not yet returned . [The women of the household]1044-the women of the household grew anxious -- [Priscilla]121-priscilla went to the door many times , looking up [the tortuous by - road]1045-the tortuous by - road for the first glimpse of [the expected returning vehicle]1046-the expected returning vehicle -- and [Innocent]152-innocent stood in [the garden]415-the garden near [the porch]1048-the porch , as watchful as [a sentinel]1049-a sentinel and as silent . At last the sound of trotting hoofs was heard in the far distance , and [Robin]84-robin , suddenly making [his]84-robin appearance from [the stable - yard]1050-the stable - yard where [he]84-robin too had been waiting , called cheerily,--

" [Uncle]3477-uncle at last ! Here [he]84-robin comes ! "[84-robin]

Another few minutes and the mare 's head turned the corner -- then [the whole dog - cart]1051-the whole dog - cart came into view with [Farmer Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn driving [it]1051-the whole dog - cart . But [he]84-robin was quite alone .

[Robin]84-robin and [Innocent]152-innocent exchanged surprised glances , but had no time to make any comment as [old Hugo]87-uncle hugo just then drove up and , throwing the reins to [[his]87-uncle hugo nephew]726-his nephew , alighted .

" Are n't [you]84-robin very late , [Dad]85-dad ? "[152-innocent] said [Innocent]152-innocent then , going to meet him--"I was beginning to be quite anxious ! "[152-innocent]

" Were [you]84-robin ? [Poor little one]3478-poor little one ! [I]87-uncle hugo 'm all right ! [I]87-uncle hugo had business -- [I]87-uncle hugo was kept longer than [I]87-uncle hugo expected-- "[87-uncle hugo] Here [he]87-uncle hugo turned quickly to [Robin--"Unharness]174-robin--"unharness , [boy!--unharness!--and]3479-boy!--unharness!--and come in to supper ! "[87-uncle hugo]

" Where 's [Landon]112-landon ? "[84-robin] asked [Robin]84-robin .

" [Landon]112-landon ? Oh , [I]87-uncle hugo 've left [him]112-landon in [the town]2918-the town . "[87-uncle hugo]

[He]87-uncle hugo pulled off [his]87-uncle hugo driving - gloves , and unbuttoned [his]87-uncle hugo overcoat -- then strode into [the house]2762-the house . [Innocent]152-innocent followed [him]87-uncle hugo -- [she]152-innocent was puzzled by [his]87-uncle hugo look and manner , and [her]152-innocent heart beat with a vague sense of fear . There was something about [the old man]426-the old man that was new and strange to [her]152-innocent . [She]152-innocent could not define it , but it filled [her]152-innocent mind with a curious and inexplicable uneasiness . [Priscilla]121-priscilla , who was setting the dishes on the table in the room where the cloth was laid for supper , had the same uncomfortable impression when [she]121-priscilla saw [him]87-uncle hugo enter . [His]87-uncle hugo face was unusually pale and drawn , and the slight stoop of age in [his]87-uncle hugo otherwise upright figure seemed more pronounced than usual . [He]87-uncle hugo drew up [his]87-uncle hugo chair to the table and sat down,--then ruffling [his]87-uncle hugo fine white hair over [his]87-uncle hugo brow with one hand , looked round [him]87-uncle hugo with an evidently forced smile .

" Anxious about [me]87-uncle hugo , were [you]152-innocent , [child]2801-child ? "[87-uncle hugo] [he]87-uncle hugo said , as [Innocent]152-innocent took [her]152-innocent place beside [him]87-uncle hugo . " Well , well ! [He]87-uncle hugo broke off suddenly and stared in front of [him]87-uncle hugo with strange fixed eyeballs .

[Innocent]152-innocent and [Priscilla]121-priscilla looked at [one another]1055-one another in alarm . There was a moment 's tense [stillness,--then Innocent]152-innocent said in rather a trembling voice--

Just then [Robin]84-robin entered .

"[120-farmer jocelyn]

There was another silent pause .

"[120-farmer jocelyn]

CHAPTER VII

The supper was a very silent meal . [Old Hugo]143-hugo jocelyn was evidently not inclined to converse,--he ate [his]143-hugo jocelyn food quickly , almost ravenously , without seeming to be conscious that [he]143-hugo jocelyn was eating . [Robin Clifford]84-robin glanced at [him]143-hugo jocelyn now and again watchfully , and with some anxiety,--an uncomfortable idea that there was something wrong somewhere worried him,--moreover [he]143-hugo jocelyn was troubled by the latent feeling that presently [[his]143-hugo jocelyn uncle]514-his uncle would be sure to ask if all was " settled "[514-his uncle] between [himself]143-hugo jocelyn and [Innocent]152-innocent . Strangely enough , however , [the old man]426-the old man made no allusion to the subject . [He]426-the old man seemed to have forgotten it , though it had been the chief matter on which [he]426-the old man had laid so much stress that morning . Each minute [Innocent]152-innocent expected [him]426-the old man to turn upon [her]152-innocent with the dreaded question -- to which [she]152-innocent would have had to reply untruly , according to the plan made between [herself]152-innocent and [Robin]84-robin . But to [her]152-innocent great surprise and relief [he]426-the old man said nothing that conveyed the least hint of the wish [he]426-the old man had so long cherished . [He]426-the old man was irritable and drowsy,--now and again [his]426-the old man head fell a little forward on [his]426-the old man chest and [his]426-the old man eyes closed as though in utter weariness . Seeing this , [the practical Priscilla]121-priscilla made haste to get the supper finished and cleared away .

" [You]426-the old man be off to bed , [Mister Jocelyn]102-amadis de jocelyn , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said,--"The sooner the better , for [you]426-the old man look as tired as a lame dog that ' as limped ' ome twenty miles . [You]426-the old man ai n't fit to be racketing about markets an ' drivin ' bargains . "[121-priscilla]

" Who says [I]426-the old man 'm not ? "[426-the old man] [he]426-the old man interrupted , sitting bolt upright and glaring fiercely at her--"I tell [you]426-the old man [I]426-the old man am ! [I]426-the old man can do business as well as [any man]2694-any man -- and drive a bargain - ah ! [I]426-the old man should think so indeed!--a hard - and - fast bargain!--not easy to get out of , [I]426-the old man can tell [you!--not]3491-you!--not easy to get out of ! And it has cost [me]426-the old man a pretty penny , too ! "[426-the old man]

[Robin Clifford]84-robin glanced at [him]426-the old man enquiringly .

" How 's that ? "[426-the old man] [he]426-the old man asked--"You generally make rather than spend ! "[84-robin]

[Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn gave a sudden loud laugh .

" So [I]120-farmer jocelyn do , [boy]3492-boy , so [I]120-farmer jocelyn do ! But sometimes [one]2752-one has to spend to make ! [I]120-farmer jocelyn 've done both to - day -- [I've]120-farmer jocelyn made and [I]120-farmer jocelyn 've spent . And what [I]120-farmer jocelyn 've spent is better than keeping it -- and what [I]120-farmer jocelyn 've made -- ay!--what [I]120-farmer jocelyn 've made -- well!--it 's a bargain , and [no one]2691-no one can say it is n't a fair one ! "[120-farmer jocelyn]

[He]426-the old man got up from the supper table and pushed away [his]426-the old man chair .

" [I]426-the old man 'll go , "[426-the old man] [he]426-the old man said--"Priscilla 's right -- I'm dog - tired and bed 's the best place for [me]426-the old man . "[426-the old man] [He]426-the old man passed [his]426-the old man hand over [his]426-the old man forehead . " There 's a sort of buzzing in [my]426-the old man brain like the noise of a cart - wheel -- [I]426-the old man want rest . "[426-the old man] As [he]426-the old man spoke [Innocent]152-innocent came softly beside [him]426-the old man and took [his]426-the old man arm caressingly . [He]426-the old man looked down upon [her]152-innocent with a smile . " Yes , wilding , [I]426-the old man want rest ! [We]3495-we 'll have a long talk out tomorrow -- [you]152-innocent and [I]426-the old man and [Robin]84-robin . Bless [thee]152-innocent , [child]2801-child ! Good - night ! "[426-the old man]

[He]426-the old man kissed [her]152-innocent tenderly and held out one hand to [Clifford]84-robin , who cordially grasped it .

" [Good boy]3497-good boy ! "[426-the old man] [he]426-the old man said-"Be up early , for there 's much to do -- and [Landon]112-landon wo n't be [home]2674-home till late -- no -- not till late ! Get on with the field work -- for if the clouds mean anything [we]1058-we shall have rain . "[426-the old man] [He]426-the old man paused a moment and seemed to reflect , then repeated slowly--"Yes , [lad]2838-lad ! [We]1058-we shall have rain!--and wind , and storm ! Be ready!--the fine weather 's breaking ! "[426-the old man]

With that [he]426-the old man went , walking slowly , and [they]1058-we heard [him]426-the old man stumble once or twice as [he]426-the old man went up the broad oak staircase to [[his]426-the old man bedroom]1059-his bedroom . [Priscilla]121-priscilla put [her]121-priscilla head on one side , like a meditative crow , and listened . Then [she]121-priscilla heaved a sigh , smoothed down [her]121-priscilla apron and rolled up [her]121-priscilla eyes .

" Well , if [Mister Jocelyn]102-amadis de jocelyn worn't as sober [a man]2681-a man as [any judge an ' jury]3501-any judge an ' jury , "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla observed--"I should say ' e'd bin drinkin ' ! But that ai n't it . [Mr. Robin]126-robin , there 's somethin' gone wrong with ' [im]3502-im -- an ' [I]121-priscilla do n't like it . "[121-priscilla]

" Nor [I]152-innocent , "[152-innocent] said [Innocent]152-innocent , in a trembling voice , suggestive of tears . " Oh , [Robin]126-robin , [you]126-robin surely noticed how strange [he]426-the old man looked ! [I]152-innocent 'm so afraid ! [I]152-innocent feel as if something dreadful was going to happen-- "[152-innocent]

" Nonsense ! "[126-robin] and [Robin]126-robin assumed an air of indifference which [he]126-robin was far from feeling--"Uncle [Hugo]143-hugo jocelyn is tired -- [I]126-robin think [he]143-hugo jocelyn has been put out -- [you]126-robin know [he]143-hugo jocelyn 's quick - tempered and easily irritated -- [he]143-hugo jocelyn may have had some annoyance in [the town--]3503-the town-- "[126-robin]

" Ah ! And where 's [Landon]112-landon ? "[121-priscilla] put in [Priscilla]121-priscilla , with a dark nod--"That do beat [me]121-priscilla ! Why ever [the master]2759-the master should ' ave let [a man like that go on the loose for a night]3505-a man like that go on the loose for a night an ' a day is more than [I]121-priscilla can make out ! It 's sort of tempting [Providence]15-providence -- that it is ! "[121-priscilla]

[Clifford]84-robin flushed and turned aside . [His]84-robin fight with [Landon]112-landon was fresh in [his]84-robin mind -- and [he]84-robin began to wonder whether [he]84-robin had done rightly in telling [[his]84-robin uncle]514-his uncle how it came about . But meeting [Innocent]152-innocent 's anxious eyes , which mutely asked [him]84-robin for comfort , [he]84-robin answered--

" Oh , well , there 's nothing very much in that , [Priscilla]121-priscilla ! [I]84-robin daresay [Landon]112-landon wanted a holiday -- [he]112-landon does n't ask for one often , and [he]112-landon 's kept fairly sober lately . Had n't [we]3506-we better be off to bed ? Things will straighten out with the morning . "[84-robin]

" Do [you]152-innocent really think so ? "[152-innocent] [Innocent]152-innocent sighed as [she]152-innocent put the question .

" Of course [I]84-robin think so ! "[84-robin] answered [Robin]84-robin , cheerily . " [We]3506-we 're all tired , and ca n't look on the bright side ! Sound sleep is the best cure for the blues ! Good - night , [Innocent]152-innocent ! "[84-robin]

" Good - night ! "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said , gently .

" Good - night , [Priscilla]121-priscilla ! "[84-robin]

" Good - night , [Mr. Robin]126-robin . [God]80-god bless [ye]1061-ye ! "[84-robin]

[He]84-robin smiled , nodded kindly to [them]1061-ye both , and left [the room]531-the room .

" There 's [a man for [ye]1061-ye]3507-a man for ye ! "[121-priscilla] murmured [Priscilla]121-priscilla , admiringly , as [he]84-robin disappeared--"A tower of strength for a ' usband , which [the Lord]3232-the lord knows is rare ! [Lovey]177-lovey , [you]1061-ye 'll never do better ! "[84-robin]

But [Innocent]152-innocent seemed not to hear . [Her]121-priscilla face was very pale , and [her]121-priscilla eyes had a strained wistful expression .

" [Dad]85-dad looks very ill , "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla said , slowly--"Priscilla , surely [you]152-innocent noticed-- "[121-priscilla]

" Now , [child]2801-child , do n't [you]2801-child worry--'tain't no use"--and[121-priscilla] [Priscilla]121-priscilla lit two bedroom candles , giving [Innocent]152-innocent one--"You just go up to bed and think of nothing till the morning . [Mister Jocelyn]102-amadis de jocelyn is dead beat and put out about something -- precious ' ungry too , for [he]102-amadis de jocelyn ate [his]102-amadis de jocelyn food as though [he]102-amadis de jocelyn had n't ' ad any all day . [Innocent]152-innocent said nothing more . [She]152-innocent gave a parting glance round [the room]531-the room to assure [herself]152-innocent that everything was tidy , windows bolted and all safe for the night , and for a fleeting moment the impression came over [her]152-innocent that [she]152-innocent would never see it look quite the same again . A faint cold tremor ran through [her]152-innocent delicate little body -- [she]152-innocent felt lonely and afraid . Silently [she]152-innocent followed [Priscilla]121-priscilla up the beautiful Tudor staircase to the first landing , where , moved by a tender , clinging impulse , [she]152-innocent kissed [her]121-priscilla .

" Good - night , [[you]152-innocent dear]3510-you dear , kind [Priscilla]121-priscilla ! "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla said--"You've always been good to [me]152-innocent ! "[152-innocent]

" Bless [you]152-innocent , [[my]121-priscilla lovey]3511-my lovey ! "[121-priscilla] answered [Priscilla]121-priscilla , with emotion--"Go and sleep with [the angels]3512-the angels , like [the little angel [you]152-innocent are [yourself]152-innocent]3513-the little angel you are yourself ! And mind [you]152-innocent think twice , and more than twice , before [you]152-innocent say ' No ' to [Mr. Robin]126-robin ! "[121-priscilla]

With a deprecatory shake of [her]152-innocent head , and a faint smile , [Innocent]152-innocent turned away , and passed through [the curious tortuous little corridor]1064-the curious tortuous little corridor that led to [[her]152-innocent own room]865-her own room . Once safely inside [that quiet sanctum]1066-that quiet sanctum where [the Sieur Amadis of long ago]1067-the sieur amadis of long ago had " found peace , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent set [her]152-innocent candle down on the oak table and remained standing by it for some moments , lost in thought . The pale glimmer of the single light was scarcely sufficient to disperse the shadows around [her]152-innocent , but the lattice window was open and admitted a shaft of moonlight which shed a pearly radiance on [her]152-innocent little figure , clothed in its simple white gown . Had [any artist]1068-any artist seen [her]152-innocent thus , alone and absorbed in sorrowful musing , [he]1068-any artist might have taken [her]152-innocent as [a model of Psyche]1069-a model of psyche after [[her]152-innocent god]1070-her god had flown . [She]152-innocent was weary and anxious -- life had suddenly assumed for [her]152-innocent a tragic aspect . [Old Jocelyn]143-hugo jocelyn 's manner had puzzled [her]152-innocent -- [he]143-hugo jocelyn was unlike [himself]143-hugo jocelyn , and [she]152-innocent instinctively felt that [he]143-hugo jocelyn had some secret trouble on [his]143-hugo jocelyn mind . What could it be ? [she]152-innocent wondered . Not about [herself]152-innocent and [Robin]126-robin -- for were [he]143-hugo jocelyn as keen on " putting up the banns "[143-hugo jocelyn] as [he]143-hugo jocelyn had been in the morning [he]143-hugo jocelyn would not have allowed the matter to rest . [He]143-hugo jocelyn would have asked straight questions , and [he]143-hugo jocelyn would have expected plain answers,--and [they]1071-they would , in accordance with the secret understanding [they]1071-they had made with [each other]654-each other , have deceived [him]143-hugo jocelyn . Now there was no deception necessary -- [he]143-hugo jocelyn seemed to have forgotten -- at least for the present -- [his]143-hugo jocelyn own dearest desire . With a sigh , half of pain , half of relief , [she]152-innocent seated [herself]152-innocent at the table , and opening its one deep drawer with a little key which [she]152-innocent always wore round [her]152-innocent neck , [she]152-innocent began to turn over [her]152-innocent beloved pile of manuscript , and this occupied [her]152-innocent for several minutes . Presently [she]152-innocent looked up , [her]152-innocent eyes growing brilliant with thought , and a smile on [her]152-innocent lips .

" [I]152-innocent really think it might do ! "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said , aloud--"I should not be afraid to try ! Who knows what might happen ? [I]152-innocent can but fail -- or succeed . If [I]152-innocent fail , [I]152-innocent shall have had [my]152-innocent lesson -- if [I]152-innocent succeed-- "[152-innocent]

[She]152-innocent leaned [her]152-innocent head on [her]152-innocent two hands , ruffling up [her]152-innocent pretty hair into soft golden - brown rings .

" If [I]152-innocent succeed!--ah!--if [I]152-innocent do ! Then [I]152-innocent 'll pay back everything [I]152-innocent owe to [Dad]85-dad and [Briar Farm!--oh]16-briar farm!--oh , no ! [I]152-innocent can never pay back [my]152-innocent debt to [Briar Farm!--that]17-briar farm!--that would be impossible ! "[152-innocent]

Quick tears sprang to [her]152-innocent eyes -- and the tapering light of the candle looked blurred and dim .

" Yes , after all , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent went on , still talking to the air , " it 's better and braver to try to do something in [the world]2693-the world , rather than throw [myself]152-innocent upon [Robin]126-robin , and be cowardly enough to take [him]126-robin for [a husband]3372-a husband when [I]152-innocent do n't love [him]126-robin . Just for comfort and shelter and [Briar Farm]4-briar farm ! It would be shameful . And [I]152-innocent could not marry [a man]2681-a man unless [I]152-innocent loved [him]126-robin quite desperately!--I could not ! [I]152-innocent 'm not sure that [I]152-innocent like the idea of marriage at all,--it fastens [a man]2681-a man and [woman]3519-woman together for life , and the time might come when [they]3520-they would grow tired of [each other]654-each other . How cruel and wicked it would be to force [them]3520-they to endure [each other]654-each other 's company when [they]3520-they perhaps wished the width of [the world]2693-the world between [them]3520-they ! No -- [I]152-innocent do n't think [I]152-innocent should care to be married -- certainly not to [Robin]126-robin . "[152-innocent]

[She]1073-she put [her]1073-she manuscript by , and shut and locked the drawer containing it . Then [she]1073-she went to the open lattice window and looked out -- and thought of the previous night , when [Robin]126-robin had swung [himself]126-robin up on the sill to talk to [her]1073-she , and [they]1074-they had been all unaware that [Ned Landon]112-landon was listening down below . A flush of anger heated [her]1073-she cheeks as [she]1073-she recalled this and all that [Robin]126-robin had told [her]1073-she of the unprepared attack [Landon]112-landon had made upon [him]126-robin and the ensuing fight between [them]1074-they . But now ? Was it not very strange that [Landon]112-landon should apparently be in such high favour with [Hugo Jocelyn]143-hugo jocelyn that [he]112-landon had actually been allowed to stay in [the market - town]1075-the market - town and enjoy a holiday , which for [him]112-landon only meant a bout of drunkenness ? [She]1073-she could not understand it , and [her]1073-she perplexity increased the more [she]1073-she thought of it . Leaning far out over the window - sill , [she]1073-she gazed long and lovingly across [the quiet stretches of meadowland]1076-the quiet stretches of meadowland , shining white in the showered splendour of the moon -- the tall trees -- the infinite and harmonious peace of the whole scene,--then , shutting the lattice , [she]1073-she pulled the curtains across it , and taking [her]1073-she lit candle , went to [[her]1073-she secluded inner sleeping - chamber]1077-her secluded inner sleeping - chamber , where , in the small , quaintly carved four - poster bed , furnished with ancient tapestry and lavendered linen , and covered up under a quilt embroidered three centuries back by the useful fingers of [the wife of [Sieur Amadis de Jocelin]138-the sieur amadis]1078-the wife of sieur amadis de jocelin , [she]1073-she soon fell into a sound and dreamless slumber .

The hours moved on , bearing with [them]1079-them different destinies to millions of different human lives , and the tall old clock in [the great hall of [Briar Farm]4-briar farm]1080-the great hall of briar farm told [them]1079-them off with a sonorous chime and clangour worthy of [Westminster]18-westminster [itself]18-westminster . It was a quiet night ; there was not a breath of wind to whistle through crack or key - hole , or swing open an unbolted door,--and [Hero]178-hero , [the huge mastiff that always slept " on guard "[178-hero] just within the hall entrance]1081-the huge mastiff that always slept " on guard " just within the hall entrance , had surely no cause to sit up suddenly on [his]178-hero great haunches and listen with uplifted ears to sounds which were to any other creature inaudible . Yet listen [he]178-hero did -- sharply and intently . Raising [his]178-hero massive head [he]178-hero snuffed the air -- then suddenly began to tremble as with cold , and gave vent to a long , low , dismal moan . It was a weird noise -- worse than positive howling , and the dog [himself]178-hero seemed distressfully conscious that [he]178-hero was expressing something strange and unnatural . Two or three times [he]178-hero repeated this eerie muffled cry -- then , lying down again , [he]178-hero put [his]178-hero nose between [his]178-hero great paws , and , with a deep shivering sigh , appeared to resign [himself]178-hero to the inevitable . There followed several moments of tense silence . Then came a sudden dull thud overhead , as of a heavy load falling or being thrown down , and a curious inexplicable murmur like smothered choking or groaning . Instantly the great dog sprang erect and raced up [the staircase]1082-the staircase like a mad creature , barking furiously . [The house]2762-the house was aroused -- doors were flung open -- [Priscilla]121-priscilla rushed from [[her]121-priscilla room]787-her room half dressed -- and [Innocent]152-innocent ran along [the corridor]1085-the corridor in [her]152-innocent little white nightgown , [her]152-innocent feet bare , and [her]152-innocent hair falling dishevelled over [her]152-innocent shoulders .

" What is it ? "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent cried piteously--"Oh , do tell [me]152-innocent ! What is it ? "[152-innocent]

[Robin Clifford]84-robin , hearing the dog 's persistent barking , had hastily donned coat and trousers and now appeared on the scene .

" [Hero]178-hero , [Hero]178-hero ! "[178-hero] [he]178-hero called--"Quiet , [Hero]178-hero ! "[84-robin]

But [Hero]178-hero had bounded to [[his]178-hero master]684-his master [Jocelyn]143-hugo jocelyn 's door and was pounding against it with all the force of [his]178-hero big muscular body , apparently seeking to push or break it open . [Robin]84-robin laid one hand on the animal 's collar and pulled [him]178-hero back -- then tried the door [himself]84-robin -- it was locked .

" [Uncle Hugo]87-uncle hugo ! "[178-hero]

There was no answer .

" There!--that'll be a bit warmer ! "[121-priscilla] and [she]121-priscilla signed to [one of [the farm maids near [her]121-priscilla]1091-the farm maids near her]1090-one of the farm maids near her to fetch a cloak which [she]121-priscilla carefully wrapped round [the girl]414-the girl 's shoulders . Just then the hammer was brought with other tools , and [Robin]84-robin , to save any needless clamour , took a chisel and inserted it in such a manner as should most easily force the catch of the door -- but the lock was an ancient and a strong one , and would not yield for some time . At last , with an extra powerful and dexterous movement of [his]84-robin hand , it suddenly gave way -- and [he]84-robin saw what [he]84-robin would have given worlds that [Innocent]152-innocent should not have seen -- [old Hugo]87-uncle hugo lying face forward on the floor , motionless . There was a rush and a wild cry--

" [Dad]85-dad ! [Dad]85-dad ! "[121-priscilla]

[She]121-priscilla was beside [him]84-robin in a moment , trying with all [her]121-priscilla slight strength to lift [his]84-robin head and turn [his]84-robin face .

" Help [me]121-priscilla -- oh , help [me]121-priscilla ! "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla wailed . " [He]84-robin has fainted -- [we]3526-we must lift [him]84-robin -- get some one to lift [him]84-robin on the bed . [Robin]84-robin , make [them]1093-the farm lads , roused from sleep and hastily summoned hurry ! "[121-priscilla]

[Robin]84-robin had already whispered [his]84-robin orders,--and two of [the farm lads , roused from sleep and hastily summoned]1093-the farm lads , roused from sleep and hastily summoned , were ready to do what [he]84-robin told [them]1093-the farm lads , roused from sleep and hastily summoned . As the helpless head dropped back on the pillow [they]1093-the farm lads , roused from sleep and hastily summoned saw that all was over,--the pinched ashen grey of the features and the fast glazing eyes told [their]1093-the farm lads , roused from sleep and hastily summoned own fatal story -- there was no hope . But [Innocent]152-innocent held the cold hand of [the dead man]1095-the dead man to [her]152-innocent warm young bosom , endeavouring to take from it its cureless chill .

" [He]84-robin will be better soon , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said,--"Priscilla , bring [me]121-priscilla that brandy -- just a little will revive [him]84-robin , [I]121-priscilla 'm sure . Why do [you]84-robin stand there crying ? [You]84-robin surely do n't think [he]84-robin 's dead?--No , no , that is n't possible ! It is n't possible , is it , [Robin]84-robin ? [He]84-robin 'll come to [himself]84-robin in a few minutes -- a fainting fit may last quite a long time . So [she]152-innocent spoke , tremblingly nursing the dead hand in [her]152-innocent bosom . [No one present]1096-no one present had the heart to contradict [her]152-innocent -- and [Priscilla]121-priscilla , with the tears running down [her]121-priscilla face , brought the brandy [she]121-priscilla asked for and held it while [she]121-priscilla tenderly moistened the lips of the corpse and tried to force a few drops between the clenched teeth -- in vain . This futile attempt frightened [her]121-priscilla , and [she]121-priscilla looked at [Robin Clifford]84-robin with a wild air .

" [I]121-priscilla can not make [him]84-robin swallow it , "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla said--"Can [you]84-robin , [Robin]84-robin ? [He]84-robin looks so grey and cold!--but [his]84-robin lips are quite warm . "[121-priscilla]

[Robin]84-robin , restraining the emotion that half choked [him]84-robin and threatened to overflow in womanish weeping , went up to [her]121-priscilla and tried to coax [her]121-priscilla away from the bedside .

" [Dear]2830-dear , if [you]2830-dear could leave [him]84-robin for a little it would perhaps be better , "[84-robin] [he]84-robin said . " [He]84-robin might -- [he]84-robin might recover sooner . [We]3530-we have sent for [the doctor]2825-the doctor -- [he]84-robin will be [here]2907-here directly-- "[84-robin]

" [I]414-the girl will stay here till [he]84-robin comes , "[414-the girl] replied [the girl]414-the girl , quietly . " How can [you]84-robin think [I]414-the girl would leave [Dad]85-dad when [he]84-robin 's ill ? If [we]3530-we could only rouse [him]84-robin a little-- "[414-the girl]

Ah , that " if "[84-robin] ! If [we]1098-we could only rouse [[our]1098-we beloved ones who fall into that eternal sleep]1099-our beloved ones who fall into that eternal sleep , would not all the riches and glories of [the world]2693-the world seem tame in comparison with such joy ! [Innocent]152-innocent had never seen death -- [she]152-innocent could not realise that this calm irresponsiveness , this cold and stiffening rigidity , meant an end to the love and care [she]152-innocent had known all [her]152-innocent life -- love and care which would never be replaced in quite the same way !

The first peep of a silver dawn began to peer through the lattice window , and as [she]152-innocent saw this suggestion of wakening life , a sudden dread clutched at [her]152-innocent heart and made it cold .

" It will be morning soon , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said--"Priscilla , when will [the doctor]2825-the doctor come ? "[152-innocent]

Scarcely had [she]152-innocent said the words when [the doctor]2825-the doctor entered . [He]2825-the doctor took a comprehensive glance round the room,--at the still form on the bed -- at [the little crouching girl]1102-the little crouching girl -- figure beside it -- at [Priscilla]121-priscilla , trembling and tearful -- at [Robin]84-robin , deadly pale and self - restrained -- at [the farm - lads]1103-the farm - lads and [servants]1104-servants .

" When did this happen ? "[2825-the doctor] [he]2825-the doctor said .

[Robin]84-robin told [him]2825-the doctor .

" [I]2825-the doctor see ! "[2825-the doctor] [he]2825-the doctor said . " [He]1095-the dead man must have fallen forward on getting out of bed . [I]2825-the doctor rather expected a sudden seizure of this kind . "[2825-the doctor] [He]2825-the doctor made [his]2825-the doctor brief examination . The eyes of [the dead man]1095-the dead man were open and glassily staring upward -- [he]2825-the doctor gently closed the lids over them and pressed them down .

" Nothing to be done , "[2825-the doctor] [he]2825-the doctor went on , gently--"His end was painless . "[2825-the doctor]

[Innocent]152-innocent had risen -- [she]152-innocent had laid the cold hand of the corpse back on [its]1095-the dead man breast -- and [she]152-innocent stood gazing vacantly before [her]152-innocent in utter misery .

" Nothing to be done ? "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent faltered--"Do [you]2825-the doctor mean that [you]2825-the doctor can not rouse [him]1095-the dead man ? Will [he]1095-the dead man never speak to [me]2825-the doctor again ? "[2825-the doctor]

[The doctor]2825-the doctor looked at [her]152-innocent gravely and kindly .

" Not in [this world]3261-this world , [[my]2825-the doctor dear]3270-my dear , "[2825-the doctor] [he]2825-the doctor said--"in the next -- perhaps ! Let [us]3536-us hope so ! "[2825-the doctor]

[She]152-innocent put [her]152-innocent hand up to [her]152-innocent forehead with a bewildered gesture .

" [He]1095-the dead man is dead ! "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent cried--"Dead ! Oh , [Robin]84-robin , [Robin]84-robin ! [I]2825-the doctor ca n't believe it!--it is n't true ! [Dad]85-dad , [dear Dad]3537-dear dad ! [[My]2825-the doctor only friend]3538-my only friend ! [Her]152-innocent voice quavered and broke in a passion of tears .

" [I]152-innocent loved [him]1095-the dead man as if [he]1095-the dead man were [[my]152-innocent own father]3540-my own father , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent sobbed . " And [he]1095-the dead man loved [me]152-innocent as if [I]152-innocent were [[his]1095-the dead man own child]3357-his own child ! Oh , [Dad]85-dad , [darling Dad]2957-darling dad ! [We]3543-we can never love [each other]654-each other again ! "[152-innocent]

CHAPTER VIII

The news of [Farmer Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn 's sudden death was as though a cloud - burst had broken over [the village]2885-the village , dealing utter and hopeless destruction . To [the little community of [simple workaday folk]1109-simple workaday folk living round [Briar Farm]4-briar farm]1108-the little community of simple workaday folk living round briar farm it was a greater catastrophe than the death of [any king]1110-any king . Nothing else was talked of . Nothing was done . [Men]397-men stood idly about , looking at [each other]654-each other in a kind of stupefied consternation,--women chattered and whispered at [[their]397-men cottage]1113-their cottage doors , shaking [their]397-men heads with all that melancholy profundity of wisdom which is not wise till after the event,--the [children]3319-children were less noisy in [their]3319-children play , checked by the grave faces of [[their]3319-children parents]1115-their parents -- the very dogs seemed to know that something had occurred which altered the aspect of ordinary daily things . The last of [the famous Jocelyns]180-the jocelyns was no more ! It seemed incredible . And [Briar Farm]4-briar farm ? What would become of [Briar Farm]4-briar farm ?

" There ai n't [none o ' th ' owd folk]3545-none o ' th ' owd folk left now "[582-one man] said [one man]582-one man , lighting [his]582-one man pipe slowly--"It 's all over an ' done wi ' . Meanwhile , [the Reverend Mr. Medwin]184-mr. medwin , [M.A.]1125-m.a. , had arrived at [Briar Farm]4-briar farm . Everything was curiously silent . All the blinds were down -- the stable - doors were closed , and [the stable - yard]1050-the stable - yard was empty . The sunlight swept in broad slanting rays over the brilliant flower - beds which were now at their gayest and best,--the doves lay sleeping on the roofs of [sheds]1146-sheds and [barns]1147-barns as though mesmerised and forbidden to fly . A marked loneliness clouded the peaceful beauty of [the place]883-the place -- a loneliness that made itself seen and felt by [even the most casual visitor]1149-even the most casual visitor .

[Mr. Medwin]184-mr. medwin gave a slight cough -- a cough of incredulity . " Adopted "[184-mr. medwin] is a phrase often used to cover the brand of illegitimacy .

" [Poor Uncle Hugo]87-uncle hugo ! "[435-the young man] and [the young man]435-the young man looked up sorrowfully at the darkened windows of [the room]531-the room where lay in still and stern repose all that was mortal of the last of the Jocelyns--"What a mistake [you]435-the young man have made ! "[152-innocent]

A hand touched [him]435-the young man lightly on the arm from behind . [He]435-the young man turned swiftly round and confronted [Innocent]152-innocent -- [she]152-innocent stood like a little figure of white porcelain , holding [her]152-innocent dove against [her]152-innocent breast .

" [Poor [Robin]84-robin]2690-poor robin ! "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said , softly--"Don't worry ! [I]152-innocent heard everything . "[152-innocent]

[He]435-the young man stared down upon [her]435-the young man .

" [You]435-the young man heard-- ? "[435-the young man]

" Yes . [I]84-robin was at the open window there -- [I]84-robin could n't help hearing . It was [Jenny]193-dykes of the Mill - [Dykes]193-dykes -- [I]84-robin know [her]193-dykes by sight , but not to speak to -- [Priscilla]121-priscilla told [me]84-robin something about [her]193-dykes . [She]193-dykes is n't [a nice woman]3696-a nice woman , is [she]193-dykes ? "[84-robin]

" Nice ? "[84-robin] [Robin]84-robin gasped--"No , indeed ! [She]193-dykes is -- [Well!--I]195-well!--i must not tell [you]84-robin what [she]193-dykes is ! "[84-robin]

" [No!--you]84-robin must not -- [I]84-robin do n't want to hear . But [she]193-dykes ought to be [[Ned Landon]112-landon 's wife]3697-ned landon 's wife -- [I]84-robin understood that!--and [she]193-dykes has [a little child]3698-a little child . [I]84-robin understood that too . And [she]193-dykes knows everything about [me]84-robin -- and about that night when [you]84-robin climbed up on [my]84-robin window - sill and sat there so long . It was a pity [you]84-robin did that , was n't it ? "[84-robin]

" Yes!--when there was [a dirty spy in hiding]3699-a dirty spy in hiding ! "[84-robin] said [Robin]84-robin , hotly .

" [Ah!--we]3700-ah!--we never imagined such a thing could be on [Briar Farm!"--and]23-briar farm!"--and[1197-she] [she]1197-she sighed--"but it ca n't be helped now . [Poor darling Dad]85-dad ! [He]85-dad parted with all that money to get rid of [the man [he]85-dad thought would do [me]84-robin wrong]3701-the man he thought would do me wrong . Oh [Robin]84-robin , [he]85-dad loved [me]84-robin ! "[84-robin]

The tears gathered in [her]1197-she eyes and fell slowly like bright raindrops on the downy feathers of the dove [she]1197-she held .

" [He]85-dad loved [you]1197-she , and [I]84-robin love [you]1197-she ! "[84-robin] murmured [Robin]84-robin , tenderly . " [Dear little girl]3702-dear little girl , come [indoors]3703-indoors and do n't cry any more ! [Your]3702-dear little girl sweet eyes will be spoilt , and [Uncle Hugo]87-uncle hugo could never bear to see [you]3702-dear little girl weeping . All the tears in [the world]2693-the world wo n't bring [him]85-dad back to [us]1199-we here,--but [we]1199-we can do [our]1199-we best to please [him]85-dad still , so that if [his]85-dad spirit has ever been troubled , it can be at peace . Come in and let [us]1199-we talk quietly together -- [we]1199-we must look at things squarely and straightly , and [we]1199-we must try to do all the things [he]85-dad would have wished-- "[84-robin]

" All except one thing , "[1198-i] [she]1198-i said , as [they]1199-we went together side by side into the house--"the one thing that can never be ! "[84-robin]

" The one thing -- the chief thing that shall be ! "[84-robin] answered [Robin]84-robin , fiercely--"Innocent , [you]1198-i must be [[my]84-robin wife]3339-my wife ! "[84-robin]

[She]1198-i lifted [her]1198-i tear - wet eyes to [his]84-robin with a grave and piteous appeal which smote [him]84-robin to the heart by its intense helplessness and sorrow .

" [Robin,--dear Robin]84-robin ! "[1198-i] [she]1198-i said--"Don't make it harder for [me]1198-i than it is ! Think for a moment ! [I]1198-i am nameless -- a poor , unbaptised , deserted creature who was flung on [[your]1198-i uncle]3152-your uncle 's charity eighteen years ago -- [I]1198-i am [a stranger and intruder]3707-a stranger and intruder in [this old historic place]3708-this old historic place -- [I]1198-i have no right to be here at all -- only through [[your]1198-i uncle]3152-your uncle 's kindness and [yours]1198-i . And now things have happened so cruelly for [me]1198-i that [I]1198-i am supposed to be to [you]1198-i -- what [I]1198-i am not,"--and[1198-i] the deep colour flushed [her]1198-i cheeks and brow . " [I]1198-i have somehow -- through no fault of [my]1198-i own -- lost [my]1198-i name!--though [I]1198-i had no name to lose -- except [Innocent!--which]196-innocent!--which , as [the clergyman]1151-the clergyman told [me]1198-i , is no name for [a woman]2688-a woman . Do [you]1198-i not see that if [I]1198-i married [you]1198-i , [people]2701-people would say it was because [you]1198-i were compelled to marry [me?--that]3713-me?--that [you]1198-i had gone too far to escape from [me?--that]3713-me?--that , in fact , [we]1201-we were a sort of copy of [Ned Landon]112-landon and [[Jenny]193-dykes of [the Mill - Dykes]3715-the mill - dykes]3714-jenny of the mill - dykes ? "[1198-i]

" [Innocent]152-innocent ! "[1198-i]

[He]1200-you uttered the name in a tone of indignant and despairing protest . [They]1201-we were in the oak parlour together , and [she]1202-she went slowly to the window and let [her]1202-she pet dove fly .

" Ah , yes ! [Innocent]152-innocent ! "[1202-she] [she]1202-she repeated , sadly--"But [you]1200-you must let [me]1202-she go , [Robin!--just]197-robin!--just as [I]1202-she have let [my]1202-she dove fly , so [you]1200-you must let [me]1202-she fly also -- far , far away ! "[1202-she]

CHAPTER IX

No more impressive scene was ever witnessed in [a country village]1203-a country village than the funeral of " the last of [the Jocelyns,"--impressive]198-the jocelyns,"--impressive[1202-she] in [its]1204-its solemnity , simplicity and lack of needless ceremonial . The coffin , containing all that was mortal of [the sturdy , straightforward farmer , whose " old - world "[1202-she] ways of work and upright dealing with [[his]1205-the sturdy , straightforward farmer , whose " old - world " ways of work and upright dealing with his men had for so long been the wonder and envy of the district men]1206-his men had for so long been the wonder and envy of [the district]1141-the district]1205-the sturdy , straightforward farmer , whose " old - world " ways of work and upright dealing with his men had for so long been the wonder and envy of the district , was placed in a low waggon and covered with a curiously wrought , handwoven purple cloth embroidered with the arms of [the French knight]1208-the french knight " [Amadis de Jocelin]138-the sieur amadis , "[1202-she] tradition asserting that this cloth had served as a pall for [every male [Jocelyn]113-jocelyn since [his]1205-the sturdy , straightforward farmer , whose " old - world " ways of work and upright dealing with his men had for so long been the wonder and envy of the district time]1209-every male jocelyn since his time . The waggon was drawn by four glossy dark brown cart - horses , each animal having known [its master]830-its master as [a friend whose call it was accustomed to obey , following [him]830-its master wherever [he]830-its master went]1211-a friend whose call it was accustomed to obey , following him wherever he went . On the coffin itself was laid a simple wreath of the " Glory "[1213-a long train of mourners] roses gathered from [the porch and walls of [Briar Farm]4-briar farm]1212-the porch and walls of briar farm , and offered , as pencilled faintly on a little scroll--"With a life 's love and sorrow from [Innocent]152-innocent . "[1213-a long train of mourners] [A long train of [mourners]1214-mourners]1213-a long train of mourners , including [labourers]1215-labourers , [farm - lads]1216-farm - lads , [shepherds]1217-shepherds , [cowherds]1218-cowherds , [stable - men]1219-stable - men and [villagers]1220-villagers generally , followed the corpse to the grave,--Robin [Clifford]84-robin , as [[chief mourner]1221-chief mourner and next - of - kin]1222-chief mourner and next - of - kin to [the dead man]1095-the dead man , walking behind the waggon with head down - bent and a face on which intense grief had stamped such an impress as to make [it]1224-it look far older than [his]1095-the dead man years warranted . [Groups of women]1225-groups of women stood about , watching the procession with hard eager eyes , and tongues held in check for a while , only to wag more vigorously than ever when the ceremony should be over . [Innocent]152-innocent , dressed in deep black for the first time in [her]152-innocent life , went by [herself]152-innocent to [the churchyard]1226-the churchyard , avoiding [the crowd]1227-the crowd -- and , hidden away among concealing shadows , [she]152-innocent heard the service and watched all the proceedings dry - eyed and heart - stricken . [She]152-innocent could not weep any more -- there seemed no tears left to relieve the weight of [her]152-innocent burning brain . [Robin]84-robin had tenderly urged [her]152-innocent to walk with [him]84-robin in the funeral procession , but [she]152-innocent refused .

" How can [I!--how]152-innocent dare [I]152-innocent ! "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said--"I am not [[his]84-robin daughter]3716-his daughter -- [I]1228-me am nothing ! [The cruel people here]3717-the cruel people here know it!--and [they]3717-the cruel people here would only say [my]1228-me presence was an insult to [the dead]3674-the dead . [Yes!--they]3719-yes!--they would -- NOW ! [He]84-robin loved me!--and [I]1228-me loved him!--but nobody outside [ourselves]3720-ourselves thinks about that , or cares . [You]3721-you would hardly believe it , but [I]1228-me have already been told how wicked it was of [me]1228-me to be dressed in white when [the clergyman]1151-the clergyman called to see [me]1228-me the morning after [Dad]85-dad 's death -- well , [I]1228-me had no other colour to wear till [Priscilla]121-priscilla got [me]1228-me this sad black gown -- it made [me]1228-me shudder to put it on -- it is like the darkness [itself!--you]3721-you know [Dad]85-dad always made [me]1228-me wear white -- and [I]1228-me feel as if [I]1228-me were vexing [him]84-robin somehow by wearing black . Oh , [Robin]84-robin , be kind!--you always are!--let [me]1228-me go by [myself]1228-me and watch [Dad]85-dad put to rest where [nobody]2675-nobody can see [me]1228-me . For after [they]3724-they have laid [him]84-robin down and left [him]84-robin , [they]3724-they will be talking ! "[1228-me]

[She]1228-me was right enough in this surmise . Not one who saw [Farmer Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn 's coffin lowered into [the grave]1229-the grave failed to notice the wreath of " Glory "[1228-me] roses that went with it--"from Innocent";--and[1228-me] [her]1228-me name was whispered from mouth to mouth with meaning looks and suggestive nods . And when [Robin]84-robin , with tears thick in [his]84-robin eyes , flung the first handfuls of earth rattling down on the coffin lid , [his]84-robin heart ached to see the lovely fragrant blossoms crushed under the heavy scattered mould , for it seemed to [his]84-robin foreboding mind that they were like the delicate thoughts and fancies of [the girl [he]84-robin loved]1230-the girl he loved being covered by the soiling mud of [the world]2693-the world 's cruelty and slander , and killed in the cold and darkness of a sunless solitude .

All was over at last,--the final prayer was said -- the final benediction was spoken , and [the mourners]1232-the mourners gradually dispersed . [The Reverend Mr. Medwin]184-mr. medwin , assisted by [[his]184-mr. medwin young curate]1233-his young curate , had performed the ceremony , and before retiring to [the vestry]1234-the vestry to take off [his]184-mr. medwin surplice , [he]184-mr. medwin paused by [the newly - made grave]1235-the newly - made grave to offer [his]184-mr. medwin hand and utter suitable condolences to [Robin Clifford]84-robin .

" It is a great and trying change for [you]84-robin , "[184-mr. medwin] [he]184-mr. medwin said . " [I]184-mr. medwin suppose"--this[184-mr. medwin] tentatively--"I suppose [you]84-robin will go on with [the farm]2744-the farm ? "[184-mr. medwin]

" As long as [I]84-robin live , "[84-robin] answered [Clifford]84-robin , looking [him]84-robin steadily in the face , " [Briar Farm]4-briar farm will be what [it]4-briar farm has always been . "[84-robin]

[Mr. Medwin]184-mr. medwin gave [him]84-robin a little appreciative bow .

" [We]3726-we are very glad of that -- very glad indeed ! "[184-mr. medwin] [he]184-mr. medwin said--"Briar [Farm]3727-farm is a great feature -- a very great feature!--indeed , one may say it is an historical possession . Something would be lacking in [the neighbourhood]3728-the neighbourhood if [it]3727-farm were not kept up to [its]3727-farm old tradition and -- er -- reputation . [I]184-mr. medwin think [we]3726-we feel that -- [I]184-mr. medwin think [we]3726-we feel it , do [we]3726-we not , [Mr. Forwood]199-mr. forwood ? "[184-mr. medwin] here turning to [[his]184-mr. medwin curate]1236-his curate with affable condescension .

[Mark Forwood]200-mark forwood , [a clever - looking young man with kind eyes and intelligent features]1237-a clever - looking young man with kind eyes and intelligent features , looked at [Robin]84-robin sympathetically .

" [I]184-mr. medwin am quite sure , "[184-mr. medwin] [he]184-mr. medwin said , " that [Mr. Clifford]111-mr. clifford will take as much pride in [the fine old place]3729-the fine old place as [[his]111-mr. clifford uncle]514-his uncle did -- but is there not [[Miss Jocelyn?--the]3731-miss jocelyn?--the daughter]3732-miss jocelyn?--the daughter will probably inherit [the farm]2744-the farm , will [she]3732-miss jocelyn?--the daughter not , as nearest of kin ? "[184-mr. medwin]

[Mr. Medwin]184-mr. medwin coughed obtrusively -- and [Clifford]84-robin felt the warm blood rushing to [his]84-robin brows . Yet [he]84-robin resolved that the truth should be told , for the honour of [the dead man]1095-the dead man 's name .

" [She]3732-miss jocelyn?--the daughter is not [[[my]84-robin uncle]3167-my uncle 's daughter]3735-my uncle 's daughter , "[84-robin] [he]84-robin said , [quietly--"My uncle]3736-quietly--"my uncle never married . [He]3736-quietly--"my uncle adopted [her]3732-miss jocelyn?--the daughter when [she]3732-miss jocelyn?--the daughter was [an infant]3737-an infant -- and [she]3732-miss jocelyn?--the daughter was as dear to [him]3736-quietly--"my uncle as if [she]3732-miss jocelyn?--the daughter had been [[his]3736-quietly--"my uncle own child]3357-his own child . Of course [she]3732-miss jocelyn?--the daughter will be amply provided for -- there can be no doubt of that . "[84-robin]

[Mr. Forwood]199-mr. forwood raised [his]199-mr. forwood eyes and eyebrows together .

" [You]3739-you surprise [me]199-mr. forwood ! "[199-mr. forwood] [he]199-mr. forwood murmured . " Then -- there is no [Miss Jocelyn]113-jocelyn ? "[199-mr. forwood]

Again [Robin]84-robin coloured . But [he]84-robin answered , composedly--

" There is no [Miss Jocelyn]113-jocelyn . "[199-mr. forwood]

[Mr. Medwin]184-mr. medwin 's cough [here]2907-here troubled [him]184-mr. medwin considerably , and though it was a fine day , [he]184-mr. medwin expressed a mild fear that [he]184-mr. medwin was standing too long by the open grave in [his]184-mr. medwin surplice -- [he]184-mr. medwin , therefore , retired , [[his]184-mr. medwin curate]1236-his curate following [him,--whereupon]1241-him,--whereupon [the sexton]1242-the sexton , [a well - known character in [the village]2885-the village]1243-a well - known character in the village , approached to finish the sad task of committing " ashes to ashes , dust to dust . "[1242-the sexton]

" Eh , [Mr. Clifford]111-mr. clifford , "[1245-this worthy] remarked [this worthy]1245-this worthy , as [he]1245-this worthy stuck [his]1245-this worthy spade down in the heaped - up earth and leaned upon it,--"it 's a black day , forbye the summer sun ! " [You]84-robin 're right there , [Wixton]201-wixton , "[84-robin] said [Robin]84-robin , sadly--"I know [the place]883-the place can never be the same without [him]1242-the sexton . [I]84-robin shall do [my]84-robin best -- but-- "[84-robin]

" Ay , [ye'll]84-robin do [your]84-robin best , "[201-wixton] agreed [Wixton]201-wixton , with a foreboding shake of [his]201-wixton grizzled head--"but [you]84-robin 're not a [Jocelyn]113-jocelyn , an ' [your]84-robin best'll be but [a bad crutch]3741-a bad crutch , though there 's [Jocelyn]113-jocelyn blood in [ye]84-robin by [[ye'r]84-robin mother]3742-ye'r mother 's side . "[201-wixton]

[Robin]84-robin 's grave nod of acquiescence was more eloquent than speech .

[Wixton]201-wixton dug [his]201-wixton spade a little deeper into the pile of earth .

" If [Farmer [Jocelyn]113-jocelyn]3746-farmer jocelyn ' ad been [a marryin ' man]3747-a marryin ' man , why , that would a ' been the right thing , "[201-wixton] [he]201-wixton went on--"He might a ' had [a fine strappin ' son]3748-a fine strappin ' son to come arter ' [i]201-wixton m , [a real born]3749-a real born - an'-bred [Jocelyn--]194-miss jocelyn-- "[201-wixton]

[Robin]84-robin listened with acute interest . Why did not [Wixton]201-wixton mention [Innocent]152-innocent ? Did [he]201-wixton know [she]152-innocent was not a [Jocelyn]113-jocelyn ? [He]84-robin waited , and [Wixton]201-wixton went on--

" But , [ye]84-robin see , ' [e]84-robin would n't have none o ' that . An ' [he]201-wixton took the little gel as was left with ' [i]201-wixton m the night o ' the great storm nigh eighteen years ago that blew down three of [our]3750-our biggest elms in [the church - yard--]3751-the church - yard-- "[201-wixton]

" Did [you]201-wixton know ? "[84-robin] exclaimed [Clifford]84-robin , eagerly--"Did [you]201-wixton see-- ? "[84-robin]

" [I]201-wixton saw [a man]2681-a man on ' orseback ride up to [Briar Farm]4-briar farm , ' oldin ' [a baby]3055-a baby in front o ' [him]201-wixton with one hand , and the reins in t'other -- an ' [he]201-wixton came out from [the farm]2744-the farm without [the baby]3001-the baby . ' an ' [he]201-wixton sez--'Ow do [you]201-wixton know it ai n't ? ' An ' [I]201-wixton sez-- ' Because [I]201-wixton saw it come with [a stranger'--an]3759-a stranger'--an ' [he]201-wixton laughed an ' said--'It may be [mine]201-wixton for all that ! ' But [I]201-wixton knew it worn't ! [A nice little girl]3760-a nice little girl [she]3760-a nice little girl is too,--Miss Innocent -- poor soul ! [I]201-wixton 'm downright sorry for ' er , for [she]3760-a nice little girl ai n't got [many friends in [this village]3762-this village]3761-many friends in this village . "[201-wixton]

" Why ? "[84-robin] [Robin]84-robin asked , half mechanically .

" Why ? Eh , eh ! [We]3768-we should [all]604-all get along better if there worn't no wimmin jealousies , but bein ' [men]397-men [we]3768-we 've got to put up with ['em]3771-'em . Are [ye]201-wixton goin' now , [Mister?--Well]203-mister?--well , [the Lord]3232-the lord love [ye]201-wixton an ' comfort [ye!--ye'll]201-wixton never meet [a finer man this side [the next world]3774-the next world than the one [I]201-wixton 'm puttin ' a cold quilt on]3773-a finer man this side the next world than the one i 'm puttin ' a cold quilt on ! "[201-wixton]

[Silently Clifford]204-silently clifford turned away , heavy - hearted and lost in perplexed thought . What was best to be done for [Innocent]152-innocent ? This was the chief question that presented itself to [his]1246-he mind . [He]1246-he could no longer deny the fact that [her]152-innocent position was difficult -- almost untenable . Nameless , and seemingly deserted by [[her]152-innocent kindred]1247-her kindred , if any such kindred still existed , [she]152-innocent was absolutely alone in life , now that [Hugo Jocelyn]143-hugo jocelyn was no more . As [he]1246-he realised this to its fullest intensity , the deeper and more passionate grew [his]1246-he love for [her]152-innocent .

" If [she]152-innocent would only marry [me]1246-he ! "[1246-he] [he]1246-he said under [his]1246-he breath , as [he]1246-he walked [home]2674-home slowly from [the church]3057-the church - yard--"It was [Uncle Hugo]87-uncle hugo 's last wish ! "[1246-he]

Then across [his]1246-he brain flashed the memory of [Ned Landon]112-landon and [his]112-landon malignant intention -- born of baffled desire and fierce jealousy -- to tarnish the fair name of [the girl [he]1246-he coveted,--then]1250-the girl he coveted,--then , [[his]1246-he uncle]514-his uncle 's quixotic and costly way of ridding [himself]1246-he of such an enemy at any price . [He]1246-he understood now [old Jocelyn]143-hugo jocelyn 's talk of [his]1246-he " bargain "[143-hugo jocelyn] on the last night of [his]1246-he life,-and what a futile bargain it was , after all!--for was not [Jenny]193-dykes of [the Mill]1252-the mill - [Dykes]193-dykes fully informed of the reason why the bargain was made?--and [she]1253-she , [the vilest - tongued woman in [the whole neighbourhood]1255-the whole neighbourhood]1254-the vilest - tongued woman in the whole neighbourhood , would take delight in spreading the story far and wide . Five Hundred Pounds paid down as " hush - money"!--so[1253-she] [she]1253-she would report it -- thus , even if [he]1246-he married [Innocent]152-innocent it would be under the shadow of a slur and slander . What was wisest to do under the circumstances [he]1246-he could not decide -- and [he]1246-he entered [the smiling garden of [Briar Farm]4-briar farm]1256-the smiling garden of briar farm with the saddest expression on [his]1246-he face that [anyone]2832-anyone had ever seen [there]2972-there . [Priscilla]121-priscilla met [him]1246-he as [he]1246-he came towards [the house]2762-the house .

" [I]121-priscilla thought ye'd never git [here]2907-here , [Mister Robin]126-robin , "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla said , anxiously--"Ye have n't forgot there 's folks in [the hall]517-the hall ' avin ' [their]3777-their ' wake ' feed an ' [they]3777-their 'll be wantin ' to speak wi ' [ye]126-robin presently . "[121-priscilla]

" [We]207-these should like things to go on the same as if [th ' old man]3793-th ' old man were alive , "[2752-one] said [one]2752-one , a miller,--"We do n't like changes after all these years . " Time WILL prove , "[84-robin] answered [Clifford]84-robin , steadily . "[2752-one]

[Robin]84-robin made no comment . "[84-robin]

And [he]84-robin wondered what such a change might portend .

[Downstairs]994-downstairs , the funeral party had broken up -- [many of [the mourners]1232-the mourners]1284-many of the mourners had gone , and [others]2689-others were going . " This is for [you]152-innocent , "[205-mr. bayliss] [he]205-mr. bayliss said--"and this also"--here[205-mr. bayliss] [he]205-mr. bayliss lifted from the bottom of the casket a flat jewel - case of antique leather embossed in gold .

And [he]205-mr. bayliss passed the jewel - case over the table to [Innocent]152-innocent , who sat silent , with the sealed packet [she]152-innocent had just received lying before [her]152-innocent . [She]152-innocent took it passively , and opened it -- a beautiful row of pearls , not very large , but wonderfully perfect , lay within -- clasped by a small , curiously designed diamond snap . [She]152-innocent looked at [them]1297-them with half - wondering , half - indifferent eyes -- then closed the case and gave it to [Robin Clifford]84-robin .

" They are for [[your]205-mr. bayliss wife]3364-your wife when [you]205-mr. bayliss marry , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said--"Please keep [them]1297-them . "[152-innocent]

[She]152-innocent looked at [him]205-mr. bayliss , gravely .

" Yes -- [I]152-innocent am sure [he]205-mr. bayliss was , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said--"He was always good -- too good and generous -- but if they are [mine]152-innocent , [I]152-innocent give [them]1297-them to [Mr. Clifford]111-mr. clifford . [Mr. Bayliss]205-mr. bayliss coughed again .

[She]152-innocent bent [her]152-innocent head .

CHAPTER X

[Upstairs]974-upstairs , shut in [[her]1307-i own little room]1308-her own little room with the door locked , [Innocent]152-innocent opened the sealed packet . [She]1307-i found within it a letter and some bank - notes . With a sensitive pain which thrilled every nerve in [her]1307-i body [she]1307-i unfolded the letter , written in [Hugo Jocelyn]143-hugo jocelyn 's firm clear writing -- a writing [she]1307-i knew so well , and which bore no trace of weakness or failing in the hand that guided the pen . How strange it was , [she]1307-i thought , that the written words should look so living and distinct when [the writer]1309-the writer was dead ! [Her]1307-i head swam.--her eyes were dim -- for a moment [she]1307-i could scarcely see -- then the mist before [her]1307-i slowly dispersed and [she]1307-i read the first words , which made [her]1307-i heart swell and the tears rise in [her]1307-i aching throat .

" [MY]1307-i LITTLE WILDING!--When [you]3911-you read this [I]1307-i shall be gone to [that wonderful world]3912-that wonderful world which [all the clergymen]3913-all the clergymen tell [us]3914-us about , but which none of [them]3913-all the clergymen are in any great hurry to see for [themselves]3913-all the clergymen . [I]1307-i hope -- and [I]1307-i sometimes believe -- [such a world]3915-such a world exists -- and that perhaps it is [a place where [a man]2681-a man may sow seed and raise crops as well and as prosperously as on [Briar Farm]4-briar farm]3916-a place where a man may sow seed and raise crops as well and as prosperously as on briar farm -- however , [I]1307-i 'm praying [I]1307-i may not be taken till [I]1307-i 've seen [you]3911-you safely [we]3914-us d to [Robin]84-robin -- and yet , something tells [me]1307-i this will not be ; and that 's the something that makes [me]1307-i write this letter and put it with the pearls that are , by [my]1307-i will , destined for [you]3911-you on [your]3911-you marriage - morning . [I]1307-i 'm writing it , remember , on the same night [I]1307-i 've told [you]3911-you all about [yourself]3911-you -- the night of the day [the doctor]2825-the doctor gave [me]1307-i [my]1307-i death - warrant . [I]1307-i may live [a year,--I]3919-a year,--i may live but a week,--it will be hard if [I]1307-i may not live to see [you]3911-you married!--but [God]80-god 's will must be done . The bank - notes folded in this letter make up four hundred pounds -- and this money [you]3911-you can spend as [you]3911-you like -- on [your]3911-you clothes for the bridal , or on anything [you]3911-you fancy -- [I]1307-i place no restriction on [you]3911-you as to its use . When [a maid]1150-a maid weds there are many pretties [she]1150-a maid needs to buy , and the prettier they are for [you]3911-you the better shall [I]1307-i be pleased . Whether [I]1307-i live or whether [I]1307-i die , [you]3911-you need say nothing of this money to [Robin]84-robin , or to [anyone]2832-anyone . It is [your]3911-you own absolutely -- to do as [you]3911-you like with . [I]1307-i am thankful to feel that [you]3911-you will be safe in [Robin]84-robin 's loving care -- for [the world]2693-the world is hard on [a woman left alone as [you]3911-you would be]3923-a woman left alone as you would be , were it not for [him]84-robin . [I]1307-i give [you]3911-you [my]1307-i word that if [I]1307-i had any clue , however small , to [your]3911-you real parentage , [I]1307-i would write down here for [you]3911-you all [I]1307-i know -- but [I]1307-i know nothing more than [I]1307-i have told [you]3911-you . [I]1307-i have loved [you]3911-you as [[my]1307-i own child]3924-my own child and [you]3911-you have been the joy of [my]1307-i old days . May [God]80-god bless [you]3911-you and give [you]3911-you joy and peace in [Briar Farm!--you]28-briar farm!--you and [[your]3911-you children]3925-your children , and [[[your]3911-you children]3925-your children 's children]3927-your children 's children ! Amen ![1307-i]

" [Your]3911-you ' [Dad]2820-dad '[1310-her]

" [HUGO JOCELYN]143-hugo jocelyn . "[1307-i]

[She]1310-her read this to the end , and then some tension in [her]1310-her brain seemed to relax , and [she]1310-her wept long and bitterly , [her]1310-her head bent down on the letter and [her]1310-her bright hair falling over it . Presently , checking [her]1310-her sobs , [she]1310-her rose , and looked about [her]1310-her in a kind of dream -- [the familiar little room]1311-the familiar little room seemed to have suddenly become strange to [her]1310-her , and [she]1310-her thought [she]1310-her saw standing in one corner [a figure clad in armour,--its vizor]1312-a figure clad in armour,--its vizor was up , showing a sad pale face and melancholy eyes -- the lips moved -- and a sighing murmur floated past [her]1310-her ears--"Mon coeur [me]1312-a figure clad in armour,--its vizor soutien ! "[1312-a figure clad in armour,--its vizor] A cold terror seized [her]1310-her , and [she]1310-her trembled from head to foot -- then the vision or hallucination vanished as swiftly and mysteriously as it had appeared . Rallying [her]1310-her forces , [she]1310-her gradually mastered the overpowering fear which for a moment had possessed [her,--and]1313-her,--and folding up [Hugo Jocelyn]143-hugo jocelyn 's last letter , [she]1310-her kissed it , and placed it in [her]1310-her bosom . The bank - notes were four in number -- each for one hundred pounds;--these [she]1310-her put in an envelope , and shut them in the drawer containing [her]1310-her secret manuscript .

" Now the way is clear ! "[1310-her] [she]1310-her said--"I can do what [I]1310-her like -- [I]1310-her have [my]1310-her wings , and [I]1310-her can fly away ! Oh [Dad]85-dad , [dear]2830-dear [Dad!--you]85-dad would be so unhappy if [you]2830-dear knew what [I]1310-her mean to do!--it would break [your]2830-dear heart , Dad!--but [you]2830-dear have no heart to break now , [poor Dad!--it]216-poor dad!--it is cold as stone!--it will never beat any more ! [Mine]1310-her is the heart that beats!--the heart that burns , and aches , and hurts me!--ah!--how it hurts ! And [no one]2691-no one can understand -- [no one]2691-no one will ever care to understand ! "[1310-her]

[She]1310-her locked [her]1310-her manuscript - drawer -- then went and bathed [her]1310-her eyes , which smarted with the tears [she]1310-her had shed . Looking at [herself]1310-her in the mirror [she]1310-her saw [a pale plaintive little creature , without any freshness of beauty]1314-a pale plaintive little creature , without any freshness of beauty -- all the vitality seemed gone out of [her]1310-her . Smoothing [her]1310-her ruffled hair , [she]1310-her twisted it up in a loose coil at the back of [her]1310-her head , and studied with melancholy dislike and pain the heavy effect of [her]1310-her dense black draperies against [her]1310-her delicate skin .

" [I]1310-her shall do for anything now , "[1310-her] [she]1310-her said--"No one will look at [me]1310-her , and [I]1310-her shall pass quite unnoticed in [a crowd]3932-a crowd . [I]1310-her 'm glad [I]1310-her 'm not [a pretty girl]3933-a pretty girl -- it might be more difficult to get on . And [Robin]84-robin called [me]1310-her ' lovely ' the other day!--poor , foolish [Robin]84-robin ! "[1310-her]

[She]1310-her went [downstairs]994-downstairs then to see if [she]1310-her could help [Priscilla]121-priscilla -- but [Priscilla]121-priscilla would not allow [her]1310-her to do anything in the way of what [she]121-priscilla called " chores . "[121-priscilla]

" No , [lovey]2788-lovey , "[1310-her] [she]1310-her said--"you just keep quiet , an ' by - an'-bye [you]2788-lovey an ' me'll ' ave a quiet tea together , for [Mister Robin]126-robin [he]84-robin 's gone off for the rest o ' the day an ' night with [Mr. Bayliss]205-mr. bayliss , as there 's lots o ' things to see to , an ' ' [e]121-priscilla left [you]2788-lovey this little note"--here[121-priscilla] [Priscilla]121-priscilla produced a small neatly folded paper from [her]121-priscilla apron pocke - t-"an ' sez ' e--'Give this to [Miss Innocent]152-innocent ` ' ' [e]121-priscilla sez , ' an ' [she]152-innocent wo n't mind [my]121-priscilla bein ' out o ' the way -- it'll be better for ' er to be quiet a bit with [you'--an]3935-you'--an ' so it will , lovey , for sometimes [a man about the ' ouse]3936-a man about the ' ouse is a worrit an ' a burden , say what [we]3937-we will , an ' good though ' [e]121-priscilla be . "[121-priscilla]

[Innocent]152-innocent took the note and read--

" [I]152-innocent have made up [my]152-innocent mind to go with [Bayliss]205-mr. bayliss into [the town]2918-the town and stay at [[his]205-mr. bayliss house]3939-his house for the night -- there are many business matters [we]3937-we have to go into together , and it is important for [me]152-innocent to thoroughly understand the position of [[my]152-innocent uncle]3167-my uncle 's affairs . If [I]152-innocent can not manage to get back to - morrow , [I]152-innocent will let [you]121-priscilla know . [Robin]126-robin . "[152-innocent]

[She]152-innocent heaved a sigh of intense relief . For twenty - four hours at least [she]152-innocent was free from love 's importunity -- [she]152-innocent could be alone to think , and to plan . [She]152-innocent turned to [Priscilla]121-priscilla with a gentle look and smile .

" [I]152-innocent 'll go into [the garden]415-the garden , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said--"and when it 's tea - time [you]121-priscilla 'll come and fetch [me]152-innocent , wo n't [you]121-priscilla ? " Oh , bother ' [i]121-priscilla m , "[121-priscilla] muttered [Priscilla]121-priscilla , irrelevantly--"You do think too much o ' that there blessed old figure!--why , what 's ' e got to do with [you]414-the girl , [[my]121-priscilla pretty]3943-my pretty ? "[121-priscilla]

" Nothing ! "[152-innocent] and the colour came to [her]152-innocent pale cheeks for a moment , and then fled back again--"He never had anything to do with [me]152-innocent , really ! But [I]152-innocent seem to know [him]778-the old stone knight . "[152-innocent]

[Priscilla]121-priscilla gave a kind of melancholy snort -- and [the girl]414-the girl moved slowly away through the open door and beyond it , out among the radiant flowers . [Her]152-innocent little figure in deep black was soon lost to sight , and after watching [her]152-innocent for a minute , [Priscilla]121-priscilla turned to [[her]121-priscilla home]3139-her home - work with tears blinding [her]121-priscilla eyes so thickly that [she]121-priscilla could scarcely see .

" If [she]152-innocent winnot take [Mister Robin]126-robin , [the Lord]3232-the lord knows what 'll become of ' er ! "[152-innocent] sighed the worthy woman--"For [she]152-innocent 's as lone [i]152-innocent ' [the world]2693-the world as a thrush fallen out o ' the nest before it 's grown strong enough to fly ! "[152-innocent]

The afternoon was very peaceful and beautiful -- the sun shone warmly over [the smooth meadows of [Briar Farm]4-briar farm]1318-the smooth meadows of briar farm , and reddened the apples in [the orchard]3313-the orchard yet a little more tenderly , flashing in flecks of gold on the " Glory "[152-innocent] roses , and touching the wings of fluttering doves with arrowy silver gleams . [No one looking at [the fine old house]1321-the fine old house , with [its]1321-the fine old house picturesque gables and latticed windows]1320-no one looking at the fine old house , with its picturesque gables and latticed windows , would have thought that [its last master of lawful lineage]1322-its last master of lawful lineage was dead and buried , and that the funeral had taken place that morning . [Briar Farm]4-briar farm , though more than three centuries old , seemed full of youthful life and promise -- a vital fact , destined to outlast many more human lives than those which in the passing of three hundred years had already left [their]1323-their mark upon it , and it was strange and incredible to realise that the long chain of [lineally descended male ancestors]1324-lineally descended male ancestors had broken at last , and that no remaining link survived to carry on the old tradition . Sadly and slowly [Innocent]152-innocent walked across the stretches of warm clover - scented grass to [the ancient tomb of the " [Sieur Amadis"--and]218-sieur amadis"--and]3952-the ancient tomb of the " sieur amadis"--and[152-innocent] sat down beside [it]1321-the fine old house , not far from [the place where so lately [she]152-innocent had sat with [Robin]126-robin]1325-the place where so lately she had sat with robin -- what a change had come over [her]152-innocent life since then ! [She]152-innocent watched the sun sinking towards the horizon in a mellow mist of orange - coloured radiance,--the day was drawing to an end -- the fateful , wretched day which had seen [the best friend [she]152-innocent had ever known]1326-the best friend she had ever known , and whom for years [she]152-innocent had adored and revered as [[her]152-innocent own " father]3953-her own " father , "[3953-her own " father] laid in the dust to perish among perishable things .

" [I]152-innocent wish [I]152-innocent had died instead of [him]126-robin , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent said , half aloud--"or else that [I]152-innocent had never been born ! Oh , dear ' [Sieur Amadis'!--you]218-sieur amadis"--and know how hard it is to live in [the world]2693-the world unless [some one]3392-some one wants [you]218-sieur amadis"--and -- unless [some one]3392-some one loves [you!--and]218-sieur amadis"--and [no one]2691-no one wants [me]152-innocent -- [no one]2691-no one loves [me]152-innocent -- except [Robin]126-robin ! "[152-innocent]

Solitary , and full of the heaviest sadness , [she]152-innocent tried to think and to form plans -- but [her]152-innocent mind was tired , and [she]152-innocent could come to no decisive resolution beyond the one all - convincing necessity -- that of leaving [Briar Farm]4-briar farm . Of course [she]152-innocent must go,--there was no other alternative . And now , thanks to [Hugo Jocelyn]143-hugo jocelyn 's forethought in giving [her]152-innocent money for [her]152-innocent bridal " pretties , "[152-innocent] no financial difficulty stood in the way of [her]152-innocent departure . [She]152-innocent must go -- but where ? To begin with , [she]152-innocent had no name . [She]152-innocent would have to invent one for herself--"Yes ! "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent murmured--"I must invent a name -- and make it famous ! "[152-innocent] Involuntarily [she]152-innocent clenched [her]152-innocent small hand as though [she]152-innocent held some prize within its soft grasp . " Why not ? [Other people]3474-other people have done the same -- [I]152-innocent can but try ! If [I]152-innocent fail-- ! "[152-innocent]

[Her]152-innocent delicate fingers relaxed,--in [her]152-innocent imagination [she]152-innocent saw some coveted splendour slip from [her]152-innocent hold , and [her]152-innocent little face grew set and serious as though [she]152-innocent had already suffered a whole life 's disillusion .

" [I]152-innocent can but try , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent repeated--"something urges [me]152-innocent on -- something tells [me]152-innocent [I]152-innocent may succeed . And then-- ! "[152-innocent]

[Her]152-innocent eyes brightened slowly -- a faint rose flushed [her]152-innocent cheeks,--and with the sudden change of expression , [she]152-innocent became almost beautiful . Herein lay [her]152-innocent particular charm,--the rarest of all in [women,--the]1327-women,--the passing of the lights and shadows of thought over features which responded swiftly and emotionally to the prompting and play of the mind .

" [I]152-innocent should have to go , "[152-innocent] [she]152-innocent went on--"even if [Dad]85-dad were still alive . [I]152-innocent could not -- [I]152-innocent can not marry [Robin!--I]108-robin!--i do not want to marry [anybody]3114-anybody . It is [the common lot of [women]718-women]3961-the common lot of women -- why [they]718-women should envy or desire it , [I]152-innocent can not think ! To give [one]2752-one 's self up entirely to [a man]2681-a man 's humours -- to be glad of [his]2681-a man caresses , and miserable when [he]2681-a man is angry or tired -- to bear [[his]2681-a man children]3965-his children and see [them]3965-his children grow up and leave [you]3966-you for [their]3965-his children own ' betterment ' as [they]3965-his children would call it -- oh!--what [an old , old drudging life!--a life of monotony , sickness , pain]3967-an old , old drudging life!--a life of monotony , sickness , pain , and fatigue!--and nothing higher done than what animals can do ! There are [plenty of women in [the world]2693-the world]3968-plenty of women in the world who like to stay on this level , [I]152-innocent suppose -- but [I]152-innocent should not like it,--I could not live in [this beautiful , wonderful world]3970-this beautiful , wonderful world with no higher ambition than a sheep or a cow ! "[152-innocent]

And picking up [her]152-innocent dainty skirt with one ungloved hand , on which two diamond rings shone like circlets of dew , [she]152-innocent nodded , smiled , and went [her]152-innocent way -- [Innocent]152-innocent standing at the gate and watching [her]152-innocent go with a kind of numbed patience as though [she]152-innocent saw [a figure in a dream vanishing slowly with the dawn of day]1354-a figure in a dream vanishing slowly with the dawn of day . In truth [she]152-innocent could hardly grasp the full significance of what had happened -- [she]152-innocent did not feel , even remotely , the slightest attraction towards [this suddenly declared " mother]4085-this suddenly declared " mother "[152-innocent] of [hers]152-innocent -- [she]152-innocent could hardly believe the story . Yet [she]152-innocent knew it must be [true,--no woman of title and position]1355-true,--no woman of title and position would thus acknowledge a stigma on [her]1355-true,--no woman of title and position own life without any cause for the confession . [She]152-innocent stood at the gate still watching , though there was nothing now to watch , save the bending trees , and the flowering wild plants that fringed each side of [the old by - road]369-the old by - road .
