" [You]2469-she may laugh , but it is true ! "[2470-you] [he]2470-you went on , in a righteously aggrieved tone--"I have done [you]2469-she no harm,--on the contrary , [you]2469-she have to thank [me]2470-you for a great deal of happiness-- "[2470-you]

[She]2469-she gave a tragic gesture of eloquent despair .

" Oh , yes , [I]2469-she have to thank [you]2470-you ! "[2469-she] [she]2469-she said , and [her]2469-she voice now vibrated with intense and passionate sorrow--"I have to thank [you]2470-you for so much -- for so very much indeed ! [You]2470-you have been so kind and good ! Yes ! And [you]2470-you have never thought of [yourself]2470-you or [your]2470-you own pleasure at all -- but only of [me]2469-she ! And [I]2469-she have been as safe with [you]2470-you as in [[my]2469-she mother]3020-my mother 's arms , ... [yes!--you]2470-you have been quite as careful of [me]2469-she as [she]3020-my mother was ! "[2469-she] And a wan smile flitted over [her]2469-she agonised face--"All this [I]2469-she have to thank [you]2470-you for!--but [you]2470-you have ruined [me]2469-she just the same -- not [my]2469-she body , but [my]2469-she soul ! "[2469-she]

[He]2471-he looked at [her,--she]2469-she returned [his]2471-he gaze unflinchingly with eyes that glowed like burning stars -- and [he]2471-he thought [she]2469-she was , as [he]2471-he put it to [himself]2471-he , " calming down . "[2469-she] [He]2471-he laughed , a little uneasily .

" Soul is an unknown quantity , "[2471-he] [he]2471-he said--"It does n't count . "[2469-she]

[She]2469-she seemed not to hear [him]2471-he .

" [You]2471-he have ruined [my]2469-she soul ! "[2469-she] [she]2469-she repeated steadily--"You have stolen it from [God]80-god -- [you]2471-he have made it all [your]2471-he own -- for [your]2471-he ' amusement ' ! What remainder of life have [you]2471-he left to [me]2469-she ? Nothing ! [I]2469-she have no hope , no faith , no power to work -- no ambition to fulfil -- no dreams to realise ! [You]2471-he gave [me]2469-she love -- as [I]2469-she thought!--and [I]2469-she lived ; [you]2471-he take love from [me]2469-she , and [I]2469-she die ! "[2469-she]

[He]2471-he bent [his]2471-he eyes upon [her]2469-she with a kind , almost condescending gentleness,--his personal vanity was immense , and the utter humiliation of [her]2469-she love for [him]2471-he flattered the deep sense [he]2471-he had of [his]2471-he own value .

" [Dear little goose]3175-dear little goose , [you]2469-she will not die ! "[2471-he] [he]2471-he said--"For heaven 's sake have done with all this sentimental talk!--I am not a man who can tolerate it . [You]2471-he are such [a pleasant creature]5381-a pleasant creature when [you]2471-he are cheerful and self - possessed,--so bright and clever and companionable -- and there is no reason why [we]5382-we should n't make love to [each other]654-each other again as often as [we]5382-we like,--but change and novelty are good for both of [us]5382-we . Come!--kiss me!--be [a good child]5384-a good child -- and let [us]5382-we part [friends]3027-friends ! "[2471-he]

[He]2471-he approached [her,--there]2472-her,--there was a smile on [his]2471-he lips -- a smile in which lurked a suspicion of mockery as well as victorious self - satisfaction . [She]2469-she saw it -- and swiftly there came swooping over [her]2469-she brain the horrible realisation of the truth -- that it was all over!--that never , never again would [she]2469-she be able to dwell on the amorous looks and words and love - phrases of [HER]2469-she " Amadis de Jocelyn!"--that[2471-he] no happy future was in store for [her]2469-she with [him]2471-he -- that [he]2471-he had no interest whatever in [her]2469-she cherished memories of [Briar Farm]4-briar farm , and that [he]2471-he would never care to accept the right of dwelling [there]2972-there even if [she]2469-she secured [it]2474-it for [him,--moreover]2475-him,--moreover , that [he]2471-he viewed [her]2469-she very work with indifference , and had no concern as to [her]2469-she name or fame -- so that everything -- every pretty fancy , every radiant hope , every happy possibility was at an end . Life stretched before [her]2469-she dreary as [the dreariest desert]2476-the dreariest desert -- for [her]2469-she , whose nature was to love but once , there was no gleam of light in all [the world]2693-the world 's cruel darkness ! A red mist swam before [her]2469-she eyes -- black clouds seemed descending upon [her]2469-she and whirling round about [her]2469-she -- [she]2469-she looked wildly from right to left , as though seeking to escape from [some invisible pursuer]2478-some invisible pursuer . Startled at [her]2469-she expression [Jocelyn]102-amadis de jocelyn tried to hold [her]2469-she -- but [she]2469-she shook [him]2471-he off . [She]2469-she made a few unsteady steps along the floor .

" What is it ? "[2471-he] [he]2471-he said--"Innocent -- don't stare like that ! "[2469-she]

[She]2469-she smiled strangely and nodded at [him]2471-he -- [she]2469-she was fingering the plant of marguerite daisies that stood in its accustomed place between the easel and the wall . [She]2469-she plucked a flower and began hurriedly stripping off its petals .

" ' Il m'aime -- un peu!--beaucoup -- passionement -- pas du tout ! ' Pas du tout ! "[2469-she] [she]2469-she cried--"Amadis ! [Amadis de Jocelyn]102-amadis de jocelyn ! [You]2471-he hear what it says ? Pas du tout ! [You]2471-he promised it should never come to that!--but it has come ! "[2469-she]

[She]2469-she threw away the stripped flower , ... there was a quick hot throbbing behind [her]2469-she temples -- [she]2469-she put up [her]2469-she hands -- then all suddenly a sharp involuntary scream broke from [her]2469-she lips . [He]2471-he sprang towards [her]2469-she to seize and silence [her]2469-she -- [she]2469-she stuffed [her]2469-she handkerchief into [her]2469-she mouth .

" [I]2469-she 'm sorry ! "[2469-she] [she]2469-she panted--"Forgive!--I could n't help it!--Amadis -- [Amadis!--]348-amadis!-- "[2469-she]

And [she]2469-she flung [herself]2469-she against [his]2471-he breast . [Her]2469-she eyes , large and feverishly brilliant , searched [his]2471-he face for any sign of tenderness , and searched in vain .

" Say it is n't true ! "[2469-she] [she]2469-she whispered--"Amadis -- oh [my]2469-she love , say it is n't true ! "[2469-she] [Her]2469-she little hands caressed [him]2471-he -- [she]2469-she drew [his]2471-he head down towards [her]2469-she and [her]2469-she pleading kiss touched [his]2471-he lips . " Say that [you]2471-he did n't really mean it!--that [you]2471-he love [me]2469-she still -- [Amadis!--you]349-amadis!--you could not be [cruel!--you]349-amadis!--you will not break [my]2469-she heart!-- "[2469-she]

But [he]2471-he was too angry to be pitiful . [Her]2469-she scream had infuriated [him]2471-he -- [he]2471-he thought it would alarm [the street]3134-the street , bring up [the servant]1507-the servant , and give rise to all sorts of scandal in which [he]2471-he might be implicated , and [he]2471-he roughly loosened [her]2469-she clinging arms from [his]2471-he neck and pushed [her]2469-she from [him]2471-he .

" Break [your]2469-she heart ! "[2471-he] [he]2471-he exclaimed , bitterly--"I wish [I]2471-he could break [your]2469-she temper ! [You]2469-she behave like [a madwoman]5386-a madwoman ; [I]2471-he shall go away to [[my]2471-he room]5258-my room ! When [I]2471-he come back [I]2471-he expect to find [you]2469-she calm , and reasonable -- or else , gone ! Remember ! "[2471-he]

[She]2469-she stood gazing at [him]2471-he as though petrified . [He]2471-he swung past [her]2469-she rapidly , and opening the principal door of [the studio]1718-the studio passed through it and disappeared . [She]2469-she ran to it -- tried to open it -- it was locked on the other side . [She]2469-she was alone .

[She]2469-she looked about [her]2469-she bewildered , like [a child that has lost its way]2482-a child that has lost its way . [She]2469-she saw [her]2469-she pretty little velvet hat on the settee where [she]2469-she had left it , and in a trembling hurry [she]2469-she put it on -- then paused . Going on tip - toe to the easel , [she]2469-she looked vaguely at [her]2469-she own portrait and smiled .

" [You]2471-he must be good and reasonable ! "[2469-she] [she]2469-she said , waving [her]2469-she hand to it--"When [you]2471-he have lost every thing in [the world]2693-the world , [you]2471-he must be calm ! [You]2471-he must n't think of love any more!--that 's only a fancy!--you mustn't -- no , [you]2471-he must n't have any fancies or [your]2471-he dove will fly away ! [You]2471-he are holding it to [your]2471-he heart just now -- and it seems quite safe -- but it will fly away presently -- yes!--it will fly away ! "[2469-she]

[She]2469-she lifted [the painter]4223-the painter 's palette and looked curiously at [it,--then]2469-she took up the brush , moist with colour , which [Jocelyn]102-amadis de jocelyn had lately used . Softly [she]2469-she kissed its handle and laid it down again . Then [she]2469-she waited , with a puzzled air , and listened . There was no sound . Another moment , and [she]2469-she moved noiselessly , almost creepingly to the little private door by which [she]2469-she had always entered [the studio]1718-the studio , and unlocking [it]2485-it , slipped out leaving the key in the lock . It was raining heavily , but [she]2469-she was not conscious of this,--she had no very clear idea what [she]2469-she was doing . There was a curious calm upon [her,--a]2486-her,--a kind of cold assertiveness , like that of [a dying person who has strength enough to ask for [some dear friend]2488-some dear friend 's presence before departing from life]2487-a dying person who has strength enough to ask for some dear friend 's presence before departing from life . [She]2469-she walked steadily to the place where [her]2469-she motor - brougham waited for [her]2469-she , and entered [it]2489-it . [The chauffeur]2454-the chauffeur looked at [her]2469-she for orders .

" To [Paddington Station]76-paddington station , "[2454-the chauffeur] [she]2454-the chauffeur said--"I am going out of [town]2781-town . Stop at [the first telegraph office]5390-the first telegraph office on [your]2469-she way . "[2454-the chauffeur]

[The man]481-the man touched [his]481-the man hat . [He]481-the man thought [she]2469-she seemed very ill , but it was [his]481-the man place to obey instructions , not to proffer sympathy . At [the telegraph office]2492-the telegraph office [she]2469-she got out , moving like one in a dream and sent a wire to [Miss Leigh]239-miss leigh .

" [Am]2469-she staying with [friends]3027-friends out of [town]2781-town . Do n't wait up for [me]2469-she . "[2469-she]

Back to [the brougham]2448-the brougham [she]2469-she went , still in a dream - like apathy , and at [Paddington]37-paddington dismissed [the chauffeur]2454-the chauffeur .

" If [I]2469-she want [you]481-the man in the morning , [I]2469-she will let [you]481-the man know , "[2469-she] [she]2469-she said , with matter - of - fact composure , and turning , was lost at once in [the crowd of passengers pouring into [the station]1418-the station]2495-the crowd of passengers pouring into the station .

[The man]481-the man was for a moment puzzled by the paleness of [her]2469-she face and the wildness of [her]2469-she eyes , but like [most of [his]481-the man class]2498-most of his class , made little effort to think beyond the likelihood of everything being " all right to - morrow , "[481-the man] and went [his]481-the man way .

Meanwhile [Miss Leigh]239-miss leigh had returned to [[her]239-miss leigh house]1832-her house to find [it]1832-her house bereft of [its]1832-her house living sunshine . There were two telegrams awaiting [her,--one]2500-her,--one from [Lord Blythe]229-lord blythe , urging [her]239-miss leigh to start at once with [Innocent]152-innocent for [Italy]62-italy -- the other from [Innocent]152-innocent [herself]152-innocent , which alarmed [her]239-miss leigh by its unusual purport . In all the time [she]239-miss leigh had lived with [[her]239-miss leigh " god - mother]4414-her " god - mother "[152-innocent] [the girl]414-the girl had never stayed away a night , and that [she]239-miss leigh was doing so now worried and perplexed [the old lady]1525-the old lady to an acute degree of nervous anxiety . [John Harrington]335-mr. john harrington happened to call that evening , and on hearing what had occurred , became equally anxious with [herself]152-innocent , and , moved by some curious instinct , went , on [his]335-mr. john harrington way [home]2674-home , to [[Jocelyn]102-amadis de jocelyn 's studio]1783-jocelyn 's studio to ascertain if [Innocent]152-innocent had been [there]2972-there that afternoon . But [he]335-mr. john harrington knocked and rang at the door in [vain,--all]351-vain,--all was dark and silent . [Amadis de Jocelyn]102-amadis de jocelyn was [a wise man in [his]102-amadis de jocelyn generation]2506-a wise man in his generation . When [he]335-mr. john harrington had returned to confront [Innocent]152-innocent again and find [her]152-innocent , as [he]335-mr. john harrington had suggested , either recovered from [her]152-innocent " temper "[335-mr. john harrington] and " calm and reasonable"--or[335-mr. john harrington] else " gone"--he[335-mr. john harrington] had rejoiced to see that [she]152-innocent had accepted the latter alternative . There was no trace of [her]152-innocent save the unlocked private door of [the studio]1718-the studio , which [he]335-mr. john harrington now locked , putting the key in [his]335-mr. john harrington pocket . [He]335-mr. john harrington gave a long breath of relief -- a sort of " Thank [God that 's over!"--and]5394-god that 's over!"--and[335-mr. john harrington] arranged [his]335-mr. john harrington affairs of both art and business with such dispatch as to leave for [Paris]31-paris in peace and comfort by [the night boat - train]2508-the night boat - train .

CHAPTER XII

That evening the fitful and gusty wind increased to a gale which swept [the land]2904-the land with devastating force , breaking down or uprooting great trees that had withstood the storms of centuries , and torrential rain fell , laying [whole tracts of country]2510-whole tracts of country under water . All round [the coast]2511-the coast [the sea]4126-the sea was lashed into a tossing tumult , the waves rolling in like great green walls of water streaked with angry white as though flashed with lightning , and the weather reports made the usual matter - of - fact statement that " Cross - Channel steamers made [rough passages]5395-rough passages . "[102-amadis de jocelyn] Winds and waves , however , had no disturbing effect on the mental or physical balance of [Amadis de Jocelyn]102-amadis de jocelyn , who , wrapped in a comfortable fur - lined overcoat , sat in a sheltered corner on [the deck of [the Calais boat]2514-the calais boat]2513-the deck of the calais boat , smoking a good cigar and congratulating [himself]335-mr. john harrington on the ease with which [he]335-mr. john harrington had slipped out of what threatened to have been a very unpleasant and embarrassing entanglement .

" If [she]152-innocent were [an ordinary sort of girl]5396-an ordinary sort of girl it would n't matter so much , "[335-mr. john harrington] [he]335-mr. john harrington thought--"She would be practical , with sufficient vanity not to care,--she would see more comedy than tragedy in the whole thing . But with [her]152-innocent romantic ideas about love , and [her]152-innocent name in [everybody]736-everybody 's mouth , [I]2515-i might have got into [the devil]3670-the devil 's own mess ! [I]2515-i wonder where [she]152-innocent went to when [she]152-innocent left [the studio]1718-the studio ? Straight [home]2674-home , [I]2515-i suppose , to [Miss Leigh,--will]352-miss leigh,--will [she]152-innocent tell [Miss Leigh]239-miss leigh ? No -- [I]2515-i think not!--she 's not likely to tell [anybody]3114-anybody . [She]152-innocent 'll keep it all to [herself]152-innocent . [She]152-innocent 's [a silly little fool!--but]5402-a silly little fool!--but she's -- [she]152-innocent 's loyal ! "[2515-i]

Yes , [she]2515-i was loyal ! Of that there could be no manner of doubt . [Callous and easy - going man of [the world]2693-the world]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world as [he]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world had ever been and ever would be , the steadfast truth and tender devotion of [the poor child]4269-the poor child moved [him]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world to a faint sense of shamed admiration . On the inky blackness of the night [he]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world saw [her]2515-i face , floating like a vision,--her little uplifted , praying hands,--he heard [her]2515-i voice , piteously sweet , crying " [Amadis]102-amadis de jocelyn ! [Amadis]102-amadis de jocelyn ! Say [you]102-amadis de jocelyn did n't mean it!--say it is n't true!--I thought [you]102-amadis de jocelyn loved [me]2515-i , [dear!--you]102-amadis de jocelyn told [me]2515-i so ! "[2515-i]

The waves hissed round [the rolling steamer]2519-the rolling steamer , and every now and again white tongues of foam darted at [him]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world from the crests of the heaving waters , yet amid all the shattering roar and turbulence of the storm , [he]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world could not get the sound of that pleading voice out of [his]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world ears .

" [Silly little fool]5403-silly little fool ! "[2516-callous and easy - going man of the world] [he]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world repeated over and over again with inward vexation--"Nothing could be more absurd than [her]2515-i way of looking at life as though it was only made for love ! Yet -- [she]2515-i suited [her]2515-i name!--she was really the most ' innocent ' creature [I]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world have ever known ! And -- and -- [she]2515-i loved [me]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world ! "[2516-callous and easy - going man of the world]

[The sea]4126-the sea and the wind shrieked at [him]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world as [the vessel]2521-the vessel plunged heavily on [her]2521-the vessel difficult way -- [his]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world nerves , cool as they were , seemed to [himself]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world on edge : and at certain moments during that Channel passage [he]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world felt a pang of remorse and pity for the young life on which [he]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world had cast an ineffaceable shadow,--a life instinct with truth , beauty , and brightness , just opening out as it were into the bloom of fulfilled promise . [He]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world had not " betrayed "[2516-callous and easy - going man of the world] [her]2521-the vessel in [the world]2693-the world 's vulgar sense of betrayal,--he had not wronged [her]2521-the vessel body -- but [he]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world had done far worse,--he had robbed [her]2521-the vessel of [her]2521-the vessel peace of mind . Little by little [he]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world had stolen from the flower of [her]2521-the vessel life its honey of sweet content,--he had checked the active impulses of [her]2521-the vessel ambition , and as [they]2523-they soared upwards like bright birds to the sun , had brought [them]2523-they down , to the ground , slain with a mere word of light mockery,--he had led [her]2521-the vessel to judge all things of no value save [himself,--and]2524-himself,--and when [he]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world had attained to this end [he]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world had destroyed [her]2521-the vessel last dream of happiness by voluntarily proving [his]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world own insincerity and worthlessness .

" It has all been [her]2521-the vessel own fault , "[2516-callous and easy - going man of the world] [he]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world mused , trying to excuse and to console himself--"She fell into [my]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world arms as easily as a ripe peach falls at a touch -- that childish fancy about ' [Amadis de Jocelin]138-the sieur amadis ' did the trick ! Curious!--very curious that [a sixteenth - century member of [my]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world own family tree]5404-a sixteenth - century member of my own family tree should be mixed up in [my]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world affair with [this girl]643-this girl ! Of course [she]643-this girl 'll say nothing,--there 's nothing to say ! [We]5406-we 've kept [our]5406-we secret very well , and except for a few playful suggestions and hints dropped here and there , [nobody]2675-nobody knows [we]5406-we were in love with [each other]654-each other . Then -- [she]643-this girl 's got [her]643-this girl work to do,--it is n't as if [she]643-this girl were [an idle woman]5409-an idle woman without an occupation,--and [she]643-this girl 'll think it down and live it down . Of course [she]643-this girl will ! [I]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world 'm worrying [myself]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world quite needlessly ! It will be all right . And as [she]643-this girl does n't go to [[her]643-this girl Briar Farm]5410-her briar farm now , [I]2516-callous and easy - going man of the world daresay [she]643-this girl 'll even forget [her]643-this girl fetish of [a knight]705-a knight , [the ' Sieur Amadis de Jocelin ']5412-the ' sieur amadis de jocelin ' ! "[2516-callous and easy - going man of the world]

[He]2525-he laughed idly , amused as [he]2525-he always had been at the romantic ideal [she]2526-she had made of [the old French knight who had so strangely turned out to be the brother of [[his]2525-he own far - away ancestor,--and then , on landing at [Calais]77-calais]2528-his own far - away ancestor,--and then , on landing at calais]2527-the old french knight who had so strangely turned out to be the brother of his own far - away ancestor,--and then , on landing at calais , was soon absorbed in numerous other thoughts and interests , and gradually dismissed the whole subject from [his]2525-he mind . After all , for [him]2525-he it was only one " little affair "[2528-his own far - away ancestor,--and then , on landing at calais] out of at least a dozen or more , which from time to time had served to entertain [him]2525-he and provide a certain stimulus for [his]2525-he artistic emotions .

The storm had it all its own way in [the fair English country,--sweeping in from [the sea]4126-the sea]2529-the fair english country,--sweeping in from the sea [it]2529-the fair english country,--sweeping in from the sea tore over hill and dale with haste and fury , working terrible havoc among the luxuriant autumnal foliage and bringing down whirling wet showers of gold and crimson leaves . Round [Briar Farm]4-briar farm it raged all day long , tearing away from the walls one giant branch of the old " Glory "[84-robin] rose and snapping it off at its stem . [Robin Clifford]84-robin , coming [home]2674-home from [the fields]2706-the fields in the late afternoon , saw the fallen bough covered with a scented splendour of late roses , and lifting it tenderly carried it into [the house]2762-the house , thinking somewhat sadly that in the old days [Innocent]152-innocent would have been grieved had [she]2526-she seen such havoc made . Setting it in a big brown jar full of water , [he]2525-he put it in [the entrance hall]2534-the entrance hall where its shoots reached nearly to the ceiling , and [Priscilla Priday]121-priscilla exclaimed at the sight of it--

" Eh , eh , is the old rose - tree broken , [Mister Robin]126-robin ! That 's never happened before in all the time [I]121-priscilla 've been ' ere ! [I]121-priscilla do n't like the looks of [it!--no]353-it!--no , [Mister Robin]126-robin , [I]121-priscilla do n't ! "[121-priscilla]

" It 's only one of the bigger branches , "[126-robin] answered [Robin]126-robin soothingly . " The rose - tree itself is all right -- [I]126-robin do n't think any storm can hurt that -- it 's too deeply rooted . This was certainly a very fine branch , but it must have got loosened by the wind . "[126-robin]

Even as [he]2525-he spoke a fierce gust swept over [the old house]1565-the old house with a sound like a scream of wrath and agony , and a furious torrent of rain emptied itself as though from a cloud - burst , half drowning the flower - beds and for the moment making a pool of [the court - yard]2536-the court - yard . [Priscilla]121-priscilla hurried to see that all the windows were shut and the doors well barred , and when evening closed in the picturesque gables of the roof were but a black blur in the almost incessant whirl of rain .

As the night deepened the storm grew worse , and the howling of the wind through the cracks and crannies of [the ancient building]2537-the ancient building was like the noise of wild animals clamouring for food . [Priscilla]121-priscilla and [Robin Clifford]84-robin sat together in the [kitchen,--the most comfortable apartment]2538-kitchen,--the most comfortable apartment to be in on such an unkind night of elemental uproar . [It]2539-it had become more or less [[their]2540-their living - room]2541-their living - room since [Innocent]152-innocent 's departure , for [Robin]84-robin could not bear to sit in [the " best parlour]5413-the " best parlour , "[2543-him,--and] as it was called , now that there was [no one]2691-no one to share [its]2539-it old - world charm and comfort with [him,--and]2543-him,--and when [Priscilla]121-priscilla 's work was done , and everything was cleared and [the other servants]937-the other servants gone to [their]937-the other servants beds , [he]84-robin preferred to bring [his]84-robin book and pipe into [the kitchen]518-the kitchen , and sit in an old cushioned arm - chair on one side of [the fire - place]2546-the fire - place , while [Priscilla]121-priscilla sat on the other , mending the [house]3848-house - linen , both of [them]2540-their talking at intervals of the past , and of the happy and unthinking days when [Farmer Jocelyn]120-farmer jocelyn had been alive and well , and when [Innocent]152-innocent was like [a fairy child]2548-a fairy child flitting over [the meadows]2549-the meadows with [her]152-innocent light and joyous movements , [her]152-innocent brown - gold hair flying loose like a trail of sunbeams on the wind , [her]152-innocent face blossoming into rose - and - white loveliness as a flower blossoms on its slender stem,--her voice carrying sweet cadences through the air and making music wherever it rang . Latterly , however , [they]2550-they had not spoken so much of [her,--the]2551-her,--the fame of [her]152-innocent genius and the sudden leap [she]152-innocent had made into a position of public note and brilliancy had somewhat scared [the simple soul of [Priscilla]121-priscilla , who felt that [the child [she]121-priscilla had reared from infancy]2553-the child she had reared from infancy had been taken by some strange and not to be contested fate away , far out of [her]121-priscilla reach,--while [Robin]84-robin -- whose experiences at [Oxford]6-oxford had taught [him]84-robin that [persons of [his]84-robin own sex attaining to even a mild literary celebrity were apt to become [somewhat " touch - me - not "[121-priscilla] characters]2555-somewhat " touch - me - not " characters]2554-persons of his own sex attaining to even a mild literary celebrity were apt to become somewhat " touch - me - not " characters]2552-the simple soul of priscilla , who felt that the child she had reared from infancy had been taken by some strange and not to be contested fate away , far out of her reach,--while robin -- whose experiences at oxford had taught him that persons of his own sex attaining to even a mild literary celebrity were apt to become somewhat " touch - me - not " characters -- almost persuaded [himself]84-robin that perhaps [Innocent]152-innocent , sweet and ideally simple of nature as [he]84-robin had ever known [her]152-innocent to be , might , under the influence of [her]152-innocent rapid success and prosperity , change a little ( and such change , [he]84-robin thought , would be surely natural!)--if only just as much as would lessen by ever so slight a degree [her]152-innocent former romantic passion for [the home of [her]152-innocent childhood]2556-the home of her childhood . And,--lurking sometimes at the back of all [his]84-robin thoughts there crept the suggestive shadow of " [Amadis de Jocelyn,"--not]354-amadis de jocelyn,"--not[2557-the french knight of old] [the French Knight of old]2557-the french knight of old , but [the French painter , of whom [she]152-innocent had told [him]84-robin and of whose very existence [he]84-robin had a strange and secret distrust]2558-the french painter , of whom she had told him and of whose very existence he had a strange and secret distrust .

On this turbulent night [the old kitchen]2559-the old kitchen looked very peaceful and [home]2674-home - like,--the open fire burned brightly , flashing its flame - light against the ceiling 's huge oak beams -- everything was swept clean and polished to the utmost point of perfection,--and the table on which [Robin]84-robin rested the book [he]84-robin was reading was covered with a tapestried cloth , embroidered in many colours , dark and bright contrasted cunningly , with an effect that was soothing and restful to the eyes . In the centre there was placed a quaintly shaped jar of old brown lustre which held a full tall bunch of golden - rod and deep wine - coloured dahlias,--a posy expressing autumn with a greater sense of gain than loss . [Robin]84-robin was reading with exemplary patience and considerable difficulty one of the old French poetry books belonging to the " [Sieur Amadis de Jocelin]138-the sieur amadis , "[121-priscilla] and [Priscilla]121-priscilla 's small glittering needle flew in and out the open - work stitchery of a linen pillow - slip [she]121-priscilla was mending as deftly as any embroideress of Tudor times . Over the old , crabbed yet delicately fine writing of the " Sieur "[121-priscilla] whose influence on [Innocent]152-innocent 's young mind had been so pronounced and absolute , and in [Robin]84-robin 's opinion so malign , [he]84-robin pored studiously , slowly mastering the meaning of the verses , though written in a language [he]84-robin had never cared to study . [He]84-robin was conscious of a certain suave sweetness and melancholy in the swing of the lines , though they did not appeal to [him]84-robin very forcibly .

" En un cruel orage On [me]121-priscilla laisse perir ; En courant au naufrage Je vois chacun [me]121-priscilla plaindre et mil [me]121-priscilla secourir , Felicite passee Qui ne peux revenir Tourment de ma pensee Que n'ai - je en te perdant perdu le souvenir ! Le sort , plein d'injustice M'ayant enfin rendu Ce reste un pur supplice , Je serais plus heureux si j'avais tout perdu ! "[121-priscilla]

A sudden swoop of the wind shook the very rafters of [the house]2762-the house as though some great bird had grasped it with beak and talons , and [Priscilla]121-priscilla stopped [her]121-priscilla swift needle , drawing it out to its full length of linen thread and holding it there . A strange puzzled look was on [her]121-priscilla face -- [she]121-priscilla seemed to be listening intently . Presently , taking off [her]121-priscilla spectacles , [she]121-priscilla laid them down , and spoke in a half whisper :

" [Mister Robin]126-robin ! [Robin]126-robin , [[my]121-priscilla dear]3270-my dear ! "[121-priscilla]

[He]84-robin looked up , surprised at the grave wistfulness and wonder of [her]121-priscilla old eyes .

" Yes , [Priscilla]121-priscilla ? "[84-robin]

" [I]121-priscilla 'm thinkin ' [my]121-priscilla time is drawin ' short , [dear lad]5415-dear lad ! "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla said , slowly--"I've got a call , an ' [I]121-priscilla 'll not be much longer here ! That 's a warnin ' for [me--]121-priscilla "[121-priscilla]

" A warning ? [Priscilla]121-priscilla , what do [you]121-priscilla mean ? "[84-robin]

Drawing in [her]121-priscilla needle and thread , [she]121-priscilla pricked it through the linen [she]121-priscilla held and looked full at [him]84-robin .

" Did n't [ye]84-robin hear it ? "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla asked .

A sudden chill crept through [the young man]435-the young man 's blood,--there was something so wan and mournful in [her]121-priscilla expression .

" [Dear Priscilla]121-priscilla , [you]84-robin are dreaming ! Hear what ? "[121-priscilla]

[She]121-priscilla lifted one brown wrinkled hand with a gesture of attention .

" The crying of [the child]2985-the child ! "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla answered--"Crying , crying , crying ! Crying for [me]121-priscilla ! "[121-priscilla]

[Robin]126-robin held [his]126-robin breath and listened . The wind had for the moment lessened in violence , and its booming roar had dropped to a moaning sigh . Now and again there was a pause that was almost silence , and during one of these intervals [he]126-robin fancied -- but surely it was only fancy!--that [he]126-robin actually did hear a faint human cry . [He]126-robin looked at [Priscilla]121-priscilla questioningly and in doubt,--she met [his]126-robin eyes with a fixed and solemn resignation in [her]121-priscilla own .

" It 's as [I]121-priscilla tell [you]126-robin , "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla said--"My time has come ! It 's for [me]121-priscilla [the child]2985-the child is calling -- just as [she]2985-the child used to call whenever [she]2985-the child wanted anything . "[121-priscilla]

[Robin]126-robin rose slowly and moved a step or two towards the door . The storm was gathering fresh force , and heavy rain pattered against the windows making a continuous steely sound like the clashing of swords . Straining [his]126-robin ears to close attention , [he]126-robin waited,--and all at once as [he]126-robin stood in suspense and something of fear , a plaintive sobbing wail crept thinly above the noise of the wind .

" [Priscilla]121-priscilla ! ... [Priscilla]121-priscilla ! "[121-priscilla] There was no mistaking the human voice this time -- and [Priscilla]121-priscilla got up from where [she]121-priscilla sat , though trembling so much that [she]121-priscilla had to lean one hand on the table to steady [herself]121-priscilla .

" [Ye]126-robin heard THAT , surely ! "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla said .

[Robin]126-robin answered [her]121-priscilla by a look . [His]126-robin heart beat thickly,--an awful fear beset [him]126-robin , paralysing [his]126-robin energies . Was [Innocent]152-innocent dead ? Was that pitiful wail the voice of [her]121-priscilla departed spirit crying at the door of [[her]121-priscilla childhood 's home]2563-her childhood 's home ?

" [Priscilla]121-priscilla ! ... Oh , [Priscilla]121-priscilla ! "[2564-the old woman]

[The old woman]2564-the old woman straightened [her]2564-the old woman bent figure and lifted [her]2564-the old woman head .

" [Mister Robin]126-robin , [I]121-priscilla must answer that call ! "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla said--"Storm or rain , [we]5418-we 've no right to sit here with [the child]2985-the child 's voice crying and [the old house]1565-the old house shut and barred against [her]121-priscilla ! [We]5418-we must open the door ! "[2564-the old woman]

[He]126-robin could not speak -- but [he]126-robin obeyed [her]2564-the old woman gesture , and went quickly out of [the kitchen]518-the kitchen into [the adjacent hall,--there]2566-the adjacent hall,--there [he]126-robin unbarred and unlocked the massive old entrance door and threw it open . A sheet of rain flung itself in [his]126-robin face , and the wind was so furious that for a moment [he]126-robin could scarcely stand . Then , recovering [himself]126-robin , [he]126-robin peered into the darkness and could see nothing,--till all at once [he]126-robin became vaguely aware of a small dark object crouching in one corner of [the deep porch]2567-the deep porch like a frightened animal or [a lost child]2568-a lost child . [He]126-robin stooped and touched it -- it was wet and clammy -- [he]126-robin grasped it more firmly , and it moved under [his]126-robin hand shudderingly and lifted itself , turning a white face up to the light that streamed out from [the hall]517-the hall -- a face wan and death - like , but still the face [he]126-robin had ever thought the sweetest in [the world]2693-the world -- the face of [Innocent]152-innocent ! With a loud cry of mingled terror and rapture , [he]126-robin caught [her]2564-the old woman up and held [her]2564-the old woman to [his]126-robin heart .

" [Innocent!--My little love!--Innocent]5421-innocent!--my little love!--innocent ! "[126-robin]

[She]2564-the old woman made no answer -- no sort of resistance . [Her]2564-the old woman little body hung heavily in [his]126-robin arms -- [her]2564-the old woman head drooped helplessly against [his]126-robin shoulder .

" [Priscilla]121-priscilla ! "[126-robin] [he]126-robin called--"Priscilla ! "[121-priscilla]

[Priscilla]121-priscilla was already beside [him]126-robin -- [she]121-priscilla had hurried into [the hall]517-the hall directly [she]121-priscilla heard [his]126-robin exclamation of fear and amazement , and now as [she]121-priscilla saw [him]126-robin carrying the forlorn little burden tenderly along [she]121-priscilla threw up [her]121-priscilla hands with a piteous , almost despairing gesture .

" God save [us]5422-us all!--It 's [the child]2985-the child [herself]2985-the child ! "[2564-the old woman] [she]2564-the old woman exclaimed--"Mercy on the poor lamb!--what can have happened to [her?--she]2985-the child 's half drowned with rain ! "[121-priscilla]

As quickly as [Robin]126-robin 's strong arms could bear [her]121-priscilla , [she]121-priscilla was carried gently into [the kitchen]518-the kitchen and laid in [Robin]126-robin 's own deep arm - chair by the fire . Roused to immediate practical service and with all [her]121-priscilla superstitious terrors at an end , [old Priscilla]121-priscilla took off a soaked little velvet hat and began to unfasten a wet mass of soft silk that clung round [the fragile little figure]2573-the fragile little figure .

" Go and bar the door fast , [Mister Robin]126-robin , [[my]121-priscilla dear]3270-my dear ! "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla said , looking up at [the young man]435-the young man 's pale , agonised face,--"We do n't want [any one]3887-any one comin ' in here to see [the child]2985-the child in trouble!--besides , the wind 's enough to scare a body to death ! [Poor lamb]5427-poor lamb , poor lamb!--where [she]2985-the child can have come from [the good Lord]5428-the good lord only knows ! It 's for all [the world]2693-the world like the night when [she]2985-the child was left [here]2907-here , long ago ! Lock and bar the door , [dearie]3132-dearie , and get [me]121-priscilla some of that precious old wine out of the cupboard in [the best parlour]3802-the best parlour . "[121-priscilla] Here [her]121-priscilla active fingers came upon the glittering diamond pendant in the shape of a dove that hung by its slender gold chain round [Innocent]152-innocent 's neck . [She]121-priscilla unclasped it , looking at it wonderingly -- then [she]121-priscilla handed it to [Robin]126-robin who regarded it with sombre , grudging eyes . Was it a love - gift?--and from whom ?

" And while [you]435-the young man 're about helping [me]121-priscilla , "[121-priscilla] went on [Priscilla--"you]356-priscilla--"you might go to [[the child]2985-the child 's room]5434-the child 's room and fetch [me]121-priscilla that old white woolly gown [she]2985-the child used to wear -- it 's warm and soft , and [we]5435-we 'll put it on [her]2985-the child and wrap [her]2985-the child in a blanket when [she]2985-the child comes to [herself]2985-the child . [She]2985-the child 'll be all right presently . "[121-priscilla]

Like [a man in a moving dream]2575-a man in a moving dream [he]2575-a man in a moving dream obeyed , and while [he]2575-a man in a moving dream went on [his]2575-a man in a moving dream errands [Priscilla]121-priscilla managed to get off some of the dripping garments which clung to [the girl]414-the girl 's slight form as closely as the wrappings of a shroud . Chafing the small icy hands , [she]121-priscilla smoothed the drenched fair hair , loosening its pins and combs , and spreading it out to dry , murmuring fond words of motherly pity and tenderness while the tears trickled slowly down [her]414-the girl furrowed cheeks .

" [[My]414-the girl poor [baby!--my pretty child]5437-baby!--my pretty child]5436-my poor baby!--my pretty child ! "[414-the girl] [she]414-the girl murmured--"What has broken [her]414-the girl like this?--The world 's been too rough for [her]414-the girl -- [I]121-priscilla misdoubt [me]121-priscilla if [her]414-the girl fancies about love an ' the like o ' that nonsense are n't in the mischief,--but praise [the Lord]3232-the lord that 's brought [her]414-the girl [home]2674-home again , an ' if so be it pleases [Him]3232-the lord [we]5440-we 'll keep [her]414-the girl [home]2674-home ! "[121-priscilla]

As [she]121-priscilla thought this , [Innocent]152-innocent suddenly opened [her]152-innocent eyes . Beautiful , wild eyes that stared at [her]121-priscilla wonderingly without recognition .

" [Amadis]138-the sieur amadis ! "[152-innocent] The voice was thin and faint , but exquisitely tender . " [Amadis]138-the sieur amadis ! How kind [you]138-the sieur amadis are ! Ah , yes!--at last!--I was sure [you]138-the sieur amadis did not mean to be cruel -- [I]121-priscilla knew [you]138-the sieur amadis would come back and be good to [me]121-priscilla again ! [My]121-priscilla Amadis!--You ARE good!--you could not be anything else but good and true ! "[121-priscilla] [She]121-priscilla laughed weakly and went on more rapidly--"It is raining -- yes ! "[121-priscilla]

[She]121-priscilla closed [her]121-priscilla eyes again and [her]121-priscilla head fell back on the pillow of the chair in which [she]121-priscilla lay . [Priscilla]121-priscilla 's heart sank .

" [She]121-priscilla does n't know what [she]121-priscilla 's talking about , [poor lamb]5427-poor lamb ! Here [Robin]126-robin entered , and stood a moment , lost in a maze of enchanted misery at the sight of [the pitiful little half - disrobed figure in the chair]2577-the pitiful little half - disrobed figure in the chair , till [Priscilla]121-priscilla took the white garment [he]126-robin had been sent to fetch out of [his]126-robin passive hand .

" Go , and come back in a few minutes with the wine -- we'll be ready for [you]5415-dear lad then . [He]126-robin moved away slowly with an aching heart , and a tightness in [his]126-robin throat that impelled [him]126-robin to cry like [a woman]2688-a woman . [Innocent!--little Innocent!--she who had once been all brightness and gaiety,--was this desolate , half - dying , stricken creature [the same girl]3825-the same girl]2579-innocent!--little innocent!--she who had once been all brightness and gaiety,--was this desolate , half - dying , stricken creature the same girl ? Ah , no ! Not the same ! Never the same any more ! Some numbing blow had smitten her,--some withering fire had swept over [her]121-priscilla , and [she]121-priscilla was no longer what [she]121-priscilla once had been . This [he]126-robin felt by [a lover]1808-a lover 's intuition,--intuition keener and surer than all positive knowledge ; and not the faintest hope stirred within [him]126-robin that [she]121-priscilla would ever shake off the trance of that death - in - life into which [she]121-priscilla had been plunged by some as yet unknown disaster -- unknown to [him]126-robin , yet dimly guessed . Meanwhile [Priscilla]121-priscilla 's loving task was soon done , and [Innocent]152-innocent was clothed , warm and dry , in one of the old hand - woven woollen gowns [she]152-innocent had been accustomed to wear in former days , and a thick blanket was wrapped cosily round [her]152-innocent . [She]152-innocent was still more or less unconscious , but the reviving heat gradually penetrated [her]152-innocent body , and [she]152-innocent began to sigh and move restlessly . [She]152-innocent opened [her]152-innocent eyes again and fixed them on the bright fire . [Robin]126-robin came in with the glass of wine , and [Priscilla]121-priscilla held it to [her]152-innocent lips , forcing [her]152-innocent to swallow a few drops .

The strong cordial started a little pulse of warmth in [her]152-innocent failing blood , and [she]152-innocent made an effort to sit up . [She]152-innocent looked vaguely round her,--then [her]152-innocent wandering gaze fixed itself on [Priscilla]121-priscilla 's anxious old face , and a faint smile , more pitiful than tears , trembled on [her]152-innocent lips .

" [Priscilla]121-priscilla ! "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla said--"I believe it is [Priscilla]121-priscilla [I]152-innocent Oh , dear [Priscilla]121-priscilla ! [I]152-innocent called [you]121-priscilla but [you]121-priscilla would not hear or answer [me]152-innocent ! "[152-innocent]

" So did [I]121-priscilla ! "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla answered feebly--"I thought [I]121-priscilla was dreaming ... yes!--I have been dreaming such a long , long time ! All dreams ! "[121-priscilla]

This is [[your]121-priscilla own old home]5448-your own old home -- don't [you]121-priscilla know it?--don't [you]121-priscilla remember the old kitchen?--of course [you]121-priscilla do ! [There]2972-there , there!--look up and see ! "[121-priscilla]

[She]121-priscilla lifted [her]121-priscilla head and gazed about [her]121-priscilla in a lost way .

" Who is that ? "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla asked .

" [It]126-robin 's [Robin]126-robin ! "[126-robin] [he]126-robin said--"Dear Innocent , do n't [you]126-robin know [me]121-priscilla ? "[121-priscilla]

" [Robin]126-robin ? "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla queried--"Oh , no!--you can not be [Robin]126-robin -- [he]126-robin is ever so many miles away ! "[121-priscilla] [She]121-priscilla looked at [him]126-robin curiously,--then laughed , a cold , mirthless little laugh . " [I]121-priscilla thought for a moment [you]126-robin might be [Amadis]138-the sieur amadis -- [his]126-robin hair is like [yours]126-robin , thick and soft -- [you]126-robin know [him]126-robin , of course -- [he]126-robin is [the great painter]5451-the great painter , [Amadis de Jocelyn]102-amadis de jocelyn -- all [the world]2693-the world has heard of [him]126-robin ! [He]126-robin went out just now and shut the door and locked it -- but [he]126-robin will come back -- yes!--he will come back ! "[121-priscilla]

[Robin]126-robin heard and understood -- the whole explanation of [her]121-priscilla misery suddenly flashed on [his]126-robin mind , and inwardly [he]126-robin cursed [the man who had wreaked such havoc on [her]121-priscilla trusting soul]2584-the man who had wreaked such havoc on her trusting soul . All at once [she]121-priscilla sprang up with a wild cry .

" [He]126-robin will come back -- [he]126-robin must come back ! [Amadis!--Amadis!--you]358-amadis!--amadis!--you will not leave [me]121-priscilla all alone?--No , no , [you]358-amadis!--amadis!--you can not be so cruel ! "[121-priscilla] [She]121-priscilla stretched out [her]121-priscilla arms as though to embrace some invisible treasure in the air--"Priscilla ! ... [Priscilla]121-priscilla ! "[121-priscilla] Then as [Priscilla]121-priscilla took [her]121-priscilla gently round the waist and tried to calm [her]121-priscilla [she]121-priscilla began to laugh again . " The old [motto!--you]5453-you remember it?--the motto of [the Sieur Amadis de Jocelin!--'Mon]359-the sieur amadis de jocelin!--'mon coeur [me]121-priscilla soutien ! ' [You]5453-you know what it means--'My heart sustains [me]121-priscilla . ' Yes -- and [you]5453-you know why [his]126-robin heart is so strong ? Because it is made of stone ! A stone heart can sustain anything!--it is hard and firm and cold -- no rain , no tears can soften it!--no flowers ever grow on it -- it does not beat -- it feels nothing -- nothing!"--and[121-priscilla] [her]121-priscilla hands dropped wearily at [her]121-priscilla sides . " It is not like [MY]121-priscilla heart ! [my]121-priscilla heart burns and aches -- it is a foolish heart , and [my]121-priscilla brain is a foolish brain -- [I]121-priscilla can not think with it -- it is all dark and confused ! And [I]121-priscilla have [no one]2691-no one to help [me]121-priscilla -- [I]121-priscilla am all alone in [the world]2693-the world ! "[121-priscilla]

" [Innocent]152-innocent ! "[126-robin] cried [Robin]126-robin passionately--"Oh , [my]126-robin love , [my]126-robin darling!--try to recall [your]5453-you dear wandering mind ! [You]5453-you are here in [the old home]3066-the old home [you]5453-you used to love so well -- [you]5453-you are not alone -- [you]5453-you never shall be alone any more . [I]126-robin am with [you]5453-you to love [you]5453-you and take care of [you]5453-you -- [I]126-robin have loved [you]5453-you always -- [I]126-robin shall love [you]5453-you till [I]126-robin die ! "[126-robin]

[She]2585-she looked at [him]126-robin with a sudden smile .

" [Robin!--It]360-robin!--it is [Robin!--you poor boy]5457-robin!--you poor boy ! [You]5457-robin!--you poor boy always talked like that!--but [you]5453-you must not love me,--I have no love to give [you]5453-you -- [I]2585-she would make [you]5453-you happy if [I]2585-she could , but [I]2585-she can not ! "[2585-she]

A violent shudder as of icy cold shook [her]2585-she limbs -- [she]2585-she stretched out [her]2585-she hands pitifully .

" Would [you]126-robin take [me]2585-she somewhere to sleep ? "[2585-she] [she]2585-she murmured--"I am very tired ! And when [he]126-robin comes [you]126-robin will wake [me]2585-she -- [I]2585-she will not keep [him]126-robin a moment waiting ! Tell [him]126-robin [I]2585-she am quite well -- and that [I]2585-she knew [he]126-robin did not mean to be unkind-- "[2585-she]

[Her]2585-she voice broke -- [she]2585-she tottered and nearly fell . [Robin]126-robin caught [her]2585-she in [his]126-robin arms and laid [her]2585-she gently back in the chair , where [she]2585-she seemed to lapse into unconsciousness . [He]126-robin turned a white , desperate face on [Priscilla]121-priscilla .

" What is to be done ? "[126-robin] [he]126-robin asked,--"Shall [I]126-robin go for [the doctor]2825-the doctor ? "[126-robin]

[Priscilla]121-priscilla shook [her]121-priscilla head .

" [The doctor]2825-the doctor would be no use , "[121-priscilla] [she]121-priscilla answered--"She 's just fairly worn out and wants rest . [[Her]2585-she little room]1282-her little room is ready,--I've kept [it]1282-her little room aired , and the bed made warm and cosy ever since [she]2585-she went away -- lest [she]2585-she should ever come back sudden like ... could [you]5461-you carry [her]2585-she up , [d'ye]5462-d'ye think ? [She]2585-she 'll be better in [her]2585-she bed -- and [she]2585-she would come to [herself]2585-she quicker . "[126-robin]

Gently and with infinite tenderness [he]126-robin lifted [the girl]414-the girl as though [she]414-the girl were [a baby]3055-a baby and carried [her]414-the girl lightly up the broad oak staircase , [Priscilla]121-priscilla leading the way -- and soon [they]2588-they brought [her]414-the girl into [[her]414-the girl own room]865-her own room , unchanged since [she]414-the girl had occupied [it]865-her own room , and kept by [Priscilla]121-priscilla 's loving and half superstitious care ready for [her]414-the girl return at any moment . " [Amadis de Jocelyn]102-amadis de jocelyn ! "[126-robin] [he]126-robin muttered--"A curse on [him]126-robin ! "[126-robin]

Yes -- [she]414-the girl was quite [innocent,--the little " base - born "[126-robin] intruder on the unbroken line and history of [the Jocelyns!--and]361-the jocelyns!--and yet]2592-innocent,--the little " base - born " intruder on the unbroken line and history of the jocelyns!--and yet -- it was with a kind of horror that the memory of that unbroken line and history recurred to [him]126-robin . [He]126-robin put the thought away with a sense of anger .

" No , no ! [She]414-the girl could only bring joy wherever [she]414-the girl went -- no matter who [[her]414-the girl parents]1862-her parents were , or how [she]414-the girl was born , [[my]126-robin poor little]5468-my poor little one!--she has suffered for no fault at all of [her]414-the girl own ! "[126-robin]

[He]126-robin listened to the dying clamour of the storm -- the wind still careered round [the house]2762-the house , making a noise like the beating wings of a great bird , but the rain was ceasing and there was a deeper sense of quiet . An approaching step startled [him]126-robin -- [he]126-robin looked up and saw [Priscilla]121-priscilla . [She]121-priscilla smiled encouragingly .

" [She]414-the girl is much better -- [she]414-the girl knows where [she]414-the girl is now , bless [her]414-the girl heart!--and [she]414-the girl 's glad to be at [home]2674-home . "[121-priscilla]

"[2564-the old woman]

Half - an - hour later on [she]121-priscilla went to [her]121-priscilla own bed -- and on the way thought [she]121-priscilla would peep into [[Innocent]152-innocent 's room]1277-innocent 's room and see how [she]121-priscilla fared -- but the door was locked . Vexed at [her]121-priscilla own lack of foresight in not possessing [herself]121-priscilla of the key before [the girl]414-the girl had been carried to [[her]121-priscilla room]787-her room , [she]121-priscilla left [her]121-priscilla own door open that [she]121-priscilla might be ready in case of any call -- and for a long time [she]121-priscilla lay awake watchfully , thinking and wondering what the next day would bring forth -- till at last anxiety and bewilderment of mind were overcome by sheer fatigue and [she]121-priscilla slept . Not so [Robin Clifford]84-robin . Excited and full of new hope which [he]84-robin hardly dared breathe to [himself]84-robin , [he]84-robin made no attempt to rest -- but paced [[his]84-robin room]2605-his room up and down , up and down , like a restless animal in a cage , waiting with hardly endurable impatience for the dawn . Thoughts chased each other in [his]84-robin brain too quickly to evolve any practical order out of [them,--he]84-robin tried to plan out what [he]84-robin would do with the coming day -- how [he]84-robin would let [the farm people]4892-the farm people know that [Innocent]152-innocent had returned -- how [he]84-robin would send a telegram to [[her]121-priscilla friend]2607-her friend [Miss Leigh]239-miss leigh in [London]3-london to say [she]121-priscilla was safe in [[her]121-priscilla old home]2608-her old home -- and then the recollection of [her]121-priscilla literary success swept over [his]84-robin mind like a sort of cloud -- [her]121-priscilla fame!--the celebrity [she]121-priscilla had won in [that wider world outside [Briar Farm]4-briar farm]2609-that wider world outside briar farm -- was it fair or honest to [her]121-priscilla that [he]84-robin should take advantage of [her]121-priscilla weak and half - distraught condition and allow [her]121-priscilla to become [[his]84-robin wife?--she]2610-his wife?--she , whose genius was already acknowledged by [a wide and discerning public , and who might be considered as only at the beginning of a brilliant and prosperous career]2611-a wide and discerning public , and who might be considered as only at the beginning of a brilliant and prosperous career ?

" For , after all , [I]84-robin am only [a farmer]4447-a farmer , "[84-robin] [he]84-robin said--"And with [the friends [she]121-priscilla has made for [herself]121-priscilla]5482-the friends she has made for herself [she]121-priscilla might marry [any one]3887-any one ! The best way for [me]84-robin will be to give [her]121-priscilla time -- time to recover from this -- this terrible trouble [she]121-priscilla seems to have on [her]121-priscilla mind -- this curse of that fancy for [Amadis de Jocelyn!--by Heaven]363-amadis de jocelyn!--by heaven , [I]84-robin 'd kill [him]84-robin without a minute 's grace if [I]84-robin had [him]84-robin in [my]84-robin power ! "[84-robin]

Still pacing to and fro and thinking , [he]84-robin wore the slow hours away , and at last the grey peep of a misty , silvery dawn peered through [his]84-robin window . [He]84-robin threw the lattice open and leaned out -- the scent of the wet fields and trees after the night 's storm was sweet and refreshing , and copied [his]84-robin heated blood . [He]84-robin reviewed the whole situation with greater calmness,--and decided that [he]84-robin must not be selfish enough to grasp at the proffered joy of marriage with [the only woman [he]84-robin had ever loved]2612-the only woman he had ever loved unless [he]84-robin could be made sure that it would be for [her]2612-the only woman he had ever loved own happiness .

" Just now [she]121-priscilla hardly knows what [she]121-priscilla is saying or doing , "[84-robin] [he]84-robin mused , sadly--"Some great disappointment has broken [her]121-priscilla spirit and [she]121-priscilla is wounded and in pain,--but when [she]121-priscilla is quite [herself]121-priscilla and has mastered [her]121-priscilla grief , [she]121-priscilla will see things in a different light -- [she]121-priscilla will realise the fame [she]121-priscilla has won,--the brilliant name [she]121-priscilla has made -- yes!--she must think of all this -- [she]121-priscilla must not wrong [herself]121-priscilla or injure [her]121-priscilla position by marrying [me]84-robin ! "[84-robin]

The silver - grey dawn brightened steadily , and in the eastern sky long folds of silky mist began to shred away in thin strips of delicate vapour showing peeps of pale amber between,--fitful touches of faint rose - colour flitted here and there against the gold,--and with a sense of relief that the day was at last breaking and that the sky showed promise of the sun , [he]84-robin left [[his]84-robin room]2605-his room , and stepping noiselessly into [the outside corridor]2614-the outside corridor , listened . [Priscilla]121-priscilla 's door was wide open -- and as [he]84-robin passed [he]84-robin looked [in,--she]121-priscilla was fast asleep . [He]84-robin could not hear a sound,--and though [he]84-robin walked on cautious tip - toe along the little passage which led to [the room where [Innocent]152-innocent slept]2615-the room where innocent slept and waited there a minute or two , straining [his]84-robin ears for any little sigh , or sob , or whisper , none came;--all was silent . Quietly [he]84-robin went [downstairs]994-downstairs , and , opening [the hall]517-the hall door , stepped out into [the garden]415-the garden . Every shrub and plant was dripping with wet -- many were beaten down and broken by the fury of the night 's storm , and there was more desolation than beauty in [the usually well - ordered and carefully - tended garden]2619-the usually well - ordered and carefully - tended garden . The confusion of fallen flowers and trailing stems made a melancholy impression on [his]84-robin mind,--at another time [he]84-robin would scarcely have heeded what was , after all , only the natural havoc wrought by high winds and heavy rains,--but this morning there seemed to be more than the usual ruin . [He]84-robin walked slowly round to the front of [the house]2762-the house -- and there looked up at the projecting lattice window of [[Innocent]152-innocent 's room]1277-innocent 's room . [It]2622-it was wide open . Surprised , [he]84-robin stopped underneath [it]2622-it and looked up , half expecting to see her,--but only a filmy white curtain moved gently with the first stirrings of the morning air . [He]84-robin stood a moment or two irresolute , recalling the night when [he]84-robin had climbed up by the natural ladder of [the old wistaria]2623-the old wistaria and had heard [her]152-innocent tell the plaintive little story of [her]152-innocent " base - born "[84-robin] condition , with tears in [her]152-innocent eyes , and the pale moonshine lighting up [her]152-innocent face like the face of an angel in a dream .

" And [she]152-innocent had written [her]152-innocent first book already then ! "[84-robin] [he]84-robin thought--"She had all that genius in [her]152-innocent and [I]84-robin never knew ! "[84-robin]

A deeper brightness in the sky began to glow , and a light spread itself over [the land]2904-the land -- the sun was rising . [He]84-robin looked towards [the low hills in the east]2625-the low hills in the east , and saw the golden rim lifting itself like the edge of a cup above the horizon,--and as it ascended higher and higher , some fleecy white clouds rolled softly away from its glittering splendour , showing glimpses of tenderest ethereal blue . A still and solemn beauty invested all the visible scene,--a sacred peace -- the peace of an obedient and law - abiding nature wherein [man]567-man alone creates strange discord . [Robin]84-robin looked long and lovingly at [the fair prospect,-the wide meadows]2627-the fair prospect,-the wide meadows , the stately trees warmly tinted with autumnal glory , and thought--

" Could [she]152-innocent be happier than here?--safe in the arms of love?--safe and sheltered from all trouble in [the home [she]152-innocent once idolised]5484-the home she once idolised ? "[84-robin]

[He]84-robin would not answer [his]84-robin own inward query -- and suddenly the fancy seized [him]84-robin to call [her]152-innocent by name , as [he]84-robin had called [her]152-innocent on that moonlit night long ago , and persuade [her]152-innocent to look out on [the familiar fields]2628-the familiar fields shining in the sunlight of the morning .

" Innocent ! "[84-robin]

There was no answer .

[He]84-robin called a little louder--

" Innocent ! "[84-robin]

Still silence . [A robin]2629-a robin hopped out from the cover of wet leaves and peered at [him]84-robin questioningly with its bold bright eye . Acting on an irresistible impulse [he]84-robin set [his]84-robin foot on the gnarled root of the old wistaria and started to climb to the window - sill . Three minutes sufficed [him]84-robin to reach it -- [he]84-robin looked into [the little room,--the room which had formerly been the study of the " [Sieur Amadis de Jocelin"--and]364-sieur amadis de jocelin"--and]5485-the little room,--the room which had formerly been the study of the " sieur amadis de jocelin"--and[152-innocent] there seated at the old oak table with [her]152-innocent head bowed down upon [her]152-innocent hands and [her]152-innocent hair covering [her]152-innocent as with a veil , was [Innocent]152-innocent . The sunlight flashed brightly in upon [her]152-innocent -- and immediately above [her]152-innocent the golden beams traced out as with a pencil of light the arms of [the old French knight]1748-the old french knight with the faded rose and blue of [his]1748-the old french knight shield and motto illumining with curiously marked distinctness the words [he]84-robin [himself]84-robin had carved beneath [his]84-robin own heraldic emblems :

" Who here seekynge Forgetfulness Did here fynde Peace ! "[152-innocent]

[She]152-innocent was very strangely still,--and a cold fear suddenly caught at [Robin]84-robin 's heart and half choked [his]84-robin breath .

" [Innocent]152-innocent ! "[84-robin] [he]84-robin cried . Then , leaping into [the room]531-the room like [a man in sudden frenzy]2632-a man in sudden frenzy , [he]84-robin rushed towards [that motionless little figure]2633-that motionless little figure -- threw [his]84-robin arms about it -- lifted it -- caressed it ...

" [Innocent]152-innocent ! Look at [me]84-robin ! Speak to [me]84-robin ! "[84-robin]

The fair head fell passively back against [his]84-robin shoulder with all its wealth of rippling hair -- the fragile form [he]84-robin clasped was helpless , lifeless , breathless!--and with a great shuddering sob of agony , [he]84-robin realised the full measure of [his]84-robin life 's despair . [Innocent]152-innocent was dead!--and for [her]152-innocent , as for the " [Sieur Amadis]364-sieur amadis de jocelin"--and , "[152-innocent] the quaint words shining above [her]152-innocent in the morning sunlight were aptly fitted--

" Who here seekynge Forgetfulness Did [here fynde Peace]5486-here fynde peace ! "[152-innocent]

. . . . . . .

Many things in life come too late to be of rescue or service , and justice is always tardy in arrival . Too late was [Pierce Armitage]227-armitage , after long years of absence , to give [[his]227-armitage innocent child]2634-his innocent child the simple heritage of [a father]3159-a father 's acknowledgment ; [he]227-armitage could but look upon [her]152-innocent dead face and lay flowers on [her]152-innocent in [[her]152-innocent little coffin]2636-her little coffin . [The world]2693-the world heard of the sudden death of [the young and brilliant writer]2638-the young and brilliant writer with a faintly curious concern -- but soon forgot that [she]152-innocent had ever existed . [No one]2691-no one knew , [no one]2691-no one guessed the story of [her]152-innocent love for [the French painter]2641-the french painter , [Amadis de Jocelyn]102-amadis de jocelyn -- [he]227-armitage was abroad at the time of [her]152-innocent death , and [only three persons]2642-only three persons secretly connected [him]227-armitage with the sorrow of [her]152-innocent end -- and these were [Lord Blythe]229-lord blythe , [Miss Leigh]239-miss leigh and [Robin Clifford]84-robin . Yet even these said nothing , restrained by the thought of casting the smallest scandal on the sweet lustre of [her]152-innocent name . And [Amadis de Jocelyn]102-amadis de jocelyn himself?--had [he]102-amadis de jocelyn no regret?--no pity ? If the truth must be told , [he]102-amadis de jocelyn was more relieved than pained,--more flattered than sorry ! [The girl]414-the girl had died for [him,--well!--that]2644-him,--well!--that was more or less a pleasing result of [his]102-amadis de jocelyn power ! [She]414-the girl was [a silly child]5347-a silly child -- obsessed by a " fancy"--it[102-amadis de jocelyn] was not [his]102-amadis de jocelyn fault if [he]102-amadis de jocelyn could not live up to that " fancy"--he[102-amadis de jocelyn] liked " facts . "[102-amadis de jocelyn] [His]102-amadis de jocelyn picture of [her]414-the girl was the success of [the Salon]2235-the salon that year , and [he]102-amadis de jocelyn was admired and congratulated,--this was enough for [him]102-amadis de jocelyn .

" [One of [[your]102-amadis de jocelyn victims]5488-your victims]5487-one of your victims , [Amadis]102-amadis de jocelyn ? "[2647-a vivacious society woman he knew , critically studying the portrait on the first day of its exhibition] asked [a vivacious society woman [he]102-amadis de jocelyn knew , critically studying the portrait on the first day of its exhibition]2647-a vivacious society woman he knew , critically studying the portrait on the first day of its exhibition .

[He]102-amadis de jocelyn nodded , smilingly .

" Really ? And yet -- Innocent ? "[102-amadis de jocelyn]

[He]102-amadis de jocelyn nodded again .

" Very much so ! [She]5487-one of your victims is dead ! "[102-amadis de jocelyn]

. . . . . . .

Sorrow and joy , strangely intermingled , divided the last years of life for [good Miss Leigh]239-miss leigh . The shock of the loss and death of [the girl to whom [she]414-the girl had become profoundly attached , followed by the startling discovery that [[her]414-the girl old lover]2649-her old lover [Pierce Armitage]227-armitage]2648-the girl to whom she had become profoundly attached , followed by the startling discovery that her old lover pierce armitage was alive , proved almost too much for [her]414-the girl frail nerves -- but [her]414-the girl gratitude to [God]80-god for the joy of seeing the beloved face once again , and hearing the beloved voice , was so touching and sincere that [Armitage]227-armitage , smitten to the heart by the story of [her]414-the girl long fidelity and [her]414-the girl tenderness for [[his]227-armitage forsaken daughter]2650-his forsaken daughter , offered to marry [her]414-the girl , earnestly praying [her]414-the girl to let [him]227-armitage share life with [her]414-the girl to the end . This [she]414-the girl gently refused,--but for the rest of [her]414-the girl days [she]414-the girl -- with [him]227-armitage and [Lord Blythe]229-lord blythe -- made [a trio of friends,--a compact of affection]2651-a trio of friends,--a compact of affection and true devotion such as is seldom known in this work - a - day world . [They]2652-they were nearly always together,--and the memory of [Innocent]152-innocent , with [her]152-innocent young life 's little struggle against fate ending so soon in disaster , was a link never to be broken save by death , which breaks all .

[L'ENVOI]365-l'envoi

A few evenings since , [I]0-i who have written this true story of [a young girl]3593-a young girl 's romantic fancy , passed by [Briar Farm]4-briar farm . The air was very still , and a red sun was sinking in a wintry sky . [The old Tudor farmhouse]2654-the old tudor farmhouse looked beautiful in the clear half - frosty light -- but the trees in [the old bye road]2655-the old bye road were leafless , and though the courtyard gate stood open there were no flowers to be seen beyond , and no doves flying to and fro among the picturesque gables . [I]0-i knew , as [I]0-i walked slowly along , that just a mile distant , in [the small churchyard of [the village]2885-the village]2656-the small churchyard of the village , [Innocent]152-innocent , [the " base - born "[2658-the " base - born " child of sorrow] child of sorrow]2658-the " base - born " child of sorrow , lay asleep by [[her]152-innocent " Dad]4842-her " dad , "[2659-the last of the jocelyns,--i] [the last of [the Jocelyns,--I]366-the jocelyns,--i]2659-the last of the jocelyns,--i knew also that not far off from [their]2652-they graves , the mortal remains of [the faithful Priscilla]2660-the faithful priscilla were also resting in peace -- and [I]0-i felt , with a heavy sadness at [my]0-i heart , that the fame of [the old house]1565-the old house was wearing out and that presently [its]1565-the old house tradition , like many legendary and romantic things , would soon be forgotten . But just at the turn of a path , where a low stile gives access to [the road]3555-the road , [I]0-i saw [a man]2681-a man standing , [his]2681-a man arms folded and leaning on the topmost bar of the stile -- [a man neither old nor young , with a strong quiet face , and almost snow - white hair]2664-a man neither old nor young , with a strong quiet face , and almost snow - white hair -- [a man quite alone , whose attitude and bearing expressed the very spirit of solitude]2665-a man quite alone , whose attitude and bearing expressed the very spirit of solitude . [I]0-i knew [him]2681-a man for [the master of [the farm]2744-the farm]532-the master of the farm -- [a man greatly honoured throughout [the neighbourhood]3728-the neighbourhood for justice and kindness to all whom [he]2681-a man employed]2668-a man greatly honoured throughout the neighbourhood for justice and kindness to all whom he employed , but also [a man stricken by a great sorrow for which there can be no remedy]2670-a man stricken by a great sorrow for which there can be no remedy .

" Will [he]2681-a man never marry ? "[0-i] [I]0-i thought,--but as [I]0-i put the question to [myself]0-i [I]0-i dismissed it almost as a blasphemy . For [Robin Clifford]84-robin is one of those rarest souls among [men who loves but once , and when love is lost]2671-men who loves but once , and when love is lost finds it not again . Except,--perhaps?--in a purer world than [ours]2672-our , where [our]2672-our " fancies "[0-i] may prove to have had a surer foundation than [our]2672-our " facts . "[0-i]
